title: Junior Product Manager
description: About the job We build digital tools to simplify healthcare. Tuotempo is the CRM used by some of the biggest clinics in Europe and Latin America. We help hospitals, doctors, and operators focus on what matters most: taking care of patients. Our product is cloud-based, modular, and designed to make every step of the patient journey simpler — from booking to post-visit follow-up. Curious to learn more? Check out our website: https://www.tuotempo.com 👀 🏠 We're a remote-first company: you can work 100% remotely from Italy or Spain, or visit us in Bologna or Barcelona — your choice! Job Description Join us as a Junior Product Manager and help shape the future of our CRM platform. You’ll work closely with your manager, project managers, and developers, turning real customer needs into innovative, high-impact solutions that make a difference. Here's What Your Day-to-day Will Look Like Analyze customers and users needs, gather feedback, write documentation Conceptualize, design, and refine product features by writing clear specifications that guide developers as they build and improve them. Partner closely with our engineers to assess feasibility and validate solutions scalability. Dive into logs and usage data to track down bugs and pinpoint their root causes. Help internal teams understand how the product works (Sales, Support, PMs) Maintain and update internal documentation What’s in it for you? A dedicated mentor: you’ll partner one-on-one with our CRM Product Lead, gaining hands-on coaching and feedback every step of the way. End-to-end exposure: from discovery interviews to launch day, you’ll touch every phase of the product life-cycle and see how great products are built. Real responsibility (with a safety net): we’ll guide the key decisions, but you’ll own meaningful workstreams and ship features that matter. Growth: bring your curiosity and drive, and we’ll give you the space, tools and support to level up. If you’re a proactive self-starter who’s ready to learn, eager to take ownership and excited to make an impact, we can’t wait to meet you. Qualifications What we’re looking for (must have): Bachelor’s degree in Design, Computer Science, or similar 1+ year in Product Management or 3+ years in Product design or Software development (we welcome people making a career change) Hands-on experience working with digital products, especially cloud-based software Solid understanding of the full product development lifecycle Strong English (B2+), plus Italian or Spanish Bonus Points (nice To Have) Experience in the Healthtech or Insurtech industry Familiarity with AI tools or workflows (e.g. automation, analysis, productivity) Additional Information ✨ What we offer: We value a healthy work-life balance and long-term growth. Benefits vary by location, but here’s what you can expect: Shared Benefits 🏡 100% remote work, with the option to join our offices in Bologna or Barcelona 📈 Stock options plan after 6 months 🎂 One extra day off for your birthday 🌱 Access to iFeel – our mental wellbeing platform Italy-specific 🍽️ €8/day meal vouchers – lunch is covered if you're in the Bologna office 🩺 Private health coverage via Metasalute Spain-specific ❤️ Comprehensive private health insurance with Adeslas 💳 Flexoh – flexible compensation platform 💪 Wellhub – gym & wellness network membership 🌍 Language courses 🤝 Hiring process Screening test (async) – A 45' online assessment with written questions designed to understand how you approach product problems and communicate your thinking. No right or wrong answers — just your point of view. HR interview – We'll talk about your background, motivation, and what you're looking for. You’ll also learn more about our team and how we work. Interview with the Product Manager – A hands-on session where we’ll explore how you approach product challenges. There will be a live test to see you in action! Final interview with our VP of Product – A broader conversation to align on expectations and future growth. If it’s a match, we’ll move forward with the offer 🎉

title: Product Associate
description: About the job PRODUCT ASSOCIATE AT ZENOWN AI SCALE-UP 🚀 WHO ARE WE? ZenOwn is innovative AI Technology company that empowers world’s leading consumer goods brands to attract, engage and retain their consumers in the retail. ZenShelf AI solutions enables automatic planning and monitoring of the in-store execution to optimise sales for CPG brands in retail. Loop by ZenOwn enables brands to register, engage, retain & understand their consumers. Awarded by Plug & Play, WebSummit and others for its innovativeness. Powered by a high performing diverse team with leading tech & consumer goods experience, powering 5 of Top 100 consumer brands on 4 continents. 👍 WHY JOIN US By joining ZenOwn, you’ll be part of a dynamic, forward-thinking team that encourages innovation and values each team member’s contributions. You’ll work in a supportive environment that prioritises personal growth and offers opportunities to make a tangible impact. 👩‍💼👨‍💼 WE ARE LOOKING FOR A TOP PERFORMER WHO: Has strong organisational skills and can manage multiple workstreams efficiently Demonstrates a genuine interest in startups, technology, and AI Is fluent in Spanish Possesses excellent analytical abilities and is comfortable working with data to inform decisions Communicates clearly and professionally, both in writing and verbally Has a cross-functional mindset, with an understanding of customer support and business operations Is proactive, reliable, and brings a high degree of professionalism to their work Is curious, eager to learn, and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment 📦 WHAT WE OFFER: Location flexibility (remote) Further career opportunities within ZenOwn for top performers Learning & development opportunities End-to-end ownership of key initiatives with a high degree of responsibility 🎯 KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Support the Product team in managing product development workflows, ensuring tasks are organised and on track Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Customer Support, Business Development, Tech) to gather requirements and ensure smooth product operations Analyse user feedback, market trends, and internal data to identify opportunities for improvement to our B2B solutions Prepare clear documentation, reports, and presentations to communicate insights and progress to stakeholders Contribute to maintaining a high standard of execution across product initiatives Assist with onboarding materials and training related to new features and updates Help drive operational excellence and continuous improvement in product processes Communicate professionally with Spanish-speaking clients INTERESTED? Tell us why you’re a perfect fit for this role and how your experience can contribute to our mission and attach your CV in English. Put “Product Associate” and your name in the email subject line. jobs@zenown.com

title: Product Manager
description: About the job In a nutshell 🥜 Wikifarmer is on a mission to empower farmers globally by providing education and direct access to the open market at fair prices. As our product evolves to meet growing demand, we’re looking for a data-driven Product Manager to take full ownership of a key area of our platform. As part of our lean and fast-moving product team, you’ll be directly responsible for unlocking value in a key product vertical by improving user experience, measuring outcomes through clear KPIs, increasing delivery velocity, and supporting the company’s ability to scale. This is a high-impact role where product thinking meets real-world outcomes. You’ll work cross-functionally, own your roadmap, and build features that drive outcomes for users across the agriculture value chain. What you’ll be doing Own a product area: take ownership of a core product vertical or business challenge; define and prioritize opportunities, lead roadmap execution. User-centric discovery: proactively engage with users and stakeholders; synthesize qualitative and quantitative insights into actionable product improvements. Drive execution and delivery: Work closely with design, engineering, and data to build and ship valuable features at pace; remove blockers and resolve dependencies. Make data-driven decisions: define, monitor, and analyze success metrics; set up experiments (A/B tests, pilots) and use results to inform prioritization and iteration Promote team collaboration: foster a culture of transparency and partnership across squads; influence without formal authority. Champion continuous learning: stay up-to-date with AI, agri-tech, and product management best practices; champion learning mindset and experimentation. What you’ll bring to the table Work proficiency in English with strong written and spoken communication skills At least 3+ years of product management experience, with a strong track record of leading digital products end-to-end, defining KPIs, and demonstrating impact through data Strong user empathy and a proven experience solving real customer problems through validation, and data-informed iteration Cross-functional collaboration in remote-first teams (engineering, design, commercial) A curious, growth-oriented mindset - comfortable with ambiguity and eager to explore new domains through research and rapid experimentation Experience prototyping with AI, either in a professional or personal capacity, demonstrating the ability to test and apply AI tools in practical, user-focused ways 💫 Bonus points if you bring… Experience in agri-tech, food systems, marketplaces (B2B or B2C), or supply chain ops Prior experience in a startup or scale-up environment Passion for emerging tech – AI, automation, or data products A process-driven mindset: you enjoy building and improving analytics frameworks, data pipelines, or discovery practices Multilingual or experienced in designing for global users What we can offer: A competitive fixed salary of €50k - €73k based on experience Private medical insurance for you and your family 24 days of annual leave (plus national holidays) A collaborative team that values initiative, innovation, and ownership Real impact - your work will directly affect customer success and operational excellence

title: Manager, Product Manager
description: About the job Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution. The company is founder led, profitable and growing. Canonical’s product management team are technologists who have a passion for delivering products and solutions that help shape market demands while elevating open source software everywhere. This is a general application track for the product management positions at Canonical, across all levels of team leads. As a manager, you will lead a team of product managers, mentoring them to ensure their success while driving alignment with company goals. You will set a clear vision, prioritize work effectively, and ensure the team delivers high-quality products that meet business and user needs. Apply here if you excel at leadership, communication, and technical vision, and believe you can drive product strategy for the business needs of tomorrow. During the interview process we will identify specific software products which would be a good fit for your interests. We believe that open source is transforming the way that enterprises solve their business needs. Although open source has been around for thirty years, it is only now fundamental to every corner of the software landscape. Going forward we believe open source will have an even bigger impact as it moves into specialised vertical markets. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of ‘most software to most companies’, starting with Ubuntu but expanding to cover every class of application on every class of compute. To deliver on that ambition, we select product managers for their intellect and strong drive to advance the open source community. Together, we aim to improve open source quality, outreach, and impact. Our product managers set the vision and the direction to ensure teams deliver the right products in the right markets at the right time. They push the boundaries of the technology landscape to identify and deliver products into new and existing market opportunities. Our product managers are technology professionals with a software engineering background who strive to become business executives and entrepreneurs. We discuss strategy, plan product development, drive engagement, and promote the open source way. We oversee the entire product lifecycle from conception to delivery, blending technical expertise, strategic thinking, analytics, project management skills and effective communication to ensure products meet both user needs and business objectives. We have open product manager roles across a wide range of product domains, including: Ubuntu Platform - Our Ubuntu experience on Desktop, Server, Windows (WSL), Multipass, Gaming, Enterprise, & Hardware Enablement Ubuntu Pro Services - Our key commercial offerings Ubuntu Pro, Compliance, Standards, Security Engineering, and Managed Services on cloud and on prem IoT - Ubuntu on embedded devices and/or edge servers, device management, and robotics Cloud - Ubuntu in public and private clouds, promoting automation frameworks, and including technologies such as Kubernetes, MAAS, and LXD Telco - Open source for Telco's including technologies and standards related to Core Network, RAN/vRAN, SoNIC, DENT, and SmartNICs Finance - Open source solutions for financial institutions including trading platforms, blockchain technologies, regulatory compliance, and AI-driven analytics Automotive - Open source solutions for autonomous driving, in-vehicle infotainment, connected vehicles, and compliance with automotive industry standards such as ISO 26262 and ISO 21434 Application Management - Open source solutions in the enterprise including Observability, IAM, App Stores and technologies such Grafana, GitOps, and Juju Charms If your domain of expertise isn’t listed above, yet you feel it’s relevant to Canonical, then feel free to apply anyway. We will route you to the most suitable team. Location: These roles are home based in the EMEA time zone. This role entails Lead the product development lifecycle, reviewing the priorities and goals for your product Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as engineering, design, marketing, and sales Address common challenges across projects, align on priorities, enable informed decisions, and keep business execution on track Conduct market research, analyse industry trends, and gather customer feedback to identify opportunities Communicate your product vision, status updates, and key decisions to ensure alignment and manage expectations Conduct usability testing, analyse user feedback, and iterate on the product to improve the user experience Collaborate with marketing, sales, and support teams to develop go-to-market strategies, create product documentation, and provide training Contribute to the success of our sales team in winning new opportunities, reviewing customer feedback and participating in customer meetings Guide and mentor a team of product managers, helping them grow in their roles and succeed in their projects Oversee the work of multiple product lines, ensuring consistency in strategy and execution across your team Facilitate collaboration and resolve conflicts within your team and across other departments What we are looking for in you Exceptional academic results at high school and university Understanding of Linux and the wider open source software community Understanding of computer architecture, application development, datacenters, cloud or devices Passion to write about technologies and the tech landscape A strong work ethic, and personal interests aligned with the open source movement Curiosity, and the habit of continuous learning A strong sense of ownership Problem solving and the ability to innovate Outstanding communications skills in English, both verbal and written For more senior positions, product management experience in the software industry Proven experience in managing and mentoring product managers or cross-functional teams Ability to manage multiple projects or product lines while maintaining focus on key priorities Demonstrated leadership in aligning diverse teams and driving consensus around product strategies Willingness to travel internationally up to 4 times a year for company events up to two weeks long Additional Skills That We Value Familiarity with a particular verticals (e.g. Telco, Finance, Industrial, Automotive) Familiarity with the technology ecosystem including Silicon, IHV, ISV, ODM/OEMs, cloud service providers and channel Familiarity with cloud native technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker containers & Snaps Familiarity with embedded and connected device technology and ecosystems Experience in managing distributed teams across different time zones Demonstrated ability to foster collaboration and innovation in team settings What we offer colleagues We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally. Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year Annual compensation review Recognition rewards Annual holiday leave Maternity and paternity leave Employee Assistance Program Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events About Canonical Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical is an equal opportunity employer We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Product Manager - OpenData
description: About the job Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead. At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors. As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment. Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities. The Role Our vision for OpenData is to become the global leader in reference data for the life sciences industry. Customers use OpenData as a foundation for their commercial and medical operations, driving patient outcomes. We are looking for a high-performing product manager to join our team in Spain or Portugal. In this role you are responsible for driving the OpenData product in Spain and Portugal, owning all data development processes end-to-end. What You’ll Do Responsible for the OpenData Spain and Portugal data product Make product decisions across data sourcing, transformation, updates, and analytics Maintain customer relationships, gather feedback, and make continuous improvements Define priorities and requirements for data engineers, analysts, and product operations Partner with sales and services to deliver customer success Ensure the data delivered is of high quality Track relevant market changes and regulatory developments Requirements Strong prioritization skills with the ability to balance product scope, quality, and customer feedback Experience with the healthcare ecosystem in Spain and Portugal Proficient in SQL Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Math, Statistics Fluent in Spanish and English Nice to Have Experience in building data products for the life sciences industry (data modeling, data sourcing, data analysis, data delivery) Fluent in Portuguese #RemoteSpain Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. As an equal opportunity employer, Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

title: Product Manager (100% Remote)
description: About the job En Robert Walters Valencia, estamos en la búsqueda de un perfil que encaje con la posición Product Manager para liderar la transformación digital de una empresa en pleno crecimiento. Qué buscamos: Más de 4 años de experiencia en gestión de producto, preferiblemente en entornos digitales o startups. Capacidad para trabajar de forma transversal con equipos y tomar decisiones basadas en datos. Enfoque estratégico y orientación clara a resultados. Dominio de herramientas analíticas como Google Analytics, Looker o Mixpanel. Comunicación efectiva y habilidad para priorizar de forma autónoma. Se valora positivamente: Experiencia en apps móviles B2C con gran volumen de usuarios. Conocimientos de diseño UX/UI y herramientas como Figma. Familiaridad con metodologías ágiles y trabajo con equipos técnicos.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job Looking for An ambitious and visionary Product Manager excited to build a new product from scratch and leave a mark on the future of finance. About Triple Triple is a high-growth fintech disrupting the payment data enrichment landscape, leveraging technology to enhance customer experiences. Our unique ecosystem offers solutions like transaction brand enrichment, logo provisioning, geolocalisation, data categorization, subscription analysis, and carbon footprint measurement. Our aim is to shape the future of finance with a powerful API. We value thinking long-term, getting things done with a diverse team, and staying humble. We have large banks and fintechs as customers, an experienced team, and a large network of investors behind our company. We have raised $10M in funding. What you will do Take full ownership of a new product from 0 to 1 Define and shape the product in close collaboration with customers and internal teams Translate abstract user problems into clear, actionable product requirements Own the roadmap from ideation to launch and continuous iteration Work cross-functionally with engineering, design, and commercial teams to ship effectively Validate assumptions quickly and iterate based on feedback and data Drive the product vision while staying agile and open to change What you need 3–5 years of experience in Product Management, ideally in fintech or banking Proficiency in English Strong problem-solving skills and ability to simplify complex systems Experience working with technical teams on API-based or data-driven products Comfortable owning products end-to-end in fast-paced, ambiguous environments Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills Conditions Remote-first. We offer a flexible work environment, a supportive and collaborative team, a competitive salary, equity options, and the opportunity to make a real impact on the future of finance. Join Triple and shape the future of finance Please kindly apply through LinkedIn.

title: Global Product Manager - Crop Protection / Insecticides
description: About the job Join ADAMA – A Global Leader in Crop Protection With nearly 10,000 employees and $5 billion in annual sales across more than 100 countries, ADAMA is one of the world’s top crop protection companies and part of the Syngenta Group. Our mission is to create simplicity in agriculture – helping farmers grow. We are proud to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome candidates from all backgrounds. About the Role We are seeking a Global Product Manager – Insecticides to join our Global Product Development team. This is a strategic role responsible for the performance, positioning, and lifecycle management of key Active Ingredients (AIs) and their related products within ADAMA’s global insecticides portfolio. You will leverage data, market trends, and competitive insights to develop product strategies and recommendations that enhance both operational execution and commercial impact. This is a unique opportunity to gain a global view of agriculture and the crop protection industry, working cross-functionally across regions, cultures, and disciplines. Fantastic opportunity to see agriculture globally and understand our industry end to end. Reports to the Insecticides Global Sector Head and to be based from UK, Germany, France, Italy or Spain Key Responsibilities • Develop and implement strategic plans for assigned Active Ingredients under the guidance of the Global Sector Head. • Manage products across their entire lifecycle, from ideation and development to phase-out. • Analyze market data and performance metrics to identify opportunities, gaps, and risks. • Present product strategy and investment proposals to senior leadership and executive teams. • Collaborate with regional teams (Anchor and Important Countries) to optimize product value and support execution at country level. • Drive New Product launches for key products in collaboration with markets • Drive revenue and margin improvements through optimal product positioning and pricing strategies. • Partner with 3rd-party companies to establish strategic in-licensing or out-licensing collaborations. • Act as the central information hub for your products, supporting marketing, regulatory, and supply chain decisions. • Anticipate regulatory risks and help ensure continued “license to operate” for key actives. • Support the product pipeline by advancing innovations through internal stage-gate processes. • Stay informed of global trends, market developments, regulatory shifts, and competitor activity to guide strategic decision-making. • Provide training materials and performance (RTB) data to local marketing and sales teams. • Facilitate internal alignment and cross-functional commitment across global stakeholders. About You – Skills & Experience • Proven experience in a similar role within the crop protection industry is essential. Experience with insecticides is a plus, but not mandatory. • Strong analytical thinking and strategic mindset. • Excellent interpersonal and influencing skills across matrixed, multicultural environments. • Experience in additional domains such as R&D, Regulatory, or Marketing is an advantage. • Academic degree in Agronomy, Plant Science, Biology, or a related field. • MBA or business-related postgraduate qualification is a plus. • Fluent in written and spoken English. Why ADAMA? Be part of a purpose-driven global leader in agricultural innovation. Work with experts from around the world in a collaborative and inclusive environment. Influence the development and direction of key products impacting global food production. Build a career with meaning, visibility, and growth. Ready to Make an Impact? Apply today to join ADAMA as our new Global Product Manager – Insecticides and help us shape the future of crop protection.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job POWER A WORLD OF TRUST Incode is the leading provider of world-class identity solutions that is reinventing the way humans authenticate and verify their identities online to power a world of digital trust. Through our revolutionary identity solutions, we are unleashing the business potential of universal industries including finance, government, retail, hospitality, gaming, and more, by reducing fraud and transforming human interactions with data, products, and services. We’re in the process of rapidly scaling our diverse global team and we’re looking for entrepreneurial individuals and leaders who are curious, driven, and excited by ownership to join a Unicorn-status scale-up! About The Role Join Incode as a Product Manager for Biometric Intelligence, where you will lead efforts to advance next-generation biometric technologies. You will focus on building deepfake detection capabilities, enhancing liveness detection, and productizing these solutions to create impactful Go-to-Market (GTM) strategies. You will also work closely with customers to identify upsell opportunities and ensure Incode’s biometric solutions remain at the forefront of the industry. Key Responsibilities Develop and execute a product roadmap for advanced biometric intelligence, focusing on deepfake detection and enhanced liveness technology. Collaborate with engineering and research teams to deliver cutting-edge solutions that detect and prevent emerging threats. Productize biometric capabilities into scalable offerings with strong GTM alignment, ensuring rapid customer adoption. Identify and execute upsell opportunities by demonstrating the value of advanced biometric solutions to existing customers. Leverage customer insights and industry trends to drive innovation in biometric intelligence. Define and track performance metrics for biometric products, using data-driven insights to optimize offerings continuously. Qualifications 5+ years of product management experience, preferably in biometric intelligence or related fields. Strong understanding of biometric technologies, deepfake detection, and liveness detection systems. Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, research, and sales. Experience in developing GTM strategies and identifying upsell opportunities. Exceptional analytical skills and ability to leverage data to drive decision-making. 8 Aspects Of Our Culture Values are what we value High performance Freedom & responsibility Context, not control Highly aligned, loosely coupled Continuous Feedback Pay Top of Market Promotions & Development Learn more about Life at Incode! Benefits & Perks Meaningful Equity Flexible Working Hours & Workplace Open Vacation Policy Wellness Program International Travel Opportunities Additional benefits package according to location (401k, medical insurance, etc.) Equal Opportunities Incode is an equal opportunity employer, committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment. We take great pride in having an inclusive, diverse, and global team, and we are always looking for talented and passionate individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life. As part of our commitment to inclusion, we ensure that reasonable accommodations are available throughout the hiring process. If you require any accommodation due to a disability or specific need, please let our Talent Acquisition team know—we’ll do our best to support you. Applicant Data Privacy We will only use your personal information concerning Incode’s application, recruitment, and hiring processes.

title: Growth Product Manager (Web)
description: About the job At Reverse Tech, we are on a mission to create, launch, and scale digital product brands in the health and wellness space. Our goal is ambitious – we aim to help 10 million people improve their health by 2030 through hyper-targeted, mass-scale brands. We specialize in subscription-based business models and pride ourselves on being results-focused, with no big egos, just big data. What We Want to Achieve: Our vision is to discover novel self-serve solutions to the world's greatest health problems, all while adhering to our core values. We are looking for a Growth Product Manager (Web) to join our Reverse Tech remote team. You will play a crucial role in building and scaling our mobile apps within our health and wellness vertical. You'll work closely with senior stakeholders across all of Reverse Tech, contributing to our mission of improving lives and changing the world through innovative digital solutions. About the Role: As a Growth Product Manager (Web), you will: Own and optimize conversion funnels to drive user acquisition and monetization. Analyze user behavior, user personas and funnel performance to identify and prioritize improvement opportunities. Design and execute A/B tests to optimize key metrics and improve user experience. Collaborate with marketing, design, tech, and data teams to implement growth initiatives. Improve conversion rates, average order value (AOV), and user lifetime value (LTV) through data-driven strategies. Analyze customer behavior, market trends, and competitor strategies to uncover growth opportunities. Desired Skills Proven experience in growth product management or a data-driven product role. Experience with A/B testing and user journey optimization. Strong understanding of conversion rate optimization (CRO) principles and methodologies. Proficiency in analytics tools. Knowledge of UX/UI design principles and their impact on user behavior. A proactive, self-driven approach with excellent collaboration and communication skills. Comfortable working in a fast-paced, results-driven environment. Our Values: Care: We support and stand by our team members in any situation, ensuring that no one is left behind. Extreme Ownership: We take responsibility not only for tasks under our direct control but for anything that impacts our mission's success. Identification: We take pride in being part of something bigger than ourselves, with the goal of changing the world by helping people get healthier. Communication: We value honesty and direct language, fostering a culture free of politics. Performance: We believe in providing full freedom while striving for top-notch performance from everyone. Trust: We value the words and qualities of our team members, fostering an environment of trust and respect Benefits What Our Team Members Get: 100% remote and flexible work hours Top notch equipment (MacBook Pro or PC, you decide) Full-time or freelance opportunities Learning from the best, including ex-Googlers and more Unlimited growth prospects Inclusion in a winning team Competitive compensation A fun, non-corporate atmosphere If you're passionate about digital health and well-being, have a solid experience in growth product management and are ready to join a dynamic, global team, we encourage you to apply. Help us shape the future of health and wellness through technology. Learn more about us at https://www.reverse.tech/ and apply today to become a key player in our exciting journey. *This position is offered as a Remote option, reach out to us to evaluate the options according to your location.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job Job Description We’re looking for a Product Manager to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally. Who We Are At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we’ve grown to over 700 Seedtaggers across 17 countries, raising €250M to revolutionize digital advertising. Your Challenge Market analysis and trends: Maintain a deep understanding of the latest trends in the AdTech world, including emerging technologies, privacy policy changes, and market best practices. Use this knowledge to guide strategic decision-making and keep us at the forefront of the industry. Build up from a rock to a castle: As Product Manager, the ideal candidate will become part of a squad including multiple Backend Engineers. Together with the Engineering Manager, the ideal candidate will need to understand development timings and uncertainty around these, be comfortable around MVPs to find possible short-cuts while understanding the tradeoffs made in the resulting technology, define future iterations to build up the best technology while ensuring its producing impact from the very beginning. Collaboration with external partners: Work closely with our strategic partners, such as DSPs and SSPs, to establish and maintain strong integrations. Collaborate on identifying partnership opportunities, resolving technical issues, and optimizing platform performance. Internal and External evangelisation: As Product Manager for Ad Exchange you will be the point of contact for explaining (and sometimes selling) our capabilities to get the best out of our publishers inventory. The ideal candidate will need to adapt technical developments to non-technical language, properly communicate our developments and innovation to internal teams (partnerships/success/etc.) and externally to clients. Continuous improvement and optimization: Drive continuous improvement of our AdExchange by identifying areas of opportunity to optimize algorithms and increase efficiency. Conduct tests and experiments to validate new ideas and approaches. Establish product metrics, KPIs and indicators for success: Together with the Engineering Manager, the Product manager will need to be responsible for the roadmap, the developments of the squad, ensuring and measuring the success of the projects, improving ways-of-working, etc. What You’ll Need to Succeed Is very entrepreneurial, not afraid to take risks and has great communication skills. Has an educational background in Engineering, maths, tech or a related area. Has 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager or another relevant role. Knows how to make data-driven decisions and work on complex technical problems. Has a proven track record of working effectively under high pressure environments. Speaks fluent in English and Spanish, this is a must for this role. Is eager to work in a dynamic, innovative and fast-changing environment. It would be a plus if you Have previous experience in Web and CTV AdTech ecosystems. Why Join Seedtag? Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more! Additional Perks Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers. Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included. Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes. Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future. Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let’s grow together! At Seedtag, we’re committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we’ll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

title: Credit Product Manager (SME Business Lending)
description: About the job About Revolut People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day. As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution. About The Role The credit department at Revolut is anything but ordinary. They design, develop, and launch credit products across the globe. The team manages our products from day one to the end — developing the back and front-end, the data science infrastructure, and then creating a local setup in each country with scalable risk management and portfolio management solutions. It’s a big job, but our people are a credit to us all. We're looking for Credit Product Manager to drive the launch of new unsecured credit products for SME customers, establish new sales channels, improve funnel conversion, and lower the cost of acquisition 💪 You'll also make sure we offer the best product features, support, and service for our business lending products in Europe and the UK. We need a Leader with capital ‘L’ to own product building and business lending, as well as an awesome boss to cooperate occasionally with Technical Product Owners and the Engineering team. Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch 🚀 What You'll Be Doing Setting the vision for business lending products, understanding how it connects to Revolut’s goals Producing high-quality business requirements in line with market best practices, looking to disrupt and challenge the status quo Building unsecured business lending products while ensuring high UX engagement to deliver world-class customer experiences, understanding the full lifecycle of a business customer at all times Defining, prioritising, and communicating short, mid, and long-term goals of business lending products Creating market-leading distribution/sales strategies with a high conversion funnel and low cost of acquisition Establishing reliable and reputable third-party partnerships Ensuring zero tolerance of any compliance issues or breach of regulatory requirements What You'll Need Deep knowledge of EU/UK unsecured small and medium-sized enterprise (SME) lending markets (segments, competitors, best practices, acquisition channels, etc.) Hands-on experience building products and/or features in the SME lending space in Europe and the UK Solid product design experience and a passionate approach to customer experience UI/UX principle knowledge with a customer focus, understanding business needs and analysing data and real-world experiences to prioritise features Broad knowledge of risk management principles User research experience Great interpersonal and negotiation skills to communicate effectively with stakeholders A detail-oriented, analytical mindset A track record of making data-driven decisions whilst building business intuition around the credit product The ability to lead a team and build partnerships with other functions To be comfortable with and enjoy taking ownership A passion for building new processes and challenging the status quo Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team. Important notice for candidates: Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles. Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don’t use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain. We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it’s a scam. Report it immediately. By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

title: Technical Product Manager - Producto API - scrum, agile - remoto (*A)
description: About the job BETWEEN TECHNOLOGY es una consultora multinacional que cuenta con avanzadas capacidades tecnológicas en el ámbito de la Ingeniería y las TIC. Nuestros servicios llegan a todos los continentes y cubren varios sectores de la economía mundial, industria y empresas de servicios. En la actualidad BETWEEN cuenta con un equipo de 1000 personas en la industria del automóvil, ferrocarril, retail, etc. Ampliamos nuestro equipo y seleccionamos un/a Product Manager especializado/a en producto API, con amplia experiencia velando por la entrega continua del Software de valor a negocio, para un proyecto estable e indefinido, en uno de los equipos de tecnología que Between tiene implantados en uno de nuestros principales clientes. ¿Qué haré? Impulsar el producto lo más lejos posible y asegurarse de que su equipo aporte valor al negocio. Gestionar y negociar el roadmap con stakeholders de iniciativas propias y demandadas del producto. Producto API (definición API): deberás conseguir que su evolución pueda satisfacer las necesidades actuales y futuras del producto. Amplia experiencia con productos apificados desde 0, amplia experiencia trabajando con la API → OpenAPI, swagger, leer contratos de API, ver retrocompatibilidad, acostumbrado a que 5 clientes distintos se conecten a API con usos diferentes, ver uso que le dan etc y tomar decisiones para ser eficientes. Último/a responsable del backlog del producto. Aplicar técnicas de priorización y medición de impacto de iniciativas para su negociación. Comunicar y consensuar cambios de alcance en el roadmap con stakeholders. Trabajar junto al equipo de desarrollo para conseguir las mejores soluciones trasladando las necesidades y resolviendo dudas y bloqueos. Experiencia real definiendo producto de cero/primera mano (que no te haya venido dado lo que tenía que hacer, no transcribir). Ejercicio de discovery muy fuerte con stakeholders y usuarios. En People hay un montón de entidades a plasmar (ausencia, tipos de ausencias etc), además de cómo impacta en cada país. Agrupar las diferentes necesidades y experiencias. Gestionar stakeholders + definir roadmap estratégico + escribir HUs con criterios de aceptación. Muy buenas habilidades de comunicación (datos y ejemplos reales). Tus Funciones Comunicar con las partes interesadas en todos los ámbitos relacionados con el producto, incluido el equipo de desarrollo para asegurarse de que las metas sean claras y la visión esté alineada con los objetivos estratégicos. Ayudar al equipo a mantener esa visión mediante la creación de una hoja de ruta del producto, resumen visual estratégico que describe la visión y dirección del producto a lo largo del tiempo. Trabajar con la dirección como parte interesada para crear un producto que se adapte a sus objetivos estratégicos. Definir métricas de producto y su uso durante el proceso de desarrollo. Estar al día con el entorno de trabajo Agile / Scrum. Además, trabajando para BETWEEN obtendrás los siguientes beneficios añadidos: Formación con BTW University (Idiomas, Power Business School, Udemy, Certificaciones técnicas, Pharos, etc). Seguro médico gratuito desde el primer día. Posibilidad de elegir cómo obtener parte del salario gracias a la Retribución Flexible (tickets restaurante, guardería). Acceso a variedad de descuentos (Viajes, tecnología y más). Precios reducidos en bienestar, fitness y nutrición con Gympass. ¡Cumplir años como Betweener tiene premio! ¿Product Manager con amplia experiencia en producto API y velando por la entrega contiua del Software de valor a negocio y quieres formar parte de un proyecto remoto referente a nivel mundial en un entorno 100% agile y técnico y en España? ¡No dudes en inscribirte! Requisitos Experiencia como Product Manager o Product Owner. Experiencia de producto API: definición de API como un producto y familiarizado /a con el enfoque APIFirst. Experiencia en entornos de trabajo Agile / Scrum. Experiencia en la toma de decisiones basada en datos. Experiencia en negociación con stakeholders y consumidores. Experiencia trabajando en la orientación a objetivos y resultados. Muy buenas habilidades de comunicación, clara y directa, y buena capacidad de negociación. Experiencia previa trabajando con objetivos y resultados clave (OKRs).

title: Product Manager (relocation to Abu Dhabi
description: About the job Position: Product Manager Location: Abu Dhabi Presight is an ADX-listed public company with Abu Dhabi based G42 as its majority shareholder and is the region’s leading big data analytics company powered by GenAI. It combines big data, analytics, and AI expertise to serve every sector, of every scale, to create business and positive societal impact The Opportunity: Looking for an insightful, results-oriented Product Manager to drive the conceptualization, development and rapid testing of analytics products and solutions that will enhance acquisition, engagement and retention of Presight customers. Key Responsibilities: As a Product Manager, you will collaborate with clients and Presight stakeholders to define priorities, deliverables & design approaches, and lead the product strategy, planning, delivery & marketing of Presight solutions & services in line with the overall business objectives and customer requirements. Functional Translate product strategy into detailed requirements for prototype construction and final product development by engineering teams. Prepare detailed requirement specifications, functional specifications, use case, and work- flow diagrams and manage the requirements throughout the project lifecycle. Own the product roadmap and drive the execution of product lifecycle processes, including product research, market research, competitive analysis, planning, positioning, roadmap development, requirements development, and product launch. Monitor progress of product development and own the product backlog to ensure progress is as per the agreed baseline, to achieve timely completion and a return on investment. Measure product performance and mitigate impediments impacting the successful delivery of the product. Familiarity with Figma to facilitate collaboration among various stakeholders. Keeping up to date with AI agents and the latest trending models. Assist the product team by providing expertise/suggestions in the areas of design, storytelling, interaction design, visual design, user research and user behavior. Lead testing efforts in conjunction with the Project and QA Manager, including the design and execution of test scripts and scenarios. Adopt a proactive approach to identify risks and issues, create contingency plans for mitigation, assist with gap analysis and develop proof-of-concepts. Develop product positioning that differentiates Presight and its features across primary market segments. Develop dashboards and reports on product development operations that showcase the performance of the product and usage patterns and suggest possible improvements. Manage all aspects of live products, including customer feedback, requirements and issues. Comply with QHSE (Quality Health Safety and Environment), Business Continuity, Information Security, Privacy, Risk, Compliance Management and Governance of Organizations policies, procedures, plans and related risk assessments. Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Artificial Intelligence, Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field. Minimum 8 years of experience in product, software and web design or engineering and development. At least 5 years of experience in analytical product management. Ideally, you’ll also need Domain knowledge across multiple industries. A highly insightful and analytical approach to data. Excellent communication skills. Great presentation and persuasion skills.

title: Product Manager Identity Verification & Fraud
description: About the job The ideal candidate would be able to occasionally visit our Zagreb office, and the role requires working within the CET time zone. While we have a slight preference for candidates based in Zagreb, Croatia, we are also open to applicants from nearby regions and time zones. Our core markets include Bulgaria, Croatia, Romania, and Serbia. Here’s why this role matters to us At Microblink, we believe that innovation drives success, and our products make a tangible impact by solving some of the most important challenges in the digital landscape. As a Product Manager for BlinkID, you'll help guide the product strategy and shape the future of our AI-powered identity verification solutions. This role is vital in ensuring our products meet the evolving needs of our customers, and by leading the development process, you will help maintain BlinkID's leadership in the industry. A little bit about us Microblink is an AI company specializing in computer vision, dedicated to building innovative products and tools that help create a secure, fraud-free digital identity landscape. With headquarters in New York and Zagreb, our teams across the U.S. and Europe impact hundreds of millions of people each year, processing over 800 million identity documents across more than 70 countries. Here’s what you’ll do Define, develop, and execute the product strategy and roadmap for our products BlinkID Verify and BlinkCard Conduct market research to identify emerging opportunities and trends in identity verification technology Work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering and design, to ensure seamless product development Collaborate with customers and stakeholders to gather feedback and validate product direction Monitor product performance using key metrics and KPIs, making data-driven decisions for optimization Ensure high-quality product delivery, from ideation to launch and iterative improvements Engage with the marketing and sales teams to develop go-to-market strategies and product marketing materials Provide ongoing support to ensure customers derive maximum value from BlinkID Verify and BlinkCard products You'll be successful in this role if you Have proven experience in product management roles, ideally within the identity verification, document scanning, or related technology sectors (Fintech, Payments, Security) for 3-5 product cycles minimum Possess a strong understanding of Agile methodologies and the software development process Have solid experience with SDK/API-based products and their integrations Have relevant and demonstrated experience with technologies like computer vision, OCR, machine learning, and data analysis Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills Demonstrate strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities Have a customer-focused mindset and strategic thinking to drive product success Excellent GTM product skills Qualifications Education in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a relevant field Proven experience in product management, preferably in the identity verification, fraud or technology space Familiarity with mobile and web development platforms, such as iOS, Android, and web frameworks Strong leadership qualities with the ability to collaborate across diverse teams Here’s what you’ll gain if you join us Equity participation for all full-time employees, fostering shared success Unlimited PTO, giving you the flexibility to take time off as needed to maintain a healthy work-life balance Location-specific benefits tailored to personal preferences and regional needs. Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options and the opportunity to work at our Zagreb office Access to internal L&D programs to enhance your skills in a supportive environment How can you join us? If this role intrigues you, do not hesitate to hit the apply button and send us your resume. We are excited to meet talents around the world.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job Position Title: Product Insight Manager Location: Remote – Open to candidates across the EU Reporting to: European General Manager (based in Hungary) Client: Fast-growing MRO company, publicly listed on NASDAQ About the Company Our client is a dynamic and rapidly expanding MRO (Maintenance, Repair & Operations) solutions provider, publicly listed on the NASDAQ. With a strong global presence and significant market share in Asia, the company is now in an accelerated growth phase in Europe, offering innovative procurement and supply chain solutions to industrial clients. Role Overview As Product Insight Manager, you will play a critical role in shaping the company’s European product strategy. You will analyze market trends, customer needs, and competitive offerings to ensure the European product portfolio aligns with both local market demands and the company’s global strategy. This role is fully remote, offering flexibility while collaborating closely with the European General Manager and cross-functional teams. Key Responsibilities Conduct in-depth market and competitor analysis to identify emerging trends, pricing dynamics, and product gaps in the European MRO market. Gather, interpret, and present actionable product insights to support business development, category management, and marketing teams. Work closely with the European GM to develop product strategies and roadmap tailored to the EU market. Collaborate with global product and sourcing teams to align local market needs with global supply capabilities. Support product lifecycle management, from introduction to phase-out, ensuring profitability and customer satisfaction. Monitor and evaluate product performance metrics and recommend adjustments as needed. Build strong relationships with key stakeholders, suppliers, and partners to improve product offering and market positioning. Qualifications & Experience Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or related field (Master’s degree preferred). Minimum 5 years of experience in product management, product insight, or category management — preferably in the MRO, industrial supply, or related sectors. Direct industry experience strongly preferred — for example, in handling tools, industrial equipment, or related product categories. Strong analytical skills with proven ability to turn data into actionable insights. Excellent understanding of European industrial markets and customer needs. Experience working in cross-cultural, global organizations. Proficient in English; additional European languages are an advantage. Strong communication, presentation, and stakeholder management skills. Additional Information Work Arrangement: 100% remote within the EU, occasional travel for team meetings or supplier visits. Reporting Line: Directly to the European General Manager, based in Hungary. Impact: Opportunity to shape the product strategy for a rapidly expanding European market within a high-growth, publicly listed company.

title: Principal Product Manager
description: About the job 🚀 Who Are We? Welcome to Welltech—where health meets innovation! 🌍 As a global leader in Health & Fitness industry, we’ve crossed over 200 million installs with five life-changing apps, all designed to boost well-being for millions. Our mission? To transform lives through intuitive nutrition trackers, powerful fitness solutions, and personalized wellness journeys—all powered by a diverse team of over 700 passionate professionals with presence across 5 hubs. Why Welltech? Imagine joining a team where your impact on global health and wellness is felt daily. At Welltech, we strive to be proactive wellness partners for our users, while continually evolving ourselves. What We're Looking For We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented Product Manager to join our team. In this pivotal role, you will drive the product vision, strategy, and execution, leading one of our 3 product squads, ensuring delivery of exceptional value to our new users. This involves understanding user needs, defining product requirements, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to bring innovative features to market. Key Responsibilities: Product Strategy & Roadmap Create and maintain the product roadmap for your squad, aligning it with business objectives and user needs. Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify opportunities for product innovation. Define and prioritize product hypotheses based on data-driven insights and user feedback. Product Execution Collaborate closely with engineering, design, and marketing teams to deliver high-quality product features. Manage the product lifecycle from concept to launch, ensuring timely and effective execution. Utilize Agile methodologies (Scrum) to manage product development and iterate on features. You will work closely with Engineering Manager to lead squad delivery together. User Focus & Data Analysis Conduct user research and gather feedback to understand user needs and pain points. Analyze product data and user behavior to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. Run a looot of A/B tests to optimize product features and enhance user experience. Base all product decisions on data. Collaboration & Communication Communicate product vision and strategy to stakeholders across the organization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and effective execution. Actively engage with product communities to bring external insights into the product. Driving Long-Term Usage Retention & LTV Growth Focus on creating and optimizing value for our subscription-based users. Test and discover new ways to improve user experience. Candidate journey ⭕️ Recruiter call --> ⭕️ Meet a team member --> ⭕️ Skills assessment--> ⭕️ Meet the Leadership team ✨ Why You’ll Love Being Part of Welltech: Grow Together: Join a culture that champions both personal and professional growth. Here, you’ll thrive as we learn, evolve, and succeed together. Lead by Example: No matter your role, your leadership matters. Every team member is empowered to inspire and make an impact. Results-Driven: We’re all about achieving meaningful outcomes. It’s not just about the effort, but the difference we make every day. We Are Well-Makers: Be part of a movement that’s creating a healthier, happier world. Together, we make well-being a reality! Check out some of our products Muscle Booster — https://musclebooster.fitness/ Yoga-Go — https://yoga-go.io/ WalkFit - http://walkfit.pro

title: Staff Product Manager (remote, UTC-3 to UTC+3)
description: About the job (Fully remote, async-first, DevTool SaaS, 32-40h/week, time zones: UTC-3 to UTC+3) Location: This is a FULLY remote role, but you must be within UTC-3 to UTC+3 to work with your team, peers, and internal customers. You do not have to be in the specific country or city shown in this listing, but please only apply if you are physically based within the UTC-3 to UTC+3 timezone. -- Join Checkly as a Staff Product Manager and empower developers to own and ensure application performance and reliability - from pull request to post-mortem! Checkly helps engineers build reliable products by unifying testing, monitoring and observability. OpenTelemetry, Playwright, and Monitoring as Code are our foundation for unifying performance and reliability. Our tech stack is Vue.js, Node.js, TypeScript, Postgres, ClickHouse and AWS. We ship to prod all day, every day. We practice Agile (not scrum) and take pride in good documentation and good looking products. We’re a remote-first startup that keeps things simple—low on meetings, high on productivity, and always shipping. If you love building cool things, working async, actually listening to and working with customers, and keeping it lean, you’ll fit right in! Thousands of developers—teams at 1Password, CrowdStrike, Render, LinkedIn and Vercel included—trust Checkly to keep their apps running smoothly. In 2024, we raised $20M in Series B funding from Balderton, CRV, and Accel to take things to the next level. We care about building a team where people of all backgrounds are encouraged to do their best work. To achieve this we built a flexible, remote-first and async-first startup environment with inclusive benefits and full transparency about how we pay. What You'll Do As a Staff Product Manager, you will be responsible for empowering developers and designers to solve customer problems. You will report to our CPO, Alberto Gomez. You will: Learn all about the monitoring and observability market, figuring out its strengths and weaknesses to take our products to a new level. Use your empathy for the daily challenges of DevOps, SRE and (Platform) Engineering teams to create solutions to their problems. Understand the dynamics of the testing, monitoring, and observability market, and use that knowledge to bring Checkly and our growing customer base to the next level. Focus on making an impact while also being mindful about speed, efficiency and cost. Lead initiatives that span multiple teams, aligning stakeholders across Product, Engineering, Design, Sales and Marketing. Represent Checkly externally in key customer relationships and developer communities. What You Should Have Experience as a Product Manager, working on a technical product, preferably solving problems for engineers. Prior experience in the monitoring or observability space is a very big plus. You "get" developers — our main customers — through your engineering background. Self-motivated, highly driven, and eager to try to do things differently. You value autonomy, and believe in empowered teams to solve customer problems in a remote work environment Very hands-on, you use your coding abilities and AI tooling to understand customers and market dynamics, create mock designs, design system components, assessing technical viability, and writing micro-copy You have shipped multiple product features to developers, from concept to delivery. You can ship "big bang", but also manage early access, beta and staged rollouts using feature flags. You reduce risk by testing the market, and trying things out with a small groups of users. Proven ability to work cross-functionally, collaborate, influence and work as part of a team Excellent spoken and written English skills are a must. Ability to be autonomous and self-motivated in a remote work environment, while you also enjoy getting to know your colleagues and helping others. FULLY remote role, within the UTC-3 to UTC+3 time zones. Why us? Transparent salary because your salary shouldn't be dictated by how good a negotiator you are. (more info below) Remote-first, flexible work hours, async-first (low meeting, high productivity) and transparent culture Use the latest technologies and innovate with us: we are THE Monitoring-as-Code company Become part of a fast-growing, international, and remote team where your work matters—your impact won’t get lost in layers of bureaucracy. Stock options 27 days of paid vacation + your local public holidays Paid sick leave & up to 14 weeks of paid parental leave $1,500 learning, visiting and wellness budget Co-working budget or home office setup Bi-annual company retreats Employee & contractor options Find out more here. What We Pay Fair, competitive, and transparent pay is very important for us. Therefore we work with a standardized salary calculator that includes several factors such as seniority level as well as location. For this role, the range is €119k - €133k for someone in a similar cost of market as UK, Germany etc, + stock options €107k - €119k for someone in a similar cost of market as Spain, Poland, Ukraine etc, + stock options Apply If this sounds interesting, please apply! Studies by several different sources have shown that on average men will apply for a job if they meet 60% of the application requirements. Women,non-binary people and POC will seek to match a much higher percentage of requirements before applying. If you're not sure you're the right fit, apply anyway and let us know what you bring to the table. We'd love to hear from you! We're all about being transparent and setting clear expectations. That's why we've put together our hiring playbook and open-sourced our employee handbook. There you'll find a sneak peek of who we are, how we work and what you can expect in our hiring process. Compensation Range: €119K - €133K

title: Sales Account & Product Manager Iberia – Compounding / Plastic Materials
description: About the job IMCD (www.imcdgroup.com) es una empresa multinacional líder en la distribución de especialidades químicas para diferentes sectores (plastic, pharma, personal care, food, industry, etc.). Actualmente está buscando a un/a: Sales Account & Product Manager Iberia – Compounding / Plastic Materials Reportando al Business Unit Manager Advanced Materials Iberia, y con una clara orientación a la venta de soluciones técnicas, se responsabilizará de la captación y desarrollo de potenciales clientes en el sector del compounding, masterbatch, plastic recycling cubriendo la zona de actuación comercial de todo Iberia. Con una doble función como Sales Account Manager y Product Manager, tendrá asignadas algunas de nuestras representadas (firmas de primer nivel en la fabricación de materiales plásticos), y tendrá que participar en la implantación de planes de acción, así como asegurar la correcta rotación del stock y la elaboración de propuestas de compras. Pensamos en una persona con experiencia comercial técnica en el mercado de los polímeros y aditivos plásticos, con una formación superior preferiblemente en química o ingeniería. Es necesario disponer de un buen nivel de inglés y disponibilidad para viajar. Se valorará positivamente experiencia con Sales Force. Ofrecemos la oportunidad de incorporación a un proyecto estimulante, en una sólida multinacional líder en su sector, que ofrece posibilidades de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional.

title: Product Manager
description: About the job An international health & beauty business with strong roots in Asia and a growing footprint in Europe is looking for a Medical Device Marketing Manager to drive the development and launch of cutting-edge skin booster and skincare solutions across the EMEA region. You will be joining a nimble, entrepreneurial team with the backing of a major global healthcare group. This is a unique opportunity to shape a medical device portfolio from the ground up, working closely with strategic CDMO partners and medical advisors to build a disruptive aesthetic business. Key responsibilities: Lead market analysis and go-to-market strategy for innovative aesthetic medical devices. Manage the launch and lifecycle of skin boosters and other medical device solutions via partnerships. Drive new product development in collaboration with medical advisors and manufacturing partners. Oversee regulatory affairs in partnership with external consultants. Build relationships with KOL doctors and develop impactful promotional and event strategies. Play a key role in strategic alliances and acquisition projects related to medical aesthetics. Take full ownership of P&L for the medical device business line. To be considered for the role, you must closely match the following criteria: Proven track record in the aesthetic medical device industry (skin boosters, dermal fillers would be preferred) Experience working in Product Management positions with proven success working with product pipeline from early stage through to launch. You are confident leading projects independently, comfortable operating in fast-moving and entrepreneurial environments, and experienced in working with doctors and scientific advisors. You combine strategic thinking with executional focus and bring a deep understanding of regulatory and commercial realities in the medical device space.

title: Global Product Manager Ruminants
description: About the job Global Product Management – Ruminants Market Strategy and Portfolio Management (Leading Products) Objective: Serve as the primary point of contact for operations, distributors, sales, innovation, and communication supporting Cross-Functional Collaboration. Lead product portfolio and market strategy including product lifecycle management of Leading Products based on market needs and opportunities. Drive global market development for Leading Products, steer product launch and re-launch ensuring alignment with overall business goals. Support sales in defining the optimal channel management strategy Based on business goals consolidate sales budget across all markets defining and tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure product success Key Responsibilities: 1. Cross-Functional Collaboration Work closely with Innovation group to ensure that new products align with market needs and customer demands. Steer launch of new products locally with sales organization by bridging technical knowledge with commercial strategies Align with market communication teams to create compelling sales materials and campaigns. Coordinate with production ensuring product availability for all focus markets 2. Market Potential Analysis Conduct market research to identify customer needs, market trends, competitive landscape, and growth opportunities in key markets Translate insights into actionable recommendations to inform product strategies. Support activity capturing market opportunities as they appear 3. Strategic Portfolio Development Define the long-term vision and roadmap for products in the portfolio. Highlight portfolio gabs and deliver new ideas to innovation supporting the development of holistic portfolio focusing on solutions aligned with the company's strategic goals. Support the development of tailored customer solutions and product positioning. 4. Launch Planning and Execution Lead launch strategies, ensuring alignment across product development, marketing, sales, and operational teams. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and supply chain readiness before launch Develop go-to-market plans, oversee execution, and monitor the success of product launches. Drive promotional activities, and customer communication, in collaboration with local teams and regional managers 5. Sales Support & Commercial Guidance Develop and implement pricing strategies that maximize market share and profitability. Conduct pricing analysis, monitor competitive pricing, and adjust strategies as needed. Provide strategic and technical support to sales regional managers. Support the development of sales tools, sales training materials, and value propositions to enhance commercial success. 6. Performance Monitoring and Optimization Track key performance metrics to measure product success and identify areas for improvement. Continuously optimize the product lifecycle through data-driven decision- making and feedback loops. Key Metrics for Success: Profitable Sales growth and market share expansion. Customer satisfaction and engagement levels. Successful execution of launch initiatives. Effective cross-functional collaboration. Education and Experience: Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Ruminant Nutrition and preferably a degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or a related field Several years of experience in marketing specialty products, with a focus on strategic planning and execution Skills: Strong analytical skills to interpret market data and trends Excellent English communication skills, both verbally and in writing Ability to work internationally and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a matrix organization Willing to travel 60-100 days annually Project management skills to oversee marketing campaigns and launch initiatives Location: EU remote-based

title: Product Manager - Specialty tyres
description: About the job Who We Are: Sailun Group (https://en.sailungroup.com/) is one of the world's leading rubber technology and tyre companies. Being the 10th largest manufacturer in the world, Sailun Group is offering a broad portfolio of passenger car, truck and bus as well as specialty tyres. The brand Sailun is the fastest growing tyre brand globally (2023) and among the Top Ten in sustainability perception. Smart manufacturing ensuring superior product quality, emotional brand building and passionate people are the key drivers for Sailun’s success story today and in the future. Sailun Group’s products are available in more than 180 markets and regions in the Americas, Europe, Asia and Africa. With over 18,000 dedicated talents, we are heading to extend our operating footprints in the major markets to best serve the local customer needs, and aspiring to become the leader of the local market. Position Overview: As a Product Manager - Specialty tyres at Sailun Group, you will play a crucial role in the lifecycle of our specialty tyre products, from initial feasibility analysis to market release and performance evaluation. Your expertise will help ensure that our products meet market demands and maintain a competitive edge.
