Facilitate alignment through effective communication, problem-solving, risk identification and mitigation strategies. Maintain understanding of game release schedules and forecast project milestones Manage and develop Design team with thoughtful feedback, mentorship and career pathing. Required Qualifications Proficient Production/Project management fundamentals including capacity planning, scope assessment and management, and project milestone planning. Solid grasp of project management software (e.g. JIRA, Microsoft Project, Confluence, Hansoft, etc.). title: Scrum Master
description: About the job We’re BrainRocket — an international software development and digital solutions company driven by 1,300 talented professionals across Cyprus, Poland, Portugal, Spain and Serbia. Here, everything moves at rocket speed: driving innovation, pioneering projects, and fast-tracking careers. Together, we turn ideas into action—let’s get started! Key Responsibilities: Ensure transparency of teams performance and value by maintaining process metrics. Coach development teams on Agile best practices, ensuring adherence to Scrum, Kanban, and other Agile methodologies. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, helping teams enhance their efficiency and productivity. Collaborate with Product Owners and stakeholders to ensure backlog refinement and prioritization. Identify and remove impediments that hinder team progress, ensuring smooth workflow. Utilize Agile tools (e.g., JIRA, Trello) to track team performance and provide data-driven insights. Support cross-functional and distributed teams, ensuring seamless communication and alignment. Promote a self-organizing team environment, mentoring team members to enhance collaboration and accountability. Requirements: Certified ScrumMaster (CSM) or Professional Scrum Master (PSM) certification (additional certifications like Kanban Management, Flight Levels, PSM II, or OKR are a plus). 4+ years of experience as a Scrum Master in Agile software development environments. Strong understanding of Scrum, Kanban, and Agile principles with hands-on implementation experience. Proficiency in Agile tools such as JIRA, Trello, or similar project management software. Excellent communication, facilitation, and documentation skills. Strong problem-solving, decision-making, and conflict resolution abilities. Experience working with cross-functional and geographically distributed teams. Leadership and mentoring skills to help teams reach self-sufficiency. Passion for continuous learning and staying up to date with industry trends in Agile methodologies. ✅ We offer excellent benefits, including but not limited to: Learning and development opportunities and interesting, challenging tasks. 📚 Opportunity to develop language skills, with partial compensation for the cost of English classes (for localisation purposes). 🏥 Global coverage health insurance. 🏝 Time for proper rest, with 20 working days of annual vacation and additional paid sick days. 📈 Competitive remuneration level with annual review. 🤝 Team-building activities.. Bold moves start here. Make yours. Apply today!

title: New Product Introduction (NPI) Senior Expert
description: About the job Who We Are We are proud to announce the launch of our cell manufacturing facility in Valencia. This is more than just a job – it’s a unique opportunity to shape the future of sustainable energy. Join us as we ramp up operations and help build a world-class company At PowerCo, we believe in fostering an environment where ambition meets collaboration, and where flexibility and creativity thrive. You'll be part of a diverse, talented team that is shaping the future of battery production. You’ll have the chance to advance your career while working alongside passionate colleagues who share a vision of making a lasting impact on the world. Are you ready to be part of something exciting? Power up your career with us Your Role And Key Responsibilities Serve as a strategic point of contact between multiple departments (including operations, quality, and engineering) to drive alignment and ensure seamless communication across teams, ensuring the timely execution of company-wide initiatives. Own the development and execution of project timelines, managing complex schedules to guarantee that critical milestones are met while maintaining flexibility for adjustments as needed. Lead cross-functional task forces by coordinating efforts across departments, facilitating collaboration to deliver high-impact projects on time and within scope.Ensure that intermediate products meet the necessary specifications by aligning the work and expectations across various departments involved in the production process. Identify and assess key risks in the development process, proactively recommending and implementing strategies to mitigate those risks and ensure continuous progress toward project goals.Drive timely decision-making by engaging with key stakeholders and ensuring that decisions are made within the necessary timeframes. Conduct in-depth analyses using Failure Modes, Effects, and Criticality Analysis (FACA) and Root Cause Analysis (RCA) to identify product or process failures and develop proactive corrective actions. Lead the lessons learn from production toward improvement of design and execution of Failure Modes and Effects Analysis (FMEA) to anticipate potential system weaknesses and guide the creation of robust mitigation strategies. Provide strategic oversight on process optimization, conducting thorough analyses of process gaps, proposing improvements, and validating technical solutions to meet both efficiency and quality standards. Oversee and mentor the execution of Design of Experiments (DoEs) and material sampling activities to ensure reliable data collection and statistical rigor in the evaluation of new processes. Spearhead the release process for materials and components, ensuring that all materials meet stringent quality and technical requirements prior to their use in production. Guide troubleshooting and problem-solving efforts related to material changes or specification adjustments, ensuring that issues are resolved promptly to minimize disruption and ensure continuity of operations. Provide expert guidance to manufacturing teams, helping them optimize yield rates and maintain performance excellence by offering targeted technical support and process improvements. Make decisions regarding production deviations at multiple steps in the manufacturing process, ensuring that any deviations from the defined parameters are handled effectively within the scope of the project. Lead technical evaluations of production deviations, analyzing the impact of any anomalies and recommending data-driven solutions to resolve issues while ensuring compliance with production goals. Technical supervise the escalation and evaluation of production deviations that occur at various stages of manufacturing, ensuring that all deviations are addressed with appropriate technical solutions. Champion the development of a technical decision-making framework, proposing and refining a standardized decision matrix to streamline problem-solving across teams, ensuring consistency and efficiency. What You Bring To The Team ≥ 5 yrs development experience in automotive battery cell manufacturer. Experience on projects went through SOP/mass production phase. What Makes You Stand Out Master’s degree in chemistry, material, chemical engineering, mechanical engineering or related field. Please submit your CV in English Possession of a disability certificate of 33% or more is valued, and we encourage individuals of all abilities to apply. Our company is deeply committed to fostering an inclusive environment that embraces neurodiversity, functional diversity, and all facets of individual differences. We believe in the strength of diverse perspectives and are dedicated to creating a workforce where everyone feels welcomed and valued. What To Look Forward To PowerCo Spain a offers a distinctive chance to join a thriving organization renowned for its robust commitment to sustainability and innovation. Immerse yourself in a flexible, collegial, and aspirational workplace. Moreover, propel your career forward alongside a diverse ensemble of gifted colleagues. Secure employment with a compelling compensation package. Join a forward-thinking organization dedicated to environmental responsibility and a sustainable future. 25 vacation days plus an additional PowerDays this year (2025). Thrive in a richly multicultural and varied setting. Embrace a work structure that prioritizes flexibility in scheduling. Seize the chance to become a foundational member of a team poised to expand to over 2,000 individuals.

title: Consultor/a / PM Dynamics BC
description: About the job Desde Q-tech estamos colaborando con una empresa especializada en productos Microsoft. Buscamos un rol mixto entre consultor senior y PM que pueda gestionar clientes de base instalada y hacer crecer la colaboración con ellos. Debe ser un experto en diversas áreas del cliente, que pueda aprender producto propio y que atienda al cliente y desarrolle producto y negocio dentro de los mismos. Debe poder gestionar implementaciones complejas en la base instalada, evolucionarlas y desarrollarlas. Una persona autónoma, dinámica y proactiva que tenga tanto la faceta de consultor/arquitecto funcional como la faceta de gestor del cliente que puede tener un PM. 🧩 Lo que buscamos +5 años de experiencia como senior consultant BC. Valorable que haya sido como consultor de soporte. Áreas de expertise: finanzas, compras, ventas, almacén. Inglés nivel alto. Alto conocimiento de diferentes áreas de BC. Perfil que haya realizado trabajo de gestor o PM de pequeños proyectos. Proactivo, metódico y autónomo, con empatía y comunicación para desarrollar una relación de confianza con el cliente. 🎁 Lo que ofrecemos 💼 Salario fijo: 50.000 € – 55.000 € brutos/año. ⏰ Horario flexible 📈 Desarrollo continuo, formación en tecnologías punteras y plan de carrera real. 🌍 Proyectos de alto impacto tecnológico, con foco en la transformación digital y la innovación. 🤝 Cultura colaborativa, entorno dinámico y acceso a un ecosistema internacional. 💬 Si quieres dejar huella impulsando proyectos que cambian la forma de operar de las empresas, queremos conocerte.

title: LLP - TMS of Tomorrow Project - Quality Manager
description: About the job Join a high-impact transformation journey! We are offering a unique opportunity to be part of a dynamic and proactive team leading a strategic initiative for our logistics operations. If you’re looking for a challenge where your expertise can make a real difference, and where innovation, quality, and teamwork drive results, we’d love to hear from you. Quality Manager Purpose: Quality manager will drive operational excellence, embedding a quality mindset, and supporting the successful acceleration of digital and process transformation initiatives. Responsible for ensuring the quality, compliance, best practices sharing, and continuous improvement of all activities related to the implementation and transformation of system TMS of Tomorrow within LLP operations. Ensure compliance quality standards required to minimize quality costs and maximize customer satisfaction whilst ensuring that procedures and processes. Responsibilities: Define, implement, and monitor quality assurance processes aligned with the TMS of Tomorrow transformation roadmap. Establish quality KPIs, metrics, and control mechanisms to ensure compliance with DSC internal standards, external regulatory and customer requirements. Conduct quality assessments, audits, and readiness reviews throughout project phases (design, build, test, deploy, and stabilize). Support Quality Management activities, ,such as QMS, QBRs, internal and external audits, complaints management and process documentation management. Actively promote best practice methods, tools and standards and support their appropriate application - notably QMS, First Choice core tools, Process Design & Documentation. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (IT, operations, compliance, and external vendors) to ensure consistent quality practices and risk mitigation strategies. Develop and maintain project-specific documentation such as quality plans, procedures, and testing protocols. Ensure change management activities align with quality expectations, including training, user adoption, and feedback loops. Monitor deviations, issues, and non-conformities, and drive root cause analysis and corrective/preventive actions (CAPA). Support validation and qualification activities, as UATs, performance testing, to ensure system readiness. Act as a quality champion and advisor across the project to embed a continuous improvement and customer-focused culture. Qualifications and Experience: Higher education in quality, engineering, logistics or a related field. Minimum 3 years of logistics or operational experience, with at least 1year in quality management withing logistics, supply chain, or system transformation projects. Experience with TMS systems (SAP TM, Oracle TMS, Manhattan Associates) is a strong plus. Excellent problem-solving, communication, and stakeholder engagement skills. Knowledge of quality management standards (ISO 9001, ISO 13485 or GxP) and process excellence methodology (First Choice Tools, Lean or, Six Sigma). Fluent in English; knowledge of additional European languages is a plus. Able to work across multiple regions and adapt in cross-cultural environments. Good communicator, promoter of operations excellence methods & standards with an eye for improvement opportunities. Task and results orientated with attention to detail and a finisher. Good knowledge of MS Office applications. Especially MS Excel, MS Word & MS PowerPoint. Desirable (but not exclusive) Competencies: Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Proactive, hands-on, and result-driven mindset. Experience working in regulated environment or with AEO, ISO or GDP environments is an advantage. Qualifications in Project & Change Management and Supply Chain Management – desirable. Strong understanding of project lifecycle methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid) and change management principles. Geographical Experience Strong cultural awareness and interface skills. Able to work with remote and virtual teams. Requires ca. 25% International travel. Languages Employment country local language English

title: Project Manager - Promotora Inmobiliaria
description: About the job Desde la división Construcción de WeHunt, estamos trabajando con una importante compañía del sector inmobiliario. Nuestro cliente, empresa promotora inmobiliaria dedicada a la gestión y vehiculización de distintos proyectos del sector, busca un Project Manager altamente capacitado para liderar y coordinar los proyectos, asegurando eficiencia, calidad y rentabilidad en cada fase del desarrollo. Funciones principales Gestión integral de proyectos inmobiliarios desde su concepción hasta la entrega. Coordinación de equipos multidisciplinares (arquitectos, ingenieros, constructores, asesores legales). Supervisión de plazos, costos y calidad del proyecto. Gestión de licencias, normativas y documentación legal asociada a cada desarrollo. Análisis de viabilidad técnica, financiera y comercial de los proyectos. Negociación con proveedores y clientes para optimizar resultados. Elaboración de informes y reporting a la dirección. Requisitos (H/M/D) Formación: Arquitectura, Ingeniería Civil Experiencia mínima: 5 años gestionando proyectos inmobiliarios Conocimientos: Urbanismo, legislación inmobiliaria, financiación de proyectos Habilidades: Liderazgo, negociación, toma de decisiones estratégicas. No dudes en aplicar a la oferta si buscas una incorporación a una empresa sólida en el sector inmobiliario con salario competitivo acorde a experiencia y posibilidad de crecimiento y desarrollo profesional.

title: Change manager
description: About the job NTT DATA es un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales diversos que operan en más de 50 países de todo el mundo. Los sectores en los que operamos incluyen: telecomunicaciones, finanzas, industria, servicios públicos, energía, administración pública y salud. Nuestra misión: ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestro equipo y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, siempre buscamos la innovación que nos acerca al futuro. Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia tecnológica, rompiendo paradigmas y aportando soluciones que realmente responden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha llevado a ser una de las 6 principales empresas tecnológicas del mundo. Porque #GreatTech, necesita #GreatPeople, como tú En NTT DATA, buscamos incorporar a gestor de cambios en iCenter para realizar el seguimiento de los diferentes cambios que se deben aplicar a los sistemas y entornos en los que se presta servicio. El Gestor de cambios debe estar alineado con el Responsable de cambios por parte del cliente o, en su defecto, con el Gobierno de cliente que se representa en el propio Comité de cambios. A continuación, se detallan las tareas que realiza el gestor de cambios: Organizar y liderar el comité de gestión de cambios: Preparar y liderar el comité de gestión de cambios. Coordinar las diferentes áreas implicadas en los cambios, tanto internas como externas involucradas en la gestión de un cambio y realizar el Acta del comité de cambios Aprobar cambios: Analizar y aprobar los cambios de un área o entorno. Aquellos cambios que, por su impacto en los sistemas o por su complejidad, pueden necesitar la aprobación por parte del cliente. Si el cliente defina una casuística distinta de aprobación, esta prevalecerá por la descrita en el marco metodológico de iCenter. Cerrar cambios: Revisar la correcta implementación del cambio y realizar el cierre de este. Administrar cambios: Gestionar de manera eficaz el cambio y el proceso. Garantizar que cualquier problema recibe un cambio. Herramientas de gestión de cambios: Definir y fomentar un conjunto de herramientas para impulsar el cambio. Controlar el flujo de vida de un cambio mediante las fases consolidadas en la herramienta. Impulsar la implementación de cambios a través de la integración de recursos, herramientas y nuevas plataformas. Reporting: Producir información e informes con una descripción precisa de los cambios, informando a todos los participantes del comité y compartiéndose en una ruta pública o privada del cliente. Este documento se genera cada vez que se reúne el comité de cambios. Garantizar la redacción y entrega de informes y datos. Velar por el correcto funcionamiento del proceso de gestión de cambios: Mantener actualizada la información y documentación del proceso. Ejecutar las tareas del proceso de cambios de acuerdo con los requisitos estipulados. Apoyar y ayudar a garantizar la aplicación del proceso de gestión del cambio. Coordinar y gestionar las diferentes actividades del proceso de gestión de cambios. Mejorar la eficiencia, efectividad y rendimiento del proceso. Gestionar las escaladas en el proceso de cambios.Aviso, si procede, a los usuarios finales afectados por un cambio. ¿Qué podemos ofrecerte? ·Estabilidad con un Contrato indefinido. ·Desarrollo profesional personalizado donde podrás diseñar tu propio camino en función de tus intereses, talento y experiencia. · Un Modelo de Reconocimiento basado en tu contribución. ·Formación desde el primer día dirigido a la especialización y empoderamiento. ·Plan de certificaciones en tu área de conocimiento ·Salario en función de la experiencia y grado de madurez profesional basado en la equidad. · Modelo de teletrabajo híbrido y flexible que permite la conciliación y el bienestar emocional. · Trabajar en un buen ambiente de equipo donde podrás aprender para desarrollarte y compartir en un entorno de Igualdad, Inclusión y Diversidad. ·Beneficios sociales, Clubs de ocio/deportivos/descuentos/ayuda Teletrabajo, Summer Party y más actividades que fomentan la conexión del talento diverso bajo el Movimiento Digital Lovers en NTT! En NTT DATA creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad. Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad. #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

title: Internship - Program Management 1 1
description: About the job Req ID: 128142 Remote Position: No Region: Europe Country: Spain State/Province: La Pobla De Vallbona City: Valencia General Overview Functional Area: Operations (OPS) Career Stream: Customer Program Management (CPM) Role: Administrator 1 Job Title: Customer Program Management Administrator 1 Job Code: AD1-OPS-CPM Job Level: Level 04 Direct/Indirect Indicator: Indirect Summary Detailed Description Company: Celestica Valencia S.A. Celestica is a Canadian company, world leader in the electronic manufacturing sector. The plant in Valencia focuses its activities in the Aerospace, Industrial and Healthcare areas, producing and assembling high complexity products. The main differentiator in Valencia facilities are its design capabilities and the various engineering services that it can provide to its customers, creating a differential value beyond the regular electronic manufacturing services. Area/Department: Program Management The Program Management department is responsible for coordinating the Customer and the Introduction of New Projects. Therefore is the best place to implement Project Management methodologies and build trusted relationships with our Customers. Program Management department provides a 360º visibility of the operative to the team members and coordinate a Team to meet the goals. Name of the position: Program Management Student Program Management: Internship During the internship these skills will be developed: Understand and develop skills for these different systems: New Product Introduction and Project Management by Phases, deliverables and Phase Gate Exit reviews Generate reports that add value to the compliance of the system. Learn the precise tools to follow up actions and achieve milestones. Participate in Standardization Work activities Work in a multinational company with their systems and procedures. Ability to build internal and external relationships that require exchanging information and providing some explanations in a problem solving environment. Earn trust and confidence to work under minimum Supervision. Resolving tasks where considerable judgment and initiative are required in resolving problems and making recommendations. If any situation is not covered by standard processes, procedures and methods, it will be supported by the manager or subject matter expert. Knowledge/Skills/Competencies: Read and write English is required to understand and create global procedures, spoken English desirable. Strong knowledge of computer applications and the ability to accurately perform tasks in some or all of the following applications: Access, Excel, Word and PowerPoint. Use to work with Data Management Knowledge of project management, mechanical, electrical, electromechanical Ability to evaluate and prioritize a variety of tasks to ensure their timely and accurate completion, while working with frequent and ongoing interruptions. Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with a wide variety of internal and external customers. Ability to efficiently organize, file and retrieve hard copy and electronic information relating to the business of the work unit. Physical Demands Duties of this position are generally performed in a normal office environment. Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed data. Repetitive manual movements (e.g., data entry, using a computer mouse, using a calculator, etc.) are frequently required. Typical Experience: Student in practice Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Physical Demands Typical Experience Typical Education Notes This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time. Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law). At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them. Company Overview Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud. Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers. Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted. Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

title: Project Manager
description: About the job Ready to shape the future of fun? At Vortex, we have been bringing communities, businesses, and families together with innovative aquatic structures since 1995. We are proud to have created 10 000 custom installations spanning 50 countries and 5 continents! Vortex creates precious memories for thousands of families around the world every day. If you want an exciting career in an environment that values innovation and collaboration, we’d love to hear from you. We welcome all applicants and are committed to diversity, equity and ensuring everyone is empowered to succeed. The Project Manager works with our internal team, distributors, contractors, and end clients to ensure the proper execution of installations and commissioning, as well as client training and general troubleshooting both onsite and remotely. Responsibilities Project Management Manage installations from several weeks before work begins until project completion, acting as the main point of contact with the client/contractor/subcontractor team. Build and maintain relationships with subcontractors, site supervisors, and clients to ensure adherence to installation methodology, commissioning, and training protocols. On-site Technical Support Must be available to travel to project sites across Spain, with occasional travel within Europe. Coordinate subcontractors and Vortex’s own installation team to ensure equipment is installed according to Vortex's quality standards. Hold site meetings and make on-the-ground decisions with the site supervisor or client. Document installation progress and complete a final report on the technical support provided. Conduct thorough site inspections prior to system activation. Provide comprehensive training to operators on initial system start-up and shutdown procedures. Obtain client sign-off on completed projects. Provide feedback and potential solutions to the product development team regarding recurring issues. Communicate with the remote technical support team to request necessary spare/additional parts. Remote Technical Support (phone, email) – when not on-site Respond to and resolve client (distributor, contractor, or end client) inquiries via phone or email. Log calls and reports in the appropriate system. Assess whether an on-site visit is necessary. Follow up with the internal design team and discuss possible solutions. Other Duties Assist in training clients and certified installers, including developing materials, scheduling, and facilitating sessions. Participate in continuous improvement of internal processes. Help create user guides and maintenance manuals. Requirements Willingness to travel throughout Spain and occasionally within Europe. Degree in Mechanical Engineering. Solid general knowledge of construction, with a focus on plumbing, civil works, and electrical systems. Ability to read and produce technical drawings (AutoCAD). Ability to interact with contractors and clients. Ability to train others on technical matters. Strong communication skills. Project management skills. Strong time management and prioritization abilities. Strong problem-solving skills. Ability to work across different business cultures. Well-developed interpersonal skills. Positive, team-oriented attitude. Computer literacy. Safety-oriented. Fluent in spoken and written English (mandatory). Splash into fun!

title: CX Operations & Automation Project Manager
description: About the job Groupon is a marketplace where customers discover new experiences and services everyday and local businesses thrive. To date we have worked with over a million merchant partners worldwide, connecting over 16 million customers with deals across various categories. In a world often dominated by e-commerce giants, we stand out as one of the few platforms uniquely committed to helping local businesses succeed on a performance basis. Groupon is on a radical journey to transform our business with relentless pursuit of results. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. The impact here can be immediate due to our scale and the speed of our transformation. We're a "best of both worlds" kind of company. We're big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. At Groupon, we make it easy for people to discover the best local businesses at unbeatable prices. We’re reinventing the small business world by equipping merchants with tailored deal campaigns, payment processing solutions, and tools that help them run their operations more effectively. Our mission: to empower businesses and enhance the customer experience. 🚀 The Role The CX Operations & Automation Project Manager will drive strategic initiatives focused on improving refund processes, enhancing self-service capabilities, and managing key operational workflows. This role combines project management, process design, and automation strategy to support a customer-first approach across our operations. We're looking for someone with a background in customer service or retail operations, strong experience with Salesforce, and a keen interest in automation tools like chatbots or AI. If you’re a natural problem-solver with a passion for structuring complex challenges, thrive under pressure, and excel at bringing teams together to hit bold goals, this could be your perfect next step. 📍 Hybrid from Madrid, Valencia, Warsaw or Prague What You’ll Do 📋 End-to-End Project Ownership Lead multiple high-impact, concurrent initiatives from planning to full execution, ensuring delivery on time and within scope. 📊 KPI-Driven Performance Define, track, and analyze operational metrics to identify trends, opportunities, and risks, turning insights into actionable improvements. 🏗️ Process Design & Optimisation Develop, maintain, and enhance operational processes that boost efficiency, scalability, and customer satisfaction. 🤝 Cross-Functional Collaboration Work closely with global teams to drive alignment, manage stakeholders, and ensure seamless project delivery. 🧪 Tool & Innovation Testing Trial new platforms, AI tools, and automation solutions to improve workflows and performance. 📈 Global CX Impact Support and optimize multi-region support models to deliver world-class customer service. What We’re Looking For ✅ Experience: 5+ years in retail, e-commerce, or other performance-driven industries. Proven track record in project management with cross-functional leadership. Experience in global CX operations or multi-region support models. 📚 Education & Credentials: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Operations, Engineering, or related field (preferred). Project Management certifications (PMP, Agile, Scrum) are a plus. 🛠️ Skills & Competencies: Strong problem-solving and structured thinking. Advanced organisational skills and comfort with Asana (required). Proficient in data analysis using Excel/Google Sheets. Experience with dashboards, trend analysis, and process improvement. Fluency in English, written and spoken. Spanish, Polish, or Czech would be an advantage ✨ Bonus Points For: Familiarity with AI tools, chatbots, and automation. Experience with Salesforce Service Cloud, Tableau, or similar platforms. Chatbot development exposure. Why Join Us? At Groupon, you’ll be part of a passionate, globally connected team that values agility, innovation, and impact. You’ll have the freedom to own projects, experiment with new approaches, and see the results of your work in real-time. If you’re ready to drive operational excellence at a global scale, we’d love to hear from you. Groupon is an AI-First Company We’re committed to building smarter, faster, and more innovative ways of working—and AI plays a key role in how we get there. We encourage candidates to leverage AI tools during the hiring process where it adds value, and we’re always keen to hear how technology improves the way you work. If you’re passionate about AI or curious to explore how it can elevate your role—you’ll be right at home here. Groupon’s purpose is to build strong communities through thriving small businesses. To learn more about the world’s largest local e-commerce marketplace, click here. You can also find out more about us in the latest Groupon news as well as learning about our DEI approach. If all of this sounds like something that’s a great fit for you, then click apply and join us on a mission to become the ultimate destination for local experiences and services. Beware of Recruitment Fraud: Groupon follows a merit-based recruitment process without charging job seekers any fees. We've noticed an increase in recruitment fraud, including fake job postings and fraudulent interviews and job offers aimed at stealing personal information or money. Be cautious of individuals falsely representing Groupon's Talent Acquisition team with fake job offers. If you encounter any suspicious job offers or interview calls demanding money, recognize these as scams. Groupon is not responsible for losses from such dealings. For legitimate job openings (and a sneak peek into life at Groupon), always check our official career website at Groupon Careers

title: Coordinador/a Lider técnico/a de proyectos IT/Software
description: About the job Descripción del empleo En Inetum Valencia abrimos proceso de selección para incorporar un perfil senior que tenga experiencia en la coordinación técnica de proyectos, siendo el punto de interacción entre el equipo técnico, el jefe o jefa de proyecto y el cliente. Con experiencia en el mundo de transportes, será responsable de la gestión de las personas asignadas a los proyectos de nuestro cliente en Valencia, coordinando las tareas diarias de los proyectos, reportando el avance al jefe de proyecto, coordinando las actividades con el mismo, y velando por la correcta ejecución del proyecto y el cumplimiento de los objetivos. Experiencia técnica en transportes, gestión de personas y gestión técnica de proyectos. Se valorarán profesionales que destaquen en liderazgo de equipos, autonomía y proactividad. Requisitos Experiencia en cargo similar. Información adicional En Inetum Valencia abrimos proceso de selección para incorporar un perfil senior que tenga experiencia en la coordinación técnica de proyectos, siendo el punto de interacción entre el equipo técnico, el jefe o jefa de proyecto y el cliente. Con experiencia en el mundo de transportes, será responsable de la gestión de las personas asignadas a los proyectos de nuestro cliente en Valencia, coordinando las tareas diarias de los proyectos, reportando el avance al jefe de proyecto, coordinando las actividades con el mismo, y velando por la correcta ejecución del proyecto y el cumplimiento de los objetivos. Experiencia técnica en transportes, gestión de personas y gestión técnica de proyectos. Se valorarán profesionales que destaquen en liderazgo de equipos, autonomía y proactividad.

title: Senior SAP QM/PM Consultant
description: About the job Are you ready to apply your SAP expertise in a company that prides itself on excellence and quality? At Westernacher Consulting, you’ll have the opportunity to work on large-scale, challenging projects alongside top-tier experts. To complement our team in Spain, we are looking for a SAP Senior QM/PM Consultant. Your Role: Deliver of SAP transformation projects as a consultant, including assessment of business needs, evaluation of requirements, fit-to-standard workshops, and designing solutions within SAP Lead the functional and technical design, documentation, configuration, testing, and deployment of SAP QM/ PM modules Facilitate solution design workshops with business stakeholders, converting complex requirements into SAP-effective solutions Collaborate with national and international projects Participate in pre-sales activities for both local and regional opportunities when needed Contribute to global SAP S/4HANA programs within the Digital Core Practice. Elaborate and design functional specifications (RICEFW) Design and implement data migration solutions for SAP QM/PM master data Keep up-to-date with SAP standards, tools, and trends, identifying opportunities for ongoing improvements Your skills and experience: 5+ years of relevant experience implementing SAP QM (required) and PM modules Good knowledge of the end-to-end manufacturing execution scenarios within the integration with quality management (e.g., GxP) and asset maintenance processes Functional and technical proficiency in implementing SAP solutions for greenfield and rollout projects, with proven experience in full-cycle SAP project implementations Cross-module experience and knowledge of integrations of the quality processes with other SAP modules, such as PP, PM, MM, SD, and EWM Experience and knowledge of integrating SAP QM with non-SAP applications, such as LIMS Proven experience in industries such as chemical, automotive, and FMCG; experience in the pharmaceutical industry is an advantage Excellent skills in implementing technology-enabled business solutions for clients Great communication and customer-management skills SAP S/4HANA Public or Private Cloud experience is an advantage. Exceptional communication skills in Spanish and English (other languages - especially French and German - are an advantage) Available to travel if the project requires it Preferred Skills Knowledge of CSV (Computer System Validation) concepts Certification in the SAP QM and/or SAP PM modules Project management and pre-sales experience Our promise: A diverse and versatile role with ample opportunities to shape your work in a 100% employee-owned company Competitive remuneration package Inspiring and exciting, innovative working environment Partnership culture with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and opportunity for partnership/co-ownership Environment of open communication, trust and regular feedback International company culture and minimal hierarchical structure Chance to work on complex projects from different industries and add to your business process knowhow Flexible working hours and hybrid working model Interested? Then, don't hesitate to apply! This is WE: Committed to innovation, since 1969 Westernacher Consulting operates worldwide, with more than 1000 consultants in Europe, Asia and the Americas. We provide global business and SAP consulting, serving medium to large sized enterprises striving for innovation, operational excellence and profitable, sustainable growth. Headquartered in Heidelberg, Germany, Westernacher Consulting is the global leader in business process and technology innovation. Living, working, and operating in partnership. We are inquisitive, creative thinkers with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. We question new ways of working, think differently and are willing to try out new approaches to create value and innovation for our customers. All of this makes us pioneers in our field and keeps us responsive, quality-focused and results-oriented. Westernacher is a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Westernacher is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Project Manager – Client integrations
description: About the job The Apex Group was established in Bermuda in 2003 and is now one of the world’s largest fund administration and middle office solutions providers. Our business is unique in its ability to reach globally, service locally and provide cross-jurisdictional services. With our clients at the heart of everything we do, our hard-working team has successfully delivered on an unprecedented growth and transformation journey, and we are now represented by over circa 13,000 employees across 112 offices worldwide.Your career with us should reflect your energy and passion. That’s why, at Apex Group, we will do more than simply ‘empower’ you. We will work to supercharge your unique skills and experience. Take the lead and we’ll give you the support you need to be at the top of your game. And we offer you the freedom to be a positive disrupter and turn big ideas into bold, industry-changing realities. For our business, for clients, and for you Functional Title: Client Onboarding Specialist Reports to: Regional Head of Client Onboarding On-site role Outline of position The primary responsibilities of this position are: Supporting the client onboarding process by coordinating the key steps to ensure a seamless transition from Sales to Business-As-Usual (BAU); Act as a first point of contact for client queries relating to onboarding matters; Coordinating client adoptions, account openings, review of fund offering documentation and legal agreements, internal system set ups, and project planning; Assisting in project coordination, working with internal teams including Service Delivery, Sales, Legal, Compliance, and Technology teams; As part of the onboarding process, the candidate will be expected to provide regular status updates to new clients and internal parties. Weekly project calls should be held with stakeholders and project plans should be maintained to track progress; Supporting the drafting and review of client service agreements; Interacting with the Legal Department on template management and control; Assisting in the internal review process across different product and service lines within the fund administration, depository and other product lines; Provide day to day client onboarding advice across all Apex Group business lines to best meet their business needs and maintaining good working relationships through active communication, facilitation and teamwork; Assisting with the development and execution of ad hoc projects; Support the wider onboarding team where required. Will report to the Regional Head of Client Onboarding. Required Skills A degree, preferably in Law, Business, Finance or a related field; A minimum of 1-3 years of experience within the investment funds industry; Understanding of the funds industry, experience of different fund structures, domiciles and regulatory requirements is an advantage; Some familiarity with fund structuring issues, legal terminology and fund services agreements; Knowledge on Client KYC requirements is an advantage; Be highly motivated and a self-starter with the ability to work semi-supervised supporting a fast-paced dynamic business; Possess team spirit and enthusiasm with the capacity to build strong client relationships; Client facing experience; Project management skills; Excellent organisational, communication and interpersonal skills and a truly client servicing mindset; Professional level of English (spoken and written), Swedish language is an advantage. What you will get in return: A genuinely unique opportunity to be part of an expanding large global business Opportunities for personal and professional development A multinational work environment with challenging tasks; A competitive remuneration package. Disclaimer: Unsolicited CVs sent to Apex (Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Managers) by recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position. Apex operates a direct sourcing model and where agency assistance is required, the Talent Acquisition team will engage directly with our exclusive recruitment partners.

title: Operational Excellence Manager - 1014784576
description: About the job We are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Operational Excellence Manager to join our team. The successful candidate will be instrumental in driving efficiency, streamlining processes, and ensuring consistent high-quality delivery across our production lifecycle. This role requires a strong understanding of production methodologies, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives. If you are a passionate problem-solver with a knack for process optimization and a genuine interest in leveraging technology to achieve operational excellence, we have the perfect job for you! A Little Bit About Us Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 800 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe. Requirements How will you make a difference Identify and analyze bottlenecks and inefficiencies within the production lifecycle Develop and implement process improvements using methodologies like Agile, Lean, and Six Sigma Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track operational performance and identify areas for improvement. Lead cross-functional initiatives to optimize workflows, improve communication, and enhance collaboration Document and standardize processes to ensure consistency and repeatability Facilitate continuous improvement workshops and training sessions Manage and optimize our project management tools and methodologies Ensure adherence to quality standards and best practices Prepare and present regular reports on operational performance and improvement initiatives Manage risk assessments and develop mitigation strategies Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field +5 years of experience in operational excellence, process improvement, or project management. Operational consulting experience - Big 4 or Top-tier consulting or equivalent experience.. Strong understanding of software development methodologies (Agile, Scrum, Kanban) Experience with project management tools (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and CI/CD pipelines Proficiency in data analysis and reporting tools Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams. Advanced level in English and Spanish (written and spoken), ideally with experience in international environments Certification in Lean Six Sigma is a plus Benefits Growth and career development At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities Work-Life balance Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer! Comprehensive benefits Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services) 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options—no blackout days! Unique Perks If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it coplete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences. Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project! Location You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you. If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions. The personal data you provide will be processed in order to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by writing to our address (Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta. Barcelona. 08005) or to the email address protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, attaching to your request a document that can validate your identity.

title: Project Key Account Manager -Eastern Spain
description: About the job About Us GROHE is the world's leading provider of sanitary fittings and a global brand, dedicated to providing innovative water products. For many decades, GROHE has been committed to the brand values of technology, quality, design and sustainability that all illustrate GROHE's commitment to creating exceptional experiences and to delivering "Pure Freude an Wasser". With its engineering, innovation and design activities firmly anchored in Germany, GROHE products bear the badge of quality "Made in Germany", ultimately strengthening the customers’ confidence in the brand. In 2014, GROHE became part of the LIXIL Corporation, a publicly listed company on the Tokyo Stock Exchange. Job description This position will be responsible for target market exploration to identify new prospects and business opportunities with endorsers such as national accounts, installations, architects, designers, installers, public and private clients. Responsibilities: Explore new channel opportunities and/or seek new ways to promote innovative products Generate new business opportunities in all existing channels, with a creative approach Study and identify unconventional ways to promote the current portfolio Supervise all players in the area of competence Promote growth in the area through solutions in cooperation with sales agents, agencies and ASMs. Manage internal CRM and prepare appropriate reports for the assigned area/zone Essential Skills/Competencies: University studies in architecture or interior design or engineering Min 5 years’ experience in similar positions Strong English and Spanish (written and spoken) Collaborative and results oriented approach Forward thinking and strong strategic planning skills Experience in identifying and implementing improvements to workflow and operational efficiency Strong knowledge of CRM system(s) and the Google package Knowledge of investors and residential developers and hospitality businesses (hotel chains) in Spain Knowledge of Salesforce (nice to have) KPIs/Metrics: Number of visits Opportunities generated Portfolio of contacts Sales LIXIL A HOME FOR EVERYONE. Every person on the planet dreams of a better home. And at LIXIL, we’re committed to making better homes a reality for everyone, everywhere. We make it happen with pioneering water and housing technology solutions. Home to world leading brands like INAX, American Standard, GROHE, TOSTEM and many more, we touch the lives of more than a billion people each day, transforming houses into homes. Our planet is the home we all share. So how we do business matters. Our inclusive and empowering culture, entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to having a positive impact on the planet are integral to our business strategy. LIXIL today is on a journey of transformation. The world around us is changing. Technological advances. Evolving needs. New demographics. Shifting expectations. These changes serve as opportunities for solutions to be discovered, and to unlock progress for all. We invite you to make this journey with us. It is as challenging as it is inspiring. Together we can shape the future of living. We’re a home for growth, for imagination, for creativity. A home for your talent and ambition. A home for everyone. LIXIL is an equal opportunity employer, with an inclusive culture that embraces diversity. We will consider all qualified applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, nationality or national origin, color, religion or beliefs, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or disability status.

title: EU Project Manager
description: About the job ¡¡Incubadora CON VALORES estamos contratando!! Únete. La primera incubadora para personas en riesgo de exclusión apoyada por el mundo empresarial estamos buscando: TÉCNICO/A DE AYUDAS Lugar de trabajo: Valencia (España) (imprescindible en Valencia Capital o a una distancia no mayor de 50 km) Modalidad hibrida (parte online y parte presencial, pero imprescindible estar en Valencia) Sueldo: 20.188,80€ bruto/anual Contrato indefinido con prueba de seis meses Incubadora CON VALORES tiene como objetivo crear medios de vida para personas en riesgo de exclusión, a través del emprendimiento, apoyada por el mundo empresarial. Actualmente, solo en España, hay 12 millones de personas en esta delicada situación ¿Te motiva el objetivo de echarles una mano? Si es así, el puesto que buscamos tiene como objetivo general apoyar en la obtención y gestión de la financiación europea de la Asociación. La persona identificará las convocatorias en las que encajemos, las analizará, redactará y presentará y finalmente las justificará. Que esperamos que hagas… 1. Búsqueda de convocatorias de ayudas donde poder presentar los proyectos de la Asociación (locales, autonómicas, nacionales, de cooperación y sobretodo europeas e internacionales) 2. Redacción de memorias de proyectos para presentar a las convocatorias previamente identificadas 3. Seguimiento y justificación de los proyectos 4. Control económico de los proyectos de la Asociación (contabilización de los gastos, facturas, ingresos,, etc.) 5. Apoyo en otras tareas que requiera la Asociación: con los emprendedor@s, eventos, con la ejecución de los proyectos, etc. Buscamos un/a profesional CON VALORES… 1. Competencias profesionales: • Imprescindible: Experiencia en la redacción y gestión de proyectos autonómicos, nacionales, de cooperación y sobretodo europeos Buena capacidad de redacción, de generar contenido de valor en las propuestas, de creación de matrices de marco lógico Buena capacidad de planificación de tareas a la hora de ejecutar los proyectos Rigurosidad y orden a la hora de justificar los proyectos y sus gastos Capacidad de crear buenas relaciones con los diferentes partners para que nos inviten tambien a sus proyectos y generar eventos a los que acudan Buen nivel de inglés (C1) • Valorable: Experiencia en convocatorias internacionales (AMIF, fondos ONU, EuropeAid, CERV, bancos de desarrollo, etc..) Valorable otros idiomas: francés, árabe, etc. Valorable haber realizado voluntariado 2. Competencias personales: - Alta motivación por trabajar en el ámbito de la Acción Social - Ritmo alto de trabajo, muy enfocado a objetivos concretos y planificados - Empatía con personas en situaciones complicadas, sensibilidad social y que crea que una economía más humana y solidaria es posible. - Capacidad de trabajo con un grupo de diversos orígenes culturales - Capacidad creativa y resolutiva para realizar múltiples tareas - Persona autónoma y con iniciativa - Capacidad para trabajar en equipo, a una rápida velocidad y en una organización en constante crecimiento (empezamos hace unos años en Valencia, ya estamos incubando a personas en 22 países de Latinoamérica y en el 2024 haremos una primera edición en inglés... y después será Frances, Árabe, etc... ¿te apetece este ritmo? si es que sí, porque llevar este ritmo por algo que tiene PROPOSITO te encanta, perfecto, estás en el sitio ideal, si lo que buscas es estar tranquilo... no es tu sitio este 😊) Que ofrecemos… 1. Salario bruto anual: 20.188,80 € 2. Tipo de Jornada: Jornada completa, 40 horas semanales 3. Duración del contrato: Contrato indefinido, con prueba de seis meses 4. Lugar: Actualmente, 30% presencial en Valencia ciudad y 70% teletrabajo 5. Fecha prevista de incorporación: A mediados de marzo 6. Horario: Lunes a Jueves de 9h a 14h y de 15h a 18:30h y los viernes de 9h a 15h 8. Formación: creemos en el desarrollo profesional de las personas, por ello apostaremos por tu formación. 9. Otros conceptos menos materiales, pero para nosotros muy valiosos: • Incorporación a un proyecto con altísimo impacto social, donde hacer crecer TU TALENTO PROFESIONAL, al tiempo que creas IMPACTO DIRECTO a través del trabajo con personas en situaciones complicadas. • Salario emocional elevado. Serás testigo de como se crean vínculos humanos muy fuertes entre las personas que entran en la Incubadora y los profesionales. • Un ambiente acogedor, cálido e inclusivo • Ambiente innovador focalizado en emprendimiento • Formar parte de un emocionante viaje para desarrollar las mejores prácticas para el emprendimiento inclusivo a nivel mundial • Integrarte en la Familia CON VALORES, una potente comunidad a nivel mundial de emprendedores, mentores y ongs unida por vínculos emocionales que se crean durante el programa. Una comunidad abierta, colaborativa y con ganas de construir una economía mas social y humana. Y unos profesionales voluntarios con experiencia de alto nivel del mundo empresarial, que han descubierto la satisfacción de apoyar a otras personas 😊 Si te apetece conocernos un poco mejor mira nuestro canal: https://www.youtube.com/@incubadoraconvalores/

title: Chargé de projet
location: Cuart de les Valls, Valencian Community, Spain
description: About the job Administration Sainte-Marie, Québec Temps plein Postule ici! Numéro de référence : 753 Les projets, c’est ton champ de compétence ? Tu transformes les idées en actions concrètes? Tel un chef d’orchestre, tu sais harmoniser les talents, les technologies et les ambitions pour faire vibrer chaque initiative au rythme de l’innovation. Tu veux être au cœur de projets porteurs qui façonnent l’avenir d’une coopérative d’envergure? De l’optimisation des processus à l’intégration de solutions numériques, en passant par le développement d’applications et les projets de construction, tu es le moteur du changement. Ton leadership, ta créativité et ta rigueur propulsent les équipes vers des résultats durables et alignés sur la vision stratégique. Viens laisser ton empreinte dans notre champ, au sein de notre équipe corpo ! Postule dès maintenant ! Ton champ d’expertise Tu as piloté des projets pendant au moins trois ans ? Ça te permettra de récolter ce poste. Une formation en gestion de projet sera un atout. Ton champ de responsabilités En Tant Que Chargé(e) De Projet Tu guides les équipes internes dans l’analyse des besoins, identifies des opportunités d’optimisation et proposes des solutions créatives qui répondent aux ambitions de l’organisation. Tu planifies, organises et supervises des projets, incluant l’amélioration des processus d’affaires, le développement d’outils numériques, l’intégration de logiciels, les projets de construction et des initiatives d’innovation visionnaires. Tu élabores des plans de projet précis, intégrant échéanciers, budgets, ressources humaines et matérielles, tout en assurant un suivi rigoureux pour garantir leur succès. Tu collabores étroitement avec les équipes internes, les fournisseurs et partenaires pour aligner les attentes, favoriser une communication fluide et maximiser la satisfaction tout au long du projet. Tu coordonnes des équipes multidisciplinaires, favorisant la synergie et l’atteinte des objectifs, tout en amplifiant l’impact des projets grâce à ton leadership. Tu produis des rapports d’avancement clairs, identifies les risques potentiels et mets en œuvre des solutions proactives pour maintenir les projets sur la bonne voie. Tu participes à l’évaluation post-projet afin d’améliorer les pratiques de gestion et de contribuer à l’excellence organisationnelle. Un terrain fertile aux nombreux avantages Activités de mobilisation Allocation pour cellulaire Alternance entre présentiel et télétravail Assurances collectives avec participation financière de l’employeur Comité santé mieux-être Congés personnels et maladie Ententes corporatives (cellulaire, spa, hôtel, gym) Formations complètes et rémunérées Possibilités d'avancement Programme d'aide aux employés Programme de reconnaissance Rabais coéquipiers en succursales Avantis Régime de retraite Régime d’investissement coopératif Rémunération variable Service de télémédecine 24/7 pour toi et ta famille Ta seconde famille Viens grandir au sein de la grande famille Avantis Coopérative. C’est un milieu de choix pour cultiver ton champ d'appartenance à une équipe unie et solidaire, où l'entraide et la bienveillance font pousser les projets communs. Avantis Coopérative, c’est une famille plus de 1 200 coéquipiers passionnés œuvrant dans plus de 90 places d’affaires, opérées sous différentes bannières telles que Sollio Agriculture, BMR, New Holland et Sonic. Cultive avec nous l’esprit coop Tu travailles pour les familles, les producteurs agricoles et les entrepreneurs de ta région. Tu contribues à redonner à la communauté. Tu es le(la) coéquipier(ère) d’une grande famille qui prône les valeurs d’esprit de famille, d’intégrité, d’audace et d’engagement. On t’attend avec impatience ! Postule ici! Recommande-nous un coéquipier La famille Avantis, par ses valeurs et ses gestes, désire contribuer à faire de notre coopérative une référence inspirante, un milieu de travail rassembleur et inclusif où chacun, peu importe sa différence, peut grandir et s’épanouir à son plein potentiel!

title: Logistic Automation Project Manager
description: About the job Descripción del puesto: ¿Cómo sería tu día a día? Diseñar e implementar soluciones de automatización logística interna, incluyendo AGVs, sistemas de transporte automático, almacenes verticales y sistemas de picking robotizado. Liderar proyectos de automatización de principio a fin, incluyendo análisis de viabilidad, definición de requerimientos, selección de proveedores, planificación, ejecución y validación. Colaborar con los departamentos de Logística, Producción, IT y Mantenimiento para asegurar la integración de los sistemas automáticos con los procesos existentes y los sistemas ERP/MES. Supervisar la instalación, configuración y puesta en marcha de los sistemas automáticos, asegurando el cumplimiento de los estándares técnicos, de seguridad y de calidad. Gestionar la documentación técnica de los proyectos, incluyendo planos, especificaciones funcionales, cronogramas, manuales de operación y protocolos de validación. Realizar análisis de datos logísticos y de rendimiento de los sistemas automáticos, proponiendo mejoras continuas basadas en KPIs operativos. Coordinar con proveedores tecnológicos y empresas integradoras, asegurando el cumplimiento de plazos, costes y especificaciones técnicas. Formar y dar soporte técnico a los equipos de logística y mantenimiento, garantizando el correcto uso y mantenimiento de los sistemas automatizados. Gestión del tiempo y asistencia de toda la plantilla bajo su responsabilidad, gestionando y liderando y desarrollo del talento interno, sirviéndose de los procesos de recursos humanos para ello. Descripción del perfil: ¿Qué esperamos de ti? Grado en Ingeniería Industrial, Mecatrónica, Automatización o similar. Formación en Logística, Gestión de Proyectos (PMI, PRINCE2) o Industria 4.0 (deseable). Mínimo 5 años de experiencia en entornos industriales, con al menos 3 en proyectos de automatización logística. Experiencia en implantación de AGVs, transportadores automáticos, almacenes automáticos o similares. Conocimiento de procesos logísticos internos en entornos de fabricación. Experiencia en gestión de proyectos técnicos multidisciplinares. Ofrecemos: ¿Cuál es nuestro propósito? Contribuir al desarrollo de la tecnología para generar energía limpia que ayude al medio ambiente guiados por nuestros valores de Excelencia, Innovación, Flexibilidad y Sostenibilidad. ¿Qué nos hace especiales? Contrato indefinido. Horario flexible. Comedor subvencionado. Servicio de autobús gratuito de Valencia al Campus PE. Gimnasio propio en las instalaciones. Parking de Cargadores. Apostamos por la Formación a través de nuestro departamento de Universidad Corporativa. Welcome to PE Generation! En Power Electronics valoramos a las personas por su aportación de valor profesional formando parte de nuestra cultura empresarial los principios de Integridad, Igualdad, Transparencia y Compromiso cívico. Power Electronics está comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades en todos los ámbitos y especialmente, en el acceso al empleo y desarrollo profesional, sin discriminar por razón de sexo, estado civil, edad, condición social, religión o convicciones, orientación e identidad sexual, expresión de género, características sexuales, así como por razón de la lengua.

title: Salesforce Project Manager
description: About the job Omega CRM is a Merkle & Dentsu company, leader in development of Customer Experience services, with +20 years of experience in the use of Technology applied to Marketing and providing a unique Customer Relationship with mainly focus on Innovation is looking for a Project Manager. Main duties: Provide support in the pre-sales tasks of assigned accounts: solution design, estimation, planning, and assumptions. Share with the project team the client's vision, objectives, and expectations. Assign and supervise team tasks, managing assignments, vacations, and absences during the project. Manage project progress to ensure deadlines, scope, and budget are met. Facilitate change requests to ensure all parties are informed of schedule and budget impacts. Provide visibility of project progress to the client and Customer Success Manager (CSM). Lead follow-up meetings and steering committees. Alert operations management of potential deviations. Establish communication and risk mitigation plans. Monitor all incoming and outgoing project documentation. Ensure project deliverables adhere to quality standards. Lead project demos for the client. Lead the resolution of issues arising from project implementation. Lead the relationship and pursue customer satisfaction regarding the project. Ensure project objectives are met. Evaluate the project afterward and identify successful and unsuccessful project elements. Responsible for sending customer satisfaction surveys regarding the project. Identify potential Up & Cross-Selling opportunities for the account. Lead team retrospectives and identify potential internal improvements. Participate in the development, training, and supervision of the assigned team, providing guidance to improve their skills. Experience needed: +5 years of experience in PM roles. +3 years participating in end-to-end CRM implementation processes. Experience working with agile methodologies (SCRUM, Jira, etc.). Medium – high level of English. WHAT DO WE OFFER Permanent contract. Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life. Certifications plan. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners. Home Office. You decide and we support you. Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurtant, …). Health insurance. OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention Professional development: Evolve, grow and get where you want to go. About us Omega CRM, a Merkle Company, is a global digital company specialising in accelerating the Business Experience (BX) of our clients through customer-centric solutions, technology, and data – all enhanced by AI. Together with Merkle, we form the largest Customer Experience Management (CXM) agency in Spain, and as part of the dentsu group, we offer end-to-end solutions that integrate media, creativity, content, technology, and strategy to deliver real business impact. With over 23 years of experience, a team of 580+ professionals from 24 nationalities, and 2,500+ certifications, Omega CRM is a recognised leader in the Salesforce ecosystem in Spain. We operate across key industries including Retail, Healthcare, Pharma, Real Estate, Education, and Non-Profit, delivering omnichannel experiences in Customer Service, eCommerce, Marketing, and Analytics. Client satisfaction is at our core (rating: 4.9/5), and we’ve been recognised with awards such as Salesforce Partner of the Year FY23 and Most Innovative Project (Iberia). At Omega CRM, we believe in growth through people – guided by our values: #Talent, #Flexibility, #Commitment, and #Innovation. We grow #Together.

title: PROJECT MANAGER SALESFORCE
company: Aquaservice - Viva Aqua Service Spain S.A.
description: About the job En Aquaservice seguimos creciendo y apostando por el talento. Para Ello, Estamos Buscando Un/a Un Project Manager Para Salesforce Que Estará Ubicado/a En Nuestra Delegación De Paterna (valencia) Donde Sus Principales Funciones Serán Participar en proyectos de Salesforce Service/Sales, tanto proyectos grandes afectando a varias sociedades y países como evolutivo y correctivo. Diseñar y colaborar en el diseño del proyecto con otras áreas de la empresa Interiorizar los objetivos y finalidades del proyecto. Realizar el seguimiento de su ejecución. Toma decisiones sobre acciones y actividades. Testeo y formación a usuarios finales Dar soporte técnico al equipo de proyecto y consultoría interna. Requisitos Experiencia en toma de requerimientos, análisis funcional, parametrización, gestión de incidencias. Experiencia en proyectos con arquitecturas Salesforce/Mulesoft/SAP e integración con canales digitales. Conocimientos funcionales y técnicos avanzados de Salesforce Service/Sales. Valorable conocimiento de integraciones con Contact Center Cloud, preferiblemente Talkdesk o Genesys. Formación específica y certificaciones Salesforce. Se ofrece Jornada completa de lunes a jueves en horario de 8.15h a 17.30h y viernes de 8h a 15h. El trabajo será en formato híbrido realizando 3 días presenciales y 2 de teletrabajo a la semana. Desarrollo profesional en uno de los mejores y más completos equipos de Recursos Humanos. Importantes beneficios sociales: cheque guardería, descuento en seguro médico y fisioterapia, sesiones de psicología online gratuita para todos los empleados, además ¡te invitamos a una fruta y café al día!

title: PROJECT MANAGER PARA SERVICIO DE MANTENIMIENTO EN CA9O (VALENCIA)
description: About the job ¿Te gustaría formar parte de una empresa consolidada en el sector de las instalaciones y en plena expansión? ¿Eres una persona comprometida y con ilusión por afrontar nuevos retos? Si es así, ¡esto te interesa! Germanía es una empresa con una trayectoria de 25 años de experiencia, referente en el sector de las instalaciones y el mantenimiento de las mismas. Seleccionamos un/a PROJECT MANAGER CON EXPERIENCIA para la gestión integral del contrato de mantenimiento de la Ciudad Administrativa 9 de Octubre (CA9O) en Valencia. Tareas Realizará, entre otras, las siguientes funciones: Gestión del cumplimiento del Plan Integral de Mantenimiento Preventivo y Técnico Legal según lo estipulado en contrato y normativas vigentes. Gestión de los recursos humanos necesarios para el cumplimiento de objetivos. Gestión de subcontratas. Gestión de compras, en colaboración con Departamento de Compras. Gestión de stock de repuestos necesarios para el cumplimiento de plazos de entrega contractuales. Realización de presupuestos relacionados con el mantenimiento correctivo así como nuevas instalaciones que soliciten los clientes (mantenimiento modificativo). Control de costes de los expedientes de mantenimiento. Propuestas de mejora en las instalaciones mantenidas (adaptación a nueva reglamentación, obsolescencia de instalaciones, mejoras en eficiencia energética etc). Realización de informes de mantenimiento, según alcance establecido en contrato. Velar por el cumplimiento de los diferentes procedimientos de calidad de la empresa. Interlocución con el cliente. Apoyo al Departamento de Estudios en ofertas de mantenimiento y licitaciones. Requisitos Requisitos: Ingeniero Técnico Industrial, de preferencia con especialidad Construcción e Instalaciones. Formación en PRL, mínimo curso básico 60h. Experiencia mínima de 3 años en puestos similares. Conocimiento de Normativa relativa al mantenimiento de Instalaciones. Manejo de instrumentación necesaria para la revisiones técnico-legales, mediciones de parámetros eléctricos. Interpretación de esquemas eléctrico de fuerza y maniobra. Conocimientos y experiencia en gestión de ejecución de instalaciones de todo tipo, a nivel residencial, terciario e industrial. Conocimiento en aplicaciones GMAO. Conocimientos en sistemas Scada en régimen de conducción. Capacidad de trabajo en equipo y de trato con el cliente. Liderazgo para gestionar el personal del departamento. Experiencia en redacción ofertas y licitaciones de mantenimiento en Sector Público. Carnet de conducir. Beneficios Ofrecemos: Contrato indefinido. Jornada completa. Salario a convenir. Teléfono de empresa. Buen ambiente de trabajo.

title: PROJECT MANAGER SAT
description: About the job DESCRIPCIÓN DEL PUESTO Buscamos Jefe de técnicos de cocinas industriales, rol clave para garantizar un servicio de primer nivel a nuestros clientes y optimizar el rendimiento del equipo técnico. Tu misión principal sería garantizar la excelencia en la atención y soporte técnico, liderando un equipo de técnicos que realice un servicio rápido, eficiente y de calidad. Esto incluye la supervisión de instalaciones, mantenimientos y reparaciones, optimizar los procesos de trabajo y contribuir al crecimiento y reputación de la empresa. FUNCIONES, TAREAS Y RESPONSABILIDADES Liderar y coordinar al equipo de técnicos y montadores. Supervisar la calidad de las intervenciones, técnicas, detectando y ejecutando mejoras en el servicio. Coordinar la programación de intervenciones técnicas y asegurarse de que se cumplan los plazos establecidos. Garantizar la resolución oportuna de las incidencias reportadas por los clientes. Controlar el inventario de herramientas y repuestos, asegurando su disponibilidad y buen estado. PERFÍL IDEAL Mínimo 5 años de experiencia en servicio técnico de equipos profesionales, con al menos 2 años en un rol de liderazgo, en cocinas industriales o sectores técnicos afines. Conocimientos avanzados de electrodomésticos de cocina industrial y capacidad para diagnosticar y reparar fallos técnicos. Capacidad multitarea, de priorización y de adaptación a los cambios. Habilidades de comunicación y capacidad para trabajar en equipo. Habilidades de dirección. Título técnico en Electrónica, Mecánica o campos relacionados con el sector. Flexibilidad para trabajar en horarios variables. BENEFICIOS Remuneración acorde a la responsabilidad. Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional en una empresa en expansión. Disponibilidad de herramientas digitales. Disponibilidad de formación en tecnologías de cocinas industriales. Cobertura de kilometraje, dietas...

title: Service Delivery Manager
description: About the job Join Omada as a Service Delivery Manager – Drive Excellence in Identity & Access Management! Omada is on a fast track to becoming a global leader in Identity and Access Management (IAM). Our recognition as a Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant is a testament to our innovation and excellence. To maintain and elevate our high standards, we are seeking a Service Delivery Manager (SDM) to play a pivotal role in ensuring top-tier customer experience and seamless service delivery. As a Service Delivery Manager, you will oversee customers in the Omada Customer Lifecycle, ensuring the effective management of our Omada Identity Cloud customers. You will be a part of a dynamic team, manage work scheduling, and be responsible for customer retention. Additionally, you will oversee our Service Catalog, ensuring the timely resolution of service requests and incidents. The SDM also manages the Omada Service Catalog and is accountable for the delivery of Service Requests as well as the resolution of Incidents. Key Responsibilities Drive customer satisfaction and retention by delivering best-in-class service. Ensure adherence to committed SLAs/OLAs for Omada Identity Cloud and On-Premise customers and partners. Define, execute, and continuously improve the Service Catalog. Manage the seamless handover from implementation to operations. Lead the Global Knowledge Escalation Process. Facilitate internal and external service communications. Lead the Change Management Board. Provide data-driven reporting to customers. Performance Indicators Incident and Problem Resolution Time Compliance with Omada’s Information Security Management System (ISMS). High customer satisfaction and retention rates. Efficient utilization of Service Delivery Center resources. Consistent delivery of agreed SLAs. What You Bring ITIL Intermediate certification or higher. Understanding of ISO 27001 and SOC2 quality management framework. Experience in establishing and optimizing call center and service management processes.
