We build what works, launch it fast, and make sure it hits. ✅ Responsibilities: ✔️ Requirements Analysis: Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and analyse requirements, ensuring alignment with business goals. ✔️ System Design: Develop detailed system designs, workflows, and technical specifications to meet business needs. ✔️ Collaboration: Work closely with developers, testers, and product teams to ensure successful system implementations. ✔️ Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation, including system requirements, user guides, and technical manuals. ✔️ Testing Support: Support user acceptance testing (UAT) by creating test cases, reviewing results, and facilitating issue resolution. ✅ Requirements: Technical Skills: ✔️ System Analysis: Expertise in gathering, analysing, and documenting business requirements, user stories, and functional specifications. ✔️ System Design: Strong experience in creating system architecture diagrams, workflows, and technical specifications. ✔️ Tools and Technologies: Proficiency in tools such as SQL, UML, BPMN, and requirements management systems (JIRA, Confluence, or similar). ✔️ Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC): Solid understanding of the end-to-end software development lifecycle, Agile methodologies, and related processes. Soft Skills: ✔️ Analytical Thinking: Strong ability to analyse complex business and technical problems, identify root causes, and propose effective solutions. ✔️ Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively collaborate with technical teams, stakeholders, and business users. ✔️ Problem-Solving: Exceptional problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented and structured approach. ✔️ Collaboration: Ability to work in cross-functional teams, bridging the gap between business and technical stakeholders. ✔️ Adaptability: Flexibility to adapt to changing project priorities, technologies, and requirements. ✅ Qualifications: ✔️ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. ✔️ A minimum of 5 years of experience as a System Analyst or in a similar role. ✔️ Proven experience in requirements gathering, system design, and process optimisation. ✔️ Proficiency in SQL, system modelling tools (UML/BPMN), and documentation tools (JIRA, Confluence, or similar). ✔️ Experience working in Agile/Scrum environments. ✔️ Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organisational skills. ✔️ Strong communication and collaboration abilities to work effectively with technical and business teams. ✅ We offer excellent benefits, including but not limited to: 🧑🏻 💻Learning and development opportunities and interesting, challenging tasks; ✈️ Relocation package (tickets, staying in a hotel for 2 weeks); 📚 Opportunity to develop language skills and partial compensation for the cost of language classes; 🎁 Birthday celebration present; 🏝 Time for proper rest and 22 working days of Annual Vacation. Join BrainRocket and rock with us! 🚀

title: LLP - Operations Excellence Manager
description: About the job Be An Essential Part Of Everyday Life DHL Supply Chain is the world’s leading contract logistics provider that combines value-added and management services with fulfillment and distribution. At DHL Supply Chain we are committed to looking after tomorrow & today with our Environment, Social, and Governance (ESG) strategy. So what's it like to work for DHL Supply Chain? At DHL we’re proud of our international reach as it brings together people with a wide range of skills, experiences, cultures, and viewpoints. We see the diversity of our employees as a genuine strength and we’re proud of our supportive work environment where employees are given the tools and training they need to learn, grow and succeed. We are offering an exciting opportunity for the position of Operations Excellence Regional Manager. In this position you will play a crucial role to support our vision of becoming a Great place to work for all. Position located in Valencia Center of Excellence. Visit us for further info: https://dhlinsights.dhlsupplychain.dhl.com/ao-lead-logistics-partner What will your responsibilities be? Accountable owner and leader of the Central Operations Excellence function regional cluster Responsible for the communication, delivery & implementation of the Central OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE agenda & driving an OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE culture to support our the 3 bottom lines Build partnerships, strong diverse stakeholder relationships and act as an enabler for our business strategies to be achieved Ensure regulatory and customer expectations and standards are consistently met Drive cross collaboration with functional and operational leads to identify & share best practice, ensure standardisation and drive continuious improvement To present Central OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE solutions to prospective customers, inspiring confidence in LLP’s Central OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE service deliverables Achieve KPI targets, implement initiatives and deliver continuous improvement opportunities Lead and build Central OPERATIONS EXCELLENCE Cluster team, review resource reqs and budget to deliver excellent, consistent service that meets business & customer needs, present & future Provide leadership, coaching, support and excellence in line management Maximise standards compliance in H&S, Quality Management, Risk Management, minimize deviations from process and requirements, maximise improvements. Maximise crisis resilience and response capability, minimize recovery times of critical services. You won’t find another OEManager position like the one you’ll find with DHL Supply Chain. Now, here’s what we need from you: University degree National & International Qualifications and experience in Project Management & Supply Chain Management Qualifications in ISO, H&S, Continuious improvement & change management preferred +5 experience in the logistics industry in the area of supply chain management +5 years team leadership experience Experience of working to ISO standards and other regulatory and compliance standards/legisitation Experience in process improvement techniques Experience working internationally or in diverse business environments and working in a country/regional/global environment Outstanding communication skills and ability to influence at a senior level Outstanding team management and Change management experience skills Strong administrative and MS Office and people and stakeholder management skills Knowledge of Central Ops Ex corporate standards Knowledge of regional technical & regulatory requirements over all central Ops Ex disciplines Able to focus on immediate needs keeping the big picure in mind - successful track of leading multiple programs simultaneously Able to ramp-up quickly on new topics as well as dive into and understand operational content Excellent analytical and problem solving skills Effective management in a diverse geographic and multi-cultural environment What do we offer? Inspiring and rewarding place to build your career: We work in a multicultural team environment where we collaborate and support each other Personal Growth and Professional Development: Your growth opportunity is important to us. We offer continuous training and career opportunities at DHL Supply Chain Flexibility: We offer flexible work hour and hybrid work model. We care about our work life balance Competitive salary package and corporate benefits We are looking forward to receiving your application.

title: Business Analyst (with German)
description: About the job What will you do? Understanding business processes and the data generated and needed by it Translating business logic into technical and data requirements Recording and analysis of requirements, documentation and validation Execution of requirements workshops, customer training and presentation of results to the customer Creation of test case specifications and functional tests and validation of data Support of the project management by taking responsibility for partial or complete projects You will be working in an international environment with our German and Spanish colleagues. What's your story? Industry experience in the retail sector, e-Commerce or Logistics environment Customer-oriented thinking and acting Experience analyzing business requirements, creating stories and defining test scenarios A structured and agile way of working and a distinctive ability to work in a team Basic technical IT skills (sql, data modeling, data analytics) to effectively communicate with developers and assist with incident analysis Advanced written and spoken German and English skills (This is a MUST for the position) Benefits Permanent contract Flexible working hours (you decide how to organize your day to day!) Hybrid work mode (work from home up to 80% of the time, having the rest to meet your colleagues at the office!) You will be part of a fast growing company, being part of a great team Competitive salary Flexible retribution Medical insurance Agile working methods Training and Development: we have a clear focus on technical innovation, but we don't forget the personal growth! ¿Quiénes somos? OSP Spain, now part of One.O. OSP Spain takes a significant step forward in its evolution by becoming part of One.O, the new central, high-performance partner for strategy consulting and technology for the Otto Group. This strengthens our mission to deliver innovative IT solutions for commerce and logistics, combining experience, technology, and a global vision to lead the digital future. About one.O: Effective and value-orientated in the digital transformation. Otto Group one.O is the central, powerful partner for strategy consulting and technology. With around 1,000 colleagues worldwide in areas such as consulting, software development, SAP and data intelligence & AI, we provide strategic advice and design, develop and operate digital end-to-end solutions along the entire value chain. We shape the digital transformation in an innovative and integrated way and accompany customers inside and outside the Otto Group through the AI era. And beyond.

title: Netowrk Security Analyst
location: Albalat dels Sorells, Valencian Community, Spain
description: About the job Descripción En Mercadona IT dirigimos y desarrollamos grandes proyectos que impulsan la digitalización de Mercadona, modernizando las aplicaciones ya existentes y desarrollando nuevas herramientas y productos que mejoran y optimizan los procesos de la compañía. Como Analista de Seguridad en Redes, formarás parte de un equipo Blue Team especializado, diseñando y protegiendo la infraestructura de red de la empresa para salvaguardar la confidencialidad, integridad y disponibilidad de los datos. Únete a nuestro equipo para liderar la transformación digital de los supermercados en España y Portugal. 🚀 El reto que te proponemos 🔐 Gestionarás la segmentación de red en firewalls y sistemas de detección/prevención de intrusiones. 👥 Colaborarás con equipos de seguridad para mitigar incidentes en la infraestructura de comunicaciones. 📊 Realizarás evaluaciones de riesgos y análisis de vulnerabilidades. 🔍 Ejecutarás pruebas de penetración y auditorías de seguridad. 📝 Diseñarás e implementarás políticas de seguridad de comunicaciones. 📶 Auditarás redes Wi-Fi para garantizar la seguridad en el uso de los dispositivos corporativos. Requisitos Estudios: Grado en Informática / Telecomunicaciones o Ciclo de ASIR. Conocimientos imprescindibles Conocimientos de redes: Modelo TCP/IP, Switching, IP Routing, Wifi. Conocimientos de segmentación de redes: Firewalls, ACL, Proxy. Conocimientos de protocolos habituales: DHCP, DNS, Radius, Kerberos, SMB, LDAP, RDP, SSH, HTTPS.s. Tecnologías valorables Firewalls (Checkpoint, Cisco, Palo Alto). Proxy de navegación (Bluecoat). Network-Policies (Google Cloud, Openshift, Tanzu). IDS/IPS. Router y Switch (ACLs). VPN. Experiencia Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en puestos similares. Herramientas valorables Wireshark. Burp. Network Monitor. Squid. Esta oferta es para ti si Además de cumplir con los requisitos técnicos, eres una persona apasionada por la tecnología, orientada a la mejora continua, con una mente abierta para aprender siempre y generosa para apoyar y aportar al equipo. Qué te ofrecemos ✨ Proyectos únicos y de gran impacto. 👥 Un equipo IT de más de 1.200 profesionales. 🛠️ Stack tecnológico de alto nivel. 📈 Plan de carrera con revisiones salariales anuales. ⏰ Flexibilidad horaria. 🎓 Formación continua y crecimiento profesional. 🔒 Estabilidad y cultura de equipo. 🏥 Servicio médico propio. 🏢 Oficinas innovadoras y colaborativas. 💰 Salario competitivo según tu experiencia. Salario Retribución anual en función de la experiencia (entre 35.500€ brutos y 59.800€ brutos). Si tú no tienes límites, nosotros tampoco. ㅤ #BeLimitless

title: Product Data Analyst – User dashboards B2B2C
description: About the job Product Data Analyst – User dashboards B2B2C En Fourvenues estamos revolucionando un mercado global de más de 100 mil millones de dólares, potenciando discotecas, festivales, beach clubs, promotoras y bares de copas en todo el mundo. Estamos buscando un/a Product Data Analyst – User dashboards B2B2C, para trabajar en nuestras oficinas de Valencia, que tenga ganas de dejar una huella importante en su carrera y quiera unirse a una empresa de alto crecimiento. Si tienes autoexigencia, ambición, curiosidad y compromiso para llevar a Fourvenues al siguiente nivel, ¡queremos conocerte! Localización: Valencia (modalidad híbrida) Reporte a: CPO Tu día a día... Diseñar y construir dashboards interactivos y claros que permitan a promotores analizar ventas, audiencias y tendencias. Colaborar con Product Managers para definir qué métricas y visualizaciones aportan más valor a los usuarios. Extraer, transformar y modelar datos para que sean consumibles y eficientes en los dashboards. Crear prototipos rápidos y validar con usuarios reales antes de desplegar nuevas visualizaciones. Asegurar que los dashboards cumplen buenas prácticas de UX y data storytelling, para que sean intuitivos y prácticos. Que necesitamos de ti… Tenga experiencia en visualización avanzada de datos y manejo de librerías gráficas o herramientas como Tableau o Looker. Domine SQL avanzado y sepa estructurar datasets para uso eficiente en dashboards. Conozca principios de UX y data storytelling para presentar datos de forma que guíen decisiones. Pueda colaborar con PMs, ingeniería y negocio para priorizar métricas que impacten al cliente. Sea adaptable y capaz de prototipar y iterar rápido según feedback de usuarios. Valoramos... Sabes usar librerías y herramientas de visualización como D3.js, Chart.js, Highcharts o Looker Embedded para integrar gráficos en la plataforma. Tienes conocimientos básicos de Typescript y APIs REST para integrar visualizaciones en la plataforma. Entiendes métricas de negocio como ventas, cohortes, previsiones de facturación y velocidad de venta. Tienes sensibilidad por la privacidad de datos y cumplimiento (GDPR). Has trabajado en entornos SaaS o B2B2C y conoces el contexto de ticketing y eventos. Sabes como usar inteligencia artificial para el análisis de datos y la generación de información. Qué ofrecemos… Compensación salarial competitiva, enfocada en atraer y retener perfiles de alto rendimiento. Bonus anuales para aquellos perfiles que contribuyan de forma sobresaliente en el éxito de la empresa. Plan de carrera con oportunidades de promoción y desarrollo continuo. Nos encanta apostar por la gente de casa. Una visión y un equipo que te inspirará a superarte, llevándote al siguiente nivel en tu desarrollo profesional. Formación continua. Queremos que siempre estés a la vanguardia en tecnología y habilidades, por lo que ofrecemos formaciones internas constantes. Ordenador MacBook y pantallas de alta resolución para desarrollar tu potencial al máximo. Modalidad híbrida (3+2). Tres días de oficina y dos desde casa si así te sientes mas productiv@, aunque estamos seguros de que el ambiente y el equipo te harán disfrutar de nuestra oficina más de lo esperado. Flexibilidad horaria. Como cada persona rinde mejor a su manera, te damos la libertad de organizar tu tiempo de trabajo entre las 8:00h y las 20:00h, siempre cumpliendo con los compromisos agendados. Clases de inglés voluntarias. Impartidas por profesores nativos, para que mejores tu nivel de manera efectiva. Seguro médico privado. Nos preocupamos por tu bienestar y ofrecemos cobertura médica para que tengas la tranquilidad que necesitas. Retribución flexible opcional. Este beneficio lo puedes utilizar en restaurantes, guardería, transporte y descuentos en grandes marcas. Días de vacaciones extra. Disfrutarás de días adicionales en fechas especiales como cumpleaños, navidades o eventos únicos. Sobre Fourvenues... Fourvenues, es la empresa B2B que está liderando la transformación digital en la industria del ocio nocturno. Nos dirigimos a un mercado global de más de 100 mil millones de dólares, abarcando discotecas, festivales, beach clubs, promotoras y bares de copas. Nuestra visión es clara: convertirnos en el sistema operativo de la industria, con un alto componente financiero y un modelo vertical SaaS (vSaaS) que impulse a nuestros clientes a conseguir sus objetivos. Su éxito, es el nuestro. En nuestros tres primeros años hemos multiplicado nuestros ingresos x20, y solo pensamos en ir a por más. Por eso, crecer un mínimo de 100% anual es nuestra meta, y eso exige un ambiente donde el compromiso, la autoexigencia y la curiosidad constante son clave. Aquí, la excelencia no es opcional; es la norma. Tenemos el privilegio de trabajar con marcas de renombre mundial, entre ellas Pacha, BRESH, Cova Santa, BCM, Magic Room HK, Blackworks, Sonorama Medellin, Opium o Gossip Doha. Y lo mejor, es que no paramos de cerrar nuevos partnerships cada mes, por lo que siempre tenemos desafíos que nos impulsan a esforzarnos al máximo para dar un servicio de diez. Si estás en ese momento de tu carrera, en el que estás listo para dejar huella, explotando todo tu potencial y ser parte de una empresa en plena expansión, ¡este es tu lugar! Aquí puedes conocer más de nuestro negocio y nuestra historia: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5ratQVugh7o

title: Talent Pool | Real Estate Analyst
description: About the job 📊🔍 ¡Buscamos a nuestro/a próximo/a Real Estate Analyst para transformar datos en decisiones con impacto! 💥🏘️ En Inversiva, ayudamos a las personas a transformar sus ahorros en patrimonio inmobiliario pasivo, combinando seguridad, rentabilidad y cero complicaciones 🙌. Y ahora estamos buscando a alguien con mente analítica, visión estratégica y mucha curiosidad para sumarse al team como Real Estate Analyst. Si sos de los que ven una hoja de Excel y se emocionan un poquito… 🧠📈 Si te apasiona entender el mercado, analizar oportunidades y tomar decisiones basadas en datos... ¡Esta puede ser tu próxima gran aventura! 🚀 🏗️ ¿Qué vas a hacer en este rol? Serás pieza clave en la validación y análisis de oportunidades inmobiliarias que llegan a través de nuestra red de partners, ayudando a garantizar que cada operación sea segura, rentable y escalable para nuestros inversores 💼💡 Tus misiones del día a día: Evaluar oportunidades de inversión 🏘️ y determinar si encajan con nuestros productos. Hacer análisis financieros que ayuden a tomar decisiones estratégicas de verdad 💸. Estar al día con el mercado inmobiliario 📊 y detectar riesgos y oportunidades. Participar en el diseño de nuevos productos de inversión basados en data y tendencias. Apoyar en negociaciones y estructuración de operaciones de compra, venta y financiación 🤝. 🔎 ¿A quién buscamos? Alguien con esa mezcla de mente numérica, mirada estratégica y ganas de crecer en un entorno dinámico: 🎓 Formación en Finanzas, Economía, ADE o similares. 💼 Al menos 2 años de experiencia analizando inversiones inmobiliarias (o afines). 📐 Manejo sólido de Excel + herramientas de análisis financiero y planometría. 🧠 Capacidad para evaluar rentabilidad, riesgo y mirar los números con lupa. ⚡ Detallista, organizado/a y cómodo/a con ritmos ágiles. 🎁 ¿Qué te espera en Inversiva? Un entorno donde vas a aprender, proponer y crecer desde el día uno 🚀 💻 Modalidad híbrida-flexible: 3 días de home office por semana 💸 Oportunidad de retribución flexible Un equipo con mucha vibra positiva, ganas de construir algo grande y disfrutar el camino 😎 Si leíste hasta acá y sentís que te describe… ¡nos encantaría conocerte! 👉 Aplicá ahora y sumate a este equipo.

title: Event & Operations Coordinator
description: About the job We’re looking for an energetic and detail-oriented Event & Operations Coordinator to bring our projects to life in Valencia. This role blends creativity with operational precision — you’ll be at the heart of organizing memorable events, building strong partnerships, and ensuring smooth day-to-day processes. Responsibilities Organize and execute internal and external events, from concept to completion. Collaborate with contractors, vendors, and partners to deliver top-quality experiences. Coordinate the team, ensuring all operational details are on track. Prepare and set up event spaces, managing all related logistics. Handle administrative tasks, including bookings, procurement, documentation, and communications. Requirements Residence in Valencia (mandatory). Fluent Spanish (spoken and written). Confident working level of English. Proven experience in event organization, space management, or cultural/urban projects. Highly responsible, detail-oriented, and well-organized. Good understanding of Valencia’s urban context and local specifics. Nice to have Strong local network of contractors, services, and rentals. Knowledge of Russian or familiarity with Eastern European cultural background. What we offer A dynamic work environment in a growing international company. Opportunities to develop your skills through challenging and creative projects. Competitive compensation package and benefits.

title: Junior Analyst – Project Finance and M&A
description: About the job Fundada en 2003, Prosolia Energy es un grupo empresarial líder en el sector de las energías renovables, con operaciones en los mercados de España, Portugal, Italia, Francia y Alemania a través de nuestras filiales. Prosolia Energy un productor de energía independiente (Independent Power Producer – IPP) especializado en ofrecer servicios de descarbonización a nuestros clientes. Controlamos toda la cadena de valor de los proyectos a través de los cuales proveemos de energía a nuestros clientes, desarrollo, construcción, operación y mantenimiento de un abanico de fuentes de generación y almacenamiento renovables. Estamos comprometidos a liderar la transición del sector industrial y productivo hacia un modelo descarbonizado, sostenible y competitivo, con una visión de producción energética descentralizada. Nuestros objetivos estratégicos para los próximos años incluyen la expansión a nuevos mercados y la innovación en soluciones energéticas, como el almacenamiento energético, aprovechando nuestras ventajas competitivas. Prosolia Energy dispone hoy de un portafolio de proyectos que supera los 4 GW en Europa. Para afrontar la construcción y desarrollo de este portafolio, así como la consecución de sus objetivos estratégicos, estamos en la búsqueda de profesionales con talento y alto potencial que deseen unirse a nuestro equipo y contribuir a nuestro éxito continuo. Responsabilidades: Como analista junior formaras parte del equipo de Transactions de la compañía encargado de los procesos de financiación Project Finance y de las transacciones de M&A, apoyando a los miembros mas senior del equipo en los procesos de financiación y M&A. Construir modelos financieros para transacciones Project Finance y M&A, incluyendo la recopilación de datos, elaboración de la estructura del modelo y los cálculos, análisis de resultados y discusión con miembros senior del equipo, asesores y entidades financieras. Revisar documentación de proyectos e informes de terceros, incluyendo PPAs, hojas de condiciones financieras y contratos de préstamo, informes del ingeniero independiente, etc., e integrar con precisión los supuestos en los modelos financieros. Realizar análisis financieros para la elaboración de propuestas comerciales para clientes de Generación Distribuida. Realizar análisis financieros de viabilidad de proyectos de la compañía y de potenciales oportunidades de adquisición. Apoyar a los miembros senior del equipo en la estructuración de financiaciones y M&A para respaldar el crecimiento del negocio solar tanto a gran escala como en generación distribuida. Supervisar los procesos de Due Diligence y coordinar toda la documentación legal, técnica, operativa y contable requerida para el proceso de diligencia con los departamentos internos, asesores y bancos. Colaborar en el seguimiento de las condiciones precedentes necesarias para el cierre exitoso y el desembolso de los préstamos. Preparar teasers de proyectos, presentaciones e informes para bancos e inversores. Gestionar los procesos de preguntas y respuestas (Q&A) con los inversores. Apoyar al equipo de Asset Management en cuestiones relacionadas con la financiación. ¿Qué estamos buscando? ·Experiencia de al menos 2-4 años preferiblemente en asesoría financiera, banca de inversión, IPPs, financiación de proyectos de infraestructura o boutiques de M&A, con un excelente nivel en modelización financiera. ·Historial académico sobresaliente con un grado universitario en finanzas, economía o ingeniería, y máster en Finanzas o MBA. ·Interés profundo en el sector energético y en las finanzas. ·Excelentes habilidades analíticas, con amplia experiencia en modelización financiera (imprescindible). ·Dominio fluido del español e inglés. El francés será altamente valorado. ·Persona curiosa, organizada, muy rigurosa y con gran atención al detalle. Con disposición para asumir tanto tareas de alto nivel como otras más operativas si es necesario para apoyar a un compañero o cumplir con un plazo. Mentalidad emprendedora. ·Ubicación: Valencia o Madrid ¿Qué ofrecemos? Empresa internacional y en expansión Oficina en el centro de la ciudad Flexibilidad horaria Trabajo híbrido

title: Valuations & Portfolio Reporting Analyst
description: About the job Se busca un Analista o Asociado para apoyar las valoraciones y reportes de una importante firma de inversión alternativa en su nueva oficina de Valencia. Participarás activamente en el análisis de cartera inmobiliaria, generación de informes y actualización de modelos financieros. Funciones principales: Ejecutar valoraciones trimestrales/mensuales y preparar reportes precisos. Actualizar modelos financieros con datos de arrendamiento, ingresos, gastos y CAPEX. Analizar mercados, flujos de caja y movimientos de valoración. Colaborar con equipos europeos y participar en proyectos de mejora. Apoyar auditorías con documentación y análisis. Requisitos: Grado o máster en Finanzas, Contabilidad o Real Estate. Mínimo de 2 años de experiencia en la Experiencia o prácticas en modelización financiera y análisis inmobiliario. Excel avanzado y capacidad para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos. Inglés fluido y habilidades comunicativas sólidas. Qué se valora: Curiosidad por aprender, atención al detalle y enfoque colaborativo. Interés en mejorar procesos y contribuir en un entorno multicultural e inclusivo. ¿Te interesa? Únete a un equipo dinámico y en crecimiento. Envía tu candidatura hoy.

title: Senior Credit Risk Analyst
description: About the job Valencia (ES) / Remote (Spain) Octopus Energy Spain 🇪🇸 – Finance / Full-time / Hybrid 🌍 Revolucionamos la energía para cambiar el mundo En Octopus Energy, no somos una eléctrica tradicional. Somos un equipo de personas apasionadas que trabaja cada día para hacer que la energía sea 100% renovable, accesible y justa para todos. Creemos en la tecnología y la innovación como motores del cambio. Queremos transformar la forma en que el mundo consume energía, eliminando barreras, simplificando procesos y ofreciendo un servicio más humano y transparente. Por esto mismo, nuestro compromiso es claro: la energía limpia debe ser la norma, no la excepción. Para lograrlo, combinamos sostenibilidad con un enfoque centrado en las personas, impulsando un servicio excepcional y construyendo un equipo increíble que comparte nuestra visión. 💡 Pero nada de esto sería posible sin personas como tú. Para seguir creciendo y transformando el mercado, buscamos talento con ganas de marcar la diferencia. Si quieres formar parte de este cambio, aportar tu energía y ayudar a construir un futuro más verde. ¿Qué estamos buscando? Buscamos un/a Credit Lead para unirse a nuestro equipo y ayudarnos a asegurar una gestión financiera sólida y eficiente dentro de nuestro crecimiento. Si tienes experiencia en el seguimiento de carteras de crédito, te motiva la recuperación de deuda y la gestión de empresas terceras de recobro, esta es tu oportunidad. 🐙 Lo llamamos el ‘Efecto Octopus’ Trabajar en Octopus Energy significa formar parte de una compañía donde la cultura y las personas son lo más importante. 💜 Apostamos por la flexibilidad y la conciliación. 🚀 Queremos que desarrolles tu potencial al máximo. 🌱 Creemos en un modelo energético más justo y sostenible. ¡Te estamos esperando! 🚀🐙 💪 Lo que harás en Octopus Realizar el seguimiento continuo de la morosidad de la cartera de clientes, identificando riesgos y tendencias de forma proactiva. Optimizar la gestión del crédito con un enfoque analítico y estratégico, utilizando herramientas como A/B testing y workflows automatizados para evaluar decisiones y mejorar resultados. Diseñar e implementar estrategias de recobro que equilibren la eficiencia financiera con una excelente experiencia de cliente (ajustes de pagos, planes de fraccionamiento, etc.). Desarrollar y mantener reportes de seguimiento (BI reporting) y modelos de provisión de deuda incobrable, colaborando con equipos de Data y Finance tanto en España como en el grupo. Actuar como punto de escalado para casos sensibles o reclamaciones complejas. Supervisar y coordinar la relación con agencias externas de recobro o despachos legales, asegurando eficiencia, cumplimiento y alineación con nuestra cultura de respeto al cliente. Negociar con clientes para establecer planes de pago sostenibles. Colaborar con los equipos internos (comercial, legal, operaciones, etc.) para prevenir incidencias y fortalecer el ciclo de vida del cliente desde una perspectiva de riesgo. 📝 Qué necesitarás Experiencia sólida (al menos 5 años) en gestión de crédito, seguimiento de morosidad y recuperación de deuda. Experiencia demostrable en la gestión y coordinación de empresas externas o proveedores relacionados con el recobro. Data skills: SQL + Python + Excel Un enfoque analítico, proactivo y orientado a resultados, con capacidad para la toma de decisiones estratégicas, y centrado en lograr objetivos e impulsar la mejora continua. Habilidades avanzadas de negociación y comunicación, tanto escrita como oral. Competencia en análisis de datos para medir el éxito del equipo, rastrear el rendimiento e identificar tendencias. Excelentes habilidades de comunicación y la capacidad de tener conversaciones difíciles con empatía. Capacidad para trabajar de forma independiente y en equipo en un entorno de ritmo rápido. Nivel de inglés alto. ⚡️ Condiciones del puesto 🏠 Oficina: Valencia, híbrido o remoto. 👋🏼 Incorporación: Inmediata. 📝 Tipo de contrato: Indefinido. ⏰ Horario: Jornada Completa 💶 Salario: ¿Te preguntas cuál es el salario para este puesto? ¡Simplemente pregúntanos! En una llamada con nuestro equipo de Talento, es algo que siempre comentamos, ya que realmente queremos que tu experiencia coincida con el salario correcto. La razón por la que no lo anunciamos es porque, sinceramente, tenemos un grado de flexibilidad y nunca querríamos que el salario fuera una razón por la que alguien no aplicara a Octopus. Para nosotros, lo más importante es encontrar el octoencaje perfecto. Otros beneficios: 💰 Opciones sobre acciones en Octopus Energy ☕ Desayuno y fruta fresca en la oficina 🏥 Beneficios flexibles (tarjeta restaurante, transporte, guardería, seguro médico...) 🚘 Ayuda para la compra de vehículos eléctricos 🏦 Plan de pensiones 🎓 Desarrollo profesional 🎉 Ambiente de trabajo divertido, dinámico e inclusivo 🍽️ Eventos: "Family Dinners" y muchas más experiencias de equipo 📩 ¿Te unes al cambio? Si quieres formar parte de este proyecto y ayudar a construir un futuro más verde, ¡envíanos tu candidatura! 🌱 📎 Adjunta tu CV y, si tu perfil encaja, nos pondremos en contacto contigo. ¡Estamos deseando conocerte! 😉

title: Operations Manager, West Europe
description: About the job The world needs more Intrepid people: We’re looking for a confident and experienced Operations Manager to lead our trips across West Europe. Based in Valencia in a hybrid capacity, this full-time role is responsible for the day-to-day running of our tours, supporting a large team of leaders, and ensuring every trip meets Intrepid’s high standards. You’ll manage trip delivery across multiple countries, lead recruitment and training for our group leaders and guides, and respond quickly when things don’t go to plan. You’ll also play a key role in improving systems, managing budgets, and making sure our safety and operational policies are followed. This is a great opportunity for someone who knows Europe well, thrives in fast-paced environments, and brings a strong understanding of what great group travel looks like. Some of the experience you’ll bring with you may include: Senior-level operations management experience across multiple locations or countries Strong knowledge of Europe’s travel industry and cultural landscape Previous experience as a Group Leader or in a similar on-the-ground role Proven ability to recruit, train and manage large remote teams Confidence managing operational budgets, safety processes and incident response A process-driven mindset with strong cross-functional collaboration skills Fluency in English and Spanish is essential, with any other European languages such as Italian, French and Portuguese as a plus. A bit about our team: You’ll be joining a passionate regional team who care deeply about what we do and how we do it. We support each other, challenge each other, and work hard to ensure Intrepid trips are nothing short of exceptional. If you want to make an impact in a meaningful travel company – we think you’ll love it here. Our people reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities we visit: Intrepid is made up of 71 nationalities in over 30 countries, and we recognise that diversity makes us a stronger business. We support a culture where people can be themselves and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. Including First Nations People, LGBTQI+ people, those living with a disability, or from disadvantaged backgrounds, and all people from different ethnicities, races, and religions. Rewarding and developing our people is important to us, some of our work perks include: Flexible work options, such as work-from-home options and the ability to 'work from anywhere' 4 weeks a year A free Intrepid trip every year, plus generous discounts for families, and close friends 5 extra days of leave a year for use on Intrepid trip's A minimum of 10 weeks paid parental leave for all parents, and other additional leave provisions. Access to e-learning platforms, professional development and mentor programs 20 hours of volunteer leave every year to use on causes most important to you Employee Assistance Program, a 24/7 service that offers counselling for you and your family We are Real. Together. Ambitious. Impactful. These are our values and to us they're more than just words, they are the pillars of our success and every day it's our people and the work they do that bring them to life.

title: Portfolio Analyst
description: About the job FundRock is a Pan-European leading independent UCITS management company and AIFM (Alternative Investment Fund Manager). Our clients are established blue-chip companies and leaders in their domestic market. We invest in our people, enabling you to develop your skills and build on your experience. If you like the idea of working for an ambitious and growing company, as part of a multicultural team, we are the place for you. Portfolio Manager / Portfolio Analyst (m/f/d) - Real Assets Your Responsibilities Analyse fund documentation and assess real assets transactions in the fields of fund of funds, private equity, real estate, infrastructure, renewable energies, or private debt. Assess the eligibility of the proposed investment in terms of strategy, investment objectives, liquidity, ownership and/ or sustainability. Perform initial and on-going AML /KYC/ TF and Sanctions checks. Update, maintain and improve existing Excel based portfolio management cash flow models (DCF) Monitor and manage the liquidity of the fund on daily basis, evaluate the financial performance by comparing and analysing actual results with plans and forecasts. Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reporting, tools, and Excel dashboards Work closely with the portfolio management collegues in Luxembourg to ensure sound decision-making process Support by the implementation of regulatory changes Your profile 3 - 5 years of business finance or other relevant experience BA, BS, or B.Com degree required (Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance/Economics) Relevant professional experience in the analysis and monitoring of transactions in the alternative assets space ideally gained by an investment manager, fund servicer or consulting company Profound knowledge of the regulatory framework regarding alternative investment funds (AIFMD) Good understanding of valuation models for alternative assets Strong command of the MS-Office suit in particular Excel Self-starter with excellent interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills Interest in capital markets and investment fund products Ability to streamline functions and passion to learn and grow Fluency in English is mandatory, knowledge of any other European language in particular German will be considered as an asset. You can look forward to an interesting and broad field of activities within a successfully growing company. You will experience the advantages of a company of manageable size, flat hierarchies and an attractive work environment providing you a long-term perspective for your personal and professional development. Interested? If you are interested in this challenge, we look forward to receiving your application documents (motivation letter, CV, testimonials/reference letters) including additional information about your earliest possible starting date as well as your salary expectations via e-mail to hr-lux@apexgroup.com. As a vital team member and in return for your expertise, inclusive approach and commitment, we'll provide a favourable salary and the chance to join a passionate and welcoming team. Benefits As a truly global business, we tailor benefits to each location to safeguard our people and respect local cultures and ways of working. Our people are our greatest asset, and we invest in talent development. Join our global network, and you will benefit from education support, sponsorship and in-house training programs. Disclaimer: Unsolicited CVs sent to Apex (Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Managers) by recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position. Apex operates a direct sourcing model and where agency assistance is required, the Talent Acquisition team will engage directly with our exclusive recruitment partners.

title: Governance Risk & Compliance Analyst
description: About the job About XTEL At XTEL, we excel in understanding large FMCG players. As a leading software provider of sales automation solutions for the Consumer Goods Industry worldwide, our mission is to partner with our customers to unlock growth through smart investment and optimize their promotional plans. Position Overview XTEL is looking for a GRC Analyst who is driven, curious, and eager to grow. You’ll work directly with the Director of Information Assurance to help build and scale a forward-thinking and efficient security & compliance program. This isn’t a check the box compliance role, we’re looking for someone who wants to reimagine how GRC is done and isn’t afraid to roll up their sleeves to make it happen. This is an ideal opportunity for someone earlier in their GRC career who is looking to learn, contribute meaningfully, and be part of a high impact team. Responsibilities Support the ongoing operation and improvement of XTEL’s ISMS. Draft, review, and maintain security & compliance policies, standards, and procedures, ensuring they meet evolving compliance requirements and business needs. Assist with risk assessments and treatment plans. Contribute to our Third Party Risk Management (TPRM) efforts for evaluating vendors beyond just sending out lengthy questionnaires. Assist with client security questionnaires, RFPs, and due diligence requests. Help monitor compliance obligations across frameworks including ISO 27001, SOC 2, SOC 1/ISAE 3402, GDPR, and NIS2. Support ESG initiatives by collecting, analyzing, and reporting on sustainability metrics, including greenhouse gas emissions and energy usage, to meet investor and stakeholder requirements. Assist in responding to customer RFPs and inquiries related to ESG, ensuring alignment with sustainability goals and regulatory frameworks. Collaborate with stakeholders across IT, Product, Engineering, HR, etc. to implement security controls. Continuously look for ways to automate, streamline, and modernize how we manage compliance and security operations. Contribute to incident response and BCP/DRP planning and testing. Qualifications You’re motivated, adaptable, and eager to learn. You have 2-5 years of experience in security, compliance, or risk management roles, particularly in cloud based SaaS environments. You have hands on experience with ISO 27001 and SOC 2. You think of GRC as more than just documentation and spreadsheets – you see it as a system to be optimized and improved with technology. You’ve supported or helped manage ISMS operations and understand what makes policies and procedures useful. You participated in or supported risk assessments. You’re organized, self-directed, and thrive in environments where you can take ownership. Nice to have: Experience using GRC platforms such as Drata, Vanta, Secureframe, etc. Experience within Microsoft 365 and Azure environments. Experience with automation, low-code tools, or scripting to improve workflows and documentation processes. What We Offer A challenging role in a fast-growing AI-driven revenue management company. A diverse and international team with strong ownership and a can-do mentality. Opportunities to contribute to the organization's growth and development. A cross-functional role spanning geographies and departments. Flexible working with hybrid and remote options (HQ in Bologna). Location Preferences: Our headquarters is located in Casalecchio di Reno, Bologna, and we offer hybrid work arrangements. While we prioritize candidates who are based in Bologna and the surrounding areas for hybrid work, we are open to considering other options on a case-by-case basis. Equal Opportunity Statement If you have strengths to share, we’d love to hear from you. We value diverse backgrounds and experiences, so don’t hesitate to apply even if you don’t meet all criteria. XTEL is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

title: Investment and Operations Intern (6-12 months)
description: About the job Are you passionate about tackling climate change and driving impactful solutions? Join our team as an Investment and Operations Intern, where your skills will contribute to advancing natural climate solutions and fostering sustainable growth. We’re looking for a long-term member to join our team and work from/relocate to Valencia. We actively encourage applications from diverse backgrounds, especially from women and underrepresented groups, as we strive to create an inclusive and empowering workplace. About the Role This position offers a unique opportunity for a motivated individual to grow professionally while contributing to investment analysis, project management, and market research. You’ll collaborate closely with our investment and operations team, gaining hands-on experience in natural capital investment. Key Responsibilities: Investment Analysis: Support cash flow, IRR projections, and scenario analysis for land purchase decisions. Investment Management: Assist in designing and delivering quarterly/annual reports covering financial, climate, and community outcomes. Market Research: Conduct in-depth research on the Voluntary Carbon Market (VCM) and competitor analysis. Sales Support: Manage CRM tools and support the Sales team ahead of major events. Strategic Assistance: Provide operational and strategic support to our leadership team. What We’re Looking For We understand no single candidate meets every qualification. If you’re excited about this role and our mission, we encourage you to apply! Required Skills: Advanced use of Microsoft Applications (Word, Powerpoint, Excel). Previous academic or work exposure to modelling in Excel. Fluency in English (written and spoken). Ability to work autonomously and diligently in remote settings. Familiarity with Google Suite, amongst other remote working tools. Theoretical understanding of financial concepts such as IRR, NPV, and discount rates. Desired Skills (Not Mandatory): Working knowledge of Spanish and/or Portuguese is a strong plus. German and/or French is a nice-to-have. Experience in a startup environment is a plus. Experience with financial analysis and/or CRM platforms. Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., QGIS, ArcGIS) or coding (e.g., Python, VBA, R). Understanding of financial statements (P&L, Balance Sheet) & project finance reporting. Knowledge of the voluntary carbon market is highly desirable. Knowledge of natural climate solutions is highly desirable. About NatureRe Capital At NatureRe Capital, we are dedicated to “investing in nature, restoring biodiversity and removing carbon at scale.” Our innovative business model integrates carbon, biodiversity and financial expertise to deliver impactful natural climate solutions with sound returns. Here’s why you’ll love working with us: Mission-Driven Culture: Join a passionate and mission-driven team tackling both climate change and biodiversity loss. Learning Opportunities: We prioritize training and mentorship to support your growth. Flexibility: Remote work with a focus on work-life balance. Balanced Leadership: A multi-faceted and international team (40% women, 16 nationalities, significant age range), striving to increase female representation in leadership roles and valuing balanced perspectives in decision-making. Work Expectations We value balance and inclusivity. While this internship requires full-time availability, we respect personal commitments and encourage healthy work-life integration. Application Deadline: 15/09/2025 How to Apply: Please submit your CV and a brief cover letter outlining your interest in the role to career@nature-re.com. Help us shape a sustainable future—apply today! By submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data for recruitment purposes, in accordance with EU data protection regulations (GDPR). Your information will be handled confidentially and used solely for evaluating your candidacy for this role.

title: Senior Analyst (Growth)
description: About the job Simple Life is the #1 AI-powered health coaching app for adults who want to lose weight and enjoy a healthier lifestyle—without the stress or extremes. Our mission is to empower people to feel their best every day. By challenging traditional, restrictive approaches, Simple offers a more sustainable method grounded in ease, personalization, and real-life support. Simple has had over 17 million downloads and more than 300,000 5-star reviews, having helped millions lose weight successfully and sustainably. Simple has earned recognition as Best Virtual Coach and one of the Top 100 AI companies — all thanks to a dedicated global team driving real impact.With SIMPLE as a partner in their pocket, users feel cared for and empowered to embrace — and stick to — new healthy habits. To learn more, visit simple.life. Right now we are looking for a talented Senior Product Analyst who enjoys exploring product metrics, uncovering insights, and helping drive growth through analytical thinking. Push the pace of innovation and build a future of a healthier world with us! What We’re Looking For Advanced SQL skills — ability to design, write, and maintain complex, highly optimized queries on large-scale datasets, using advanced joins, window functions, CTEs, and aggregations; confidence in reviewing query plans and improving performance. Experience working with ETL pipelines and building data workflows (Airflow, dbt, or similar); understanding how to ensure data quality, reliability, and timely delivery. Python for data analysis and automation, including data wrangling, visualization, and statistical analysis. Experience forecasting LTV using cohort analysis, survival models, statistical techniques, or machine learning approaches (at least one of these); ability to select the most appropriate method depending on data quality and the product’s stage. Experience with any BI tool (Looker, Superset, Tableau, Power BI, or similar); ability to build intuitive dashboards and self-serve analytics. Solid grasp of statistics and experimentation, including A/B test design, power calculations, and post-hoc analysis. Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with growth, marketing, engineering, and other teams. A proactive, ownership mindset — someone who enjoys exploring data, spotting trends, and turning them into actionable insights and opportunities. Professional proficiency in both Russian and English (B2 or above) to comfortably communicate with international and local teams. Nice To Have Experience working as a product or data analyst specifically in a subscription-based service (SaaS, mobile subscriptions, OTT, etc.). Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries (XGBoost, CatBoost, LightGBM, etc.) for customer segmentation or predictive modeling. What You’ll Do Work on improving the existing LTV forecasting model and develop additional predictive models as needed; Participate in evaluating pricing experiments and interpreting results to inform product and marketing strategies; Build reports and dashboards to provide visibility into product trends and opportunities; Identify patterns and insights in data to determine optimal pricing strategies and uncover new growth levers; Perks And Benefits Open-minded teams, a welcoming and inclusive company culture, plus the opportunity to make a real difference with a game-changing health tech product; A competitive salary package based on your unique expertise, skillset, and impact on the product plus stock options; In-office, remote and hybrid work opportunities; Relocation package (Cyprus) - optional; The equipment whatever you need to be happy and productive; A premium SIMPLE subscription; 21 days annual leave, plus bank holidays (those observed where you live); Flexible hours. We focus on your results, not how long you spend at your desk. Palta is a health & well-being technology company. We're guided by real passion and curiosity to transform bright ideas into worldwide products while delivering real results.

title: Snr Operations Manager
description: About the job A fabless photonics company working at the cutting edge of data center and AI/ML infrastructure is looking to appoint a hands-on Operations Manager. This is a strategic hire to support their next phase of growth following a recent Series A funding round. This is a pivotal role where you’ll be hands-on in leading operations across manufacturing, supply chain, and quality. You’ll be responsible for working with global foundry and OSAT partners, scaling manufacturing processes, and introducing new systems and methodologies to support volume production. Key responsibilities: Develop and execute operational strategy within a fabless semiconductor environment. Manage supplier relationships, manufacturing partners, and documentation control. Lead DfM, MES implementation, and yield optimisation projects. Drive quality and reliability initiatives, including FMEA, SPC, and RCA. Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure traceability, cost-efficiency, and scalable output. Experience required: Must have experience in semiconductor, photonics, or electronics manufacturing. Proven experience working with OSAT partners. Strong understanding of DfM, yield analysis, supplier management, and MES systems. Proactive and collaborative approach, ideally with start-up or scale-up experience. This role would suit someone passionate about delivering operational excellence in a dynamic and technically complex environment. If you are interested in discussing this Senior Operations Manager position further, please contact Emily Wright @ IC Resources

title: Operations Planner & Business Support
description: About the job Karina, Supply Chain Solutions Supervisor, está buscando a un/a Operations Planner & Business Support con el propósito de apoyar la gestión y seguimiento logístico de nuestros clientes. Como Operativo/a de Tráfico Marítimo y parte esencial de nuestro equipo, te encargarás del seguimiento integral de los embarques, garantizando el cumplimiento de plazos y condiciones. Proporcionarás una solución completa en servicios de transporte marítimo, adaptándote a las necesidades específicas de cada cliente con un enfoque personalizado y orientado a la excelencia operativa. Tus habilidades interpersonales, tu espíritu de equipo, la orientación al cliente y el rigor en tu trabajo serán cualidades clave que contribuirán a tu desarrollo y crecimiento dentro del puesto. Tu misión: Gestionar los expedientes de Importación y Exportación respetando los procedimientos operativos estándar (SOP). Implementar los medios necesarios y adecuados para garantizar los tiempos de tránsito, la calidad del servicio y el cumplimiento de la normativa. Realizar el seguimiento de los transbordos y de la llegada de los buques y gestionar incidencias. Ser el interlocutor con los clientes, asegurar su satisfacción y participar en el desarrollo comercial. Asegurar una facturación correcta y dentro de los plazos establecidos, sirviendo de enlace entre operaciones y el dept. financiero. Ubicación: Oficina de Valencia – Teletrabajo: 2 días/semana – Contrato indefinido ¿Por qué unirte a nosotros? Te apoyaremos a lo largo de toda tu Carrera ofreciéndote formación, nuevos retos, participación en proyectos e implicación continua en el negocio y la trayectoria de la empresa. Sobre ti: 2 años de experiencia en una posición similar Formación de Transitario, Transporte y Comercial internacional Capacidad de gestionar tiempo, trabajar bajo presión y adaptabilidad a cambios. Experiencia en Servicio al Cliente Conocimiento de Incoterms Inglés – Nivel B1 La empresa: Fundada en 1955, Yusen Logistics es una empresa logística internacional que proporciona servicios de Transporte marítimo y aéreo, logística y distribución y gestión de la cadena de suministro - un conjunto de soluciones para la cadena de suministro perfectamente conectadas que ofrecen un valor, una fiabilidad y una experiencia superiores. Yusen Logistics se compromete a desarrollar empleados que ofrezcan una calidad y un servicio constantes a nuestros clientes, y a proporcionarles las habilidades, la formación, el apoyo y las oportunidades que necesitan para tener éxito. Como empresa, nos dedicamos a una cultura de mejora continua, garantizando que todos los que trabajan con nosotros estén comprometidos, conectados y sean creativos para convertirnos en la opción preferida del mundo. www.yusen-logistics.com En Yusen nos comprometemos a fomentar un entorno de trabajo que favorezca la diversidad, la equidad y la inclusión (D&I) para todos nuestros empleados y partes interesadas. Somos una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y reconoce el valor de una plantilla diversa. Nos beneficiamos de las soluciones creativas derivadas de la aceptación de las diferencias. Todas las personas cualificadas serán tenidas en cuenta para el Empleo. CONNECTED │ COMITTED │ CREATIVE

title: Ndt Manager
description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More Job vacancy: NDT Manager Responsable CND Responsable END (EN 4179 and EASA Part 145)Remote work position.We are looking for an NDT Manager ensuring compliance with EN 4179 and EASA Part 145 regulations and leading a team of NDT inspectors in PT, MT, UT, ET, RT methods.Key Responsibilities:Lead, manage, and oversee NDT operations, ensuring compliance with EN 4179 and EASA Part 145 standards.Supervise and guide a team of NDT inspectors, ensuring proper training, certification and adherence to safety procedures.Coordinate and schedule NDT activities for customers to minimize downtime and optimize fleet availabilitySupport continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency and performance.Requirements:Extensive experience in NDT, with an strong customer oriented profile.Solid understanding of EN 4179 and EASA Part 145 regulations and safety proceduresStrong team management skills.English (must), French (desirable), Portuguese (desirable)?? ****** d'emploi: NDT Manager Responsable CND Responsable END (EN 4179 and EASA Part 145)Poste de travail à distance.Nous recherchons un responsable CND chargé de veiller au respect des normes EN 4179 et EASA Partie 145 et de diriger une équipe d'inspecteurs CND spécialisés dans les méthodes PT, MT, UT, ET et RT.Principales responsabilités :Diriger, gérer et superviser les opérations CND, en veillant au respect des normes EN 4179 et EASA Partie 145.Superviser et guider une équipe d'inspecteurs CND, en veillant à ce qu'ils reçoivent une formation adéquate, soient certifiés et respectent les procédures de sécurité. Coordonner et planifier les activités CND pour les clients afin de minimiser les temps d'arrêt et d'optimiser la disponibilité de la flotte.Soutenir les initiatives d'amélioration continue afin d'accroître l'efficacité et les performances.Exigences :Vaste expérience dans le domaine des CND, avec un profil fortement orienté vers le client.Solide compréhension des réglementations EN 4179 et EASA Part 145 et des procédures de sécurité. Solides compétences en gestion d'équipe.Anglais (obligatoire), français (souhaitable), portugais (souhaitable). Vaga de emprego: NDT Manager Responsable CND Responsable END (EN 4179 and EASA Part 145)Posição de trabalho remoto.Estamos à procura de um gestor de NDT que garanta a conformidade com as normas EN 4179 e EASA Parte 145 e lidere uma equipa de inspetores de NDT nos métodos PT, MT, UT, ET e RT.Principais responsabilidades:Liderar, gerir e supervisionar as operações de NDT, garantindo a conformidade com as normas EN 4179 e EASA Parte 145.Supervisionar e orientar uma equipa de inspetores NDT, garantindo a formação adequada, certificação e adesão aos procedimentos de segurança.Coordenar e programar as atividades de NDT para os clientes, a fim de minimizar o tempo de inatividade e otimizar a disponibilidade da frota.Apoiar iniciativas de melhoria contínua para aumentar a eficiência e o desempenho.Requisitos:Ampla experiência em NDT, com um forte perfil orientado para o cliente.Sólida compreensão das normas EN 4179 e EASA Parte 145 e dos procedimentos de segurança.Fortes competências de gestão de equipas.Inglês (obrigatório), francês (desejável), português (desejável).

title: IAM Security Analyst
location: Albalat dels Sorells, Valencian Community, Spain
description: About the job Descripción En Mercadona IT dirigimos y desarrollamos grandes proyectos que impulsan la digitalización de Mercadona, modernizando las aplicaciones ya existentes y desarrollando nuevas herramientas y productos que mejoran y optimizan los procesos de la compañía. Como Analista de Seguridad en gestión de identidades formarás parte de un equipo Blue Team especializado en poner medidas contra el acceso no autorizado en el ámbito de la gestión de identidades, con un enfoque Zero Trust. Únete a nuestro equipo para liderar la transformación digital de los supermercados en España y Portugal. 🚀 El reto que te proponemos ⚙️ Automatizarás y optimizarás procesos del ciclo de vida de las identidades (altas, bajas, modificaciones). 🔐 Gestionarás y mantendrás las herramientas de control de accesos privilegiados (PAM) y gestión de secretos, e implantarás nuevos casos de uso. ⚠️ Evaluarás el riesgo ante nuevas necesidades de identidades, y proporcionarás la mejor solución. 🔍 Investigarás incidencias relacionadas con las identidades y la autenticación/autorización. Requisitos Estudios: Grado en Informática / Telecomunicaciones o Ciclo de ASIR. Conocimientos imprescindibles Gestión de identidades en Active Directory, ADFS, Microsoft Entra ID. . Powershell, Shell Scripting Conocimientos de federación, SSO, MFA, IdP. Conocimientos sobre control de acceso en diferentes tecnologías: Unix, Windows, BBDD, Contenedores (Podman, Docker), Kubernetes (Red Hat OpenShift, Google Kubernetes Engine). Conocimientos valorables Gestión de Accesos privilegiados, y gestión de secretos. Python, API REST. Protocolos: LDAP, NTLM, Kerberos, RADIUS, SAML, OpenID Connect, OAuth2. Experiencia Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en puestos similares. Esta oferta es para ti si Además de cumplir con los requisitos técnicos, eres una persona apasionada por la tecnología, orientada a la mejora continua, con una mente abierta para aprender siempre y generosa para apoyar y aportar al equipo. Qué te ofrecemos ✨ Proyectos únicos y de gran impacto. 👥 Un equipo IT de más de 1.200 profesionales. 🛠️ Stack tecnológico de alto nivel. 📈 Plan de carrera con revisiones salariales anuales. ⏰ Flexibilidad horaria. 🎓 Formación continua y crecimiento profesional. 🔒 Estabilidad y cultura de equipo. 🏥 Servicio médico propio. 🏢 Oficinas innovadoras y colaborativas. 💰 Salario competitivo según tu experiencia. Salario Retribución anual en función de la experiencia (entre 35.500€ brutos y 59.800€ brutos). Si tú no tienes límites, nosotros tampoco. ㅤ #BeLimitless

title: Security Operations Automation Engineer
description: About the job Say hello to possibilities. First, a little about us, we’re the $2 billion global leader in cloud-based communications and collaboration software. We are fundamentally changing the nature of human interaction—giving people the freedom to connect powerfully and personally from anywhere, at any time, on any device. We’re currently looking for a strong SecOps Automation Engineer. As a SecOps Automation Engineer at RingCentral, your primary responsibilities are to maintain and automate systems for: vulnerability scanning, log delivery, SIEM infrastructure, and parsing, and system inventory. You will work primarily within the Security Operations team. As a member of the SecOps Automation team, your primary customers will be the SOC, SecOps Infrastructure, and Vulnerability Management teams. Responsibilities: Maintain and develop Vulnerability Management scans automation Maintain and develop infrastructure automation Maintain and develop integrations between security products Automate manual processes through code and non-code tooling Deliver committed projects on time Support SecOps internal customers as part of an on-call rotation Requirements: Have strong python coding skills Have strong knowledge of Linux (RedHat preferred) Have a familiarity with devops tools (Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins) Have a familiarity with cloud concepts (AWS/GCP) Have a familiarity in several of the facets of security operations: Security network infrastructure and components (Firewalls, Web App Firewalls, IDS/IPS, etc) Endpoint protection for traditional OSes and containers (EDR/XDR, malware prevention, file integrity monitoring, etc) Security Events and incidents, including log sources, SIEM integrations, playbooks, runbooks, policies Vulnerability detection (Pentesting, scanning, red team, etc) Vulnerability Management Be project oriented and have great time management skills Be comfortable presenting their coding and design decisions to peers early and often Qualifications / Requirements: 3+ years in coding proficiency in scripting languages Fluent in Linux, preferably Red Hat Linux Knowledge of broad security topics such as encryption, application security, malware, ransomware Preferred Skills/Experience: Direct experience delivering internal tools and automation Experience as SOC analyst Experience in vulnerability management / /patch management What we offer: Well-coordinated professional team. Life assurance and private medical insurance. Competitive salary. Great opportunities for self-realization, professional and career growth. Corporate training programs, free language courses. Excellent work environment and good collaboration. Opportunity to be a part of the international company. RingCentral is deeply committed to equality and values a diverse workforce. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds and walks of life to join us. Regardless of your profile, personal circumstances, or unique characteristics, you belong here. We would be thrilled to have you as part of our team.

title: Operations Seafreight Export
description: About the job 💙¡Seguimos creciendo en la familia TIBA!❤ En la Delegación de TIBA Spain Valencia estamos ampliando nuestro equipo de Operaciones marítimas de exportación, donde tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar con grandes cuentas, ¿quieres formar parte del equipo?💪🏻 ¿Cómo será tu día a día?📝 Gestión completa de expedientes de tráfico marítimo de exportación. Seguimiento de los tráficos y cargas de los clientes/cuentas asignadas. Resolución de incidencias y reclamaciones que puedan surgir durante el proceso de salida, envío y/o recepción de la mercancía de los clientes. Contacto directo y diario con proveedores, clientes y agentes. Prestar apoyo en cotizaciones y facturación. ¿Qué te hará triunfar en este proyecto?💪🏻 Experiencia previa de al menos 2-3 años en empresa transitaria y en gestión de tráfico marítimo de exportación. Poseer formación en la rama Administrativa y/o de Comercio Internacional. Contar con nivel B2/C1 de inglés. Valorable experiencia previa en el manejo de CargoWise. Ser una persona con orientación al cliente, resolutiva y con capacidad de trabajo en equipo. En TIBA: Encontrarás calidad humana y un buen ambiente laboral: donde lo más importante será la comunicación y el trabajo en equipo, remando todos juntos en la misma dirección.🫂 Crecimiento personal y profesional: podrás aportar tu visión y te sentirás escuchado/a. Seguro que podrás aportar grandes ideas que aportarán valor al proyecto.🚀 Formación continua: tus compañeros/as te acompañarán durante todo tu proceso de formación, donde te sentirás como uno más desde el primer momento.📖 ⚠️IMPORTANTE⚠️ Recuerda que al inscribirte, serás redirigido/a a nuestro portal de WorkDay para completar tu solicitud.

title: Salesforce Business Analyst
description: About the job Omega CRM is a Merkle & Dentsu company, leader in development of Customer Experience services, with +20 years of experience in the use of Technology applied to Marketing and providing a unique Customer Relationship with mainly focus on Innovation is looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst. Job Description Requirements Analysis. Design and implement functional solutions in projects. Provide effort estimations for projects. Work in coordination with the rest of the Omega team and/or the client to contribute to the fulfillment of project objectives. Analyze and improve application performance. Collaborate with technology providers when required by the project. Contribute to the validation of the solution against functional requirements. Comply with the agreed software quality standards set by Omega's Technical Management. Generate functional documentation for completed projects. Collaborate within Omega's community of practice by sharing knowledge. Required Experience Minimum of 4 years work experience with Salesforce administration, configuration and consulting roles. Experience in business process analysis and redesign. Experience in functional design and implementation of Salesforce solutions to support sales, customer service, and after-sales processes, ensuring continuous improvement and user adoption Experience with different clouds such as Sales, Service, Marketing Cloud, Community, etc. Experience with Agile methodology. Oral and written fluent in English. WHAT DO WE OFFER Permanent contract. Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life. Certifications plan. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners. Home Office. You decide and we support you. Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurtant, …). Health insurance. OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention Professional development: Evolve, grow and get where you want to go. What do We offer Permanent contract. Flexible Schedule. We make it easy. Balance your professional and personal life. Trainings & Certifications. Improve your skills and get the official certificate from our main partners. Home Office. Flexible retribution (public transport ticket, Ticket restaurant, …). Health insurance. OMEGA in action. Our commitment to a better society is not just an intention. About us Omega CRM, a Merkle Company, is a global digital company specialising in accelerating the Business Experience (BX) of our clients through customer-centric solutions, technology, and data – all enhanced by AI. Together with Merkle, we form the largest Customer Experience Management (CXM) agency in Spain, and as part of the dentsu group, we offer end-to-end solutions that integrate media, creativity, content, technology, and strategy to deliver real business impact. With over 23 years of experience, a team of 580+ professionals from 24 nationalities, and 2,500+ certifications, Omega CRM is a recognised leader in the Salesforce ecosystem in Spain. We operate across key industries including Retail, Healthcare, Pharma, Real Estate, Education, and Non-Profit, delivering omnichannel experiences in Customer Service, eCommerce, Marketing, and Analytics. Client satisfaction is at our core (rating: 4.9/5), and we’ve been recognised with awards such as Salesforce Partner of the Year FY23 and Most Innovative Project (Iberia). At Omega CRM, we believe in growth through people – guided by our values: #Talent, #Flexibility, #Commitment, and #Innovation. We grow #Together.

title: Finance Operations Intern
description: About the job Company Description Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate! Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we’re on a mission to deliver the world’s most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world. What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you! Who We Are Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded more than a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in higher education. We’ve since scaled into new regions and industry verticals and expanded our product offerings to deliver meaningful value to our clients around the world. Today we support more than 4,600 clients across the global education, healthcare, travel & B2B industries, with diverse payment methods across 240 countries & territories and more than 140 currencies. With over 1,200 global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 12 offices world-wide, we’re looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow. Job Description The Opportunity: We are seeking a Finance Operations Intern to join our APAC Finance team. This internship offers a unique opportunity to contribute directly to key operational processes while gaining exposure to the financial backbone of a global technology company. The successful candidate will support daily finance operations focused on transaction reconciliation, reporting, and revenue share coordination. You’ll work closely with our experienced Finance team and gain hands-on training in critical accounting workflows and financial systems. Key Responsibilities Perform daily bank reconciliations across approximately 10 APAC bank accounts, reviewing and validating ~400 transactions per day. Process and book corporate card transactions, including expense classification and reporting (~300 monthly transactions). Assist in the preparation and coordination of Partner Revenue Share files under the guidance of senior team members — a process that currently spans ~4 business days. Collaborate with the Finance and Accounting teams to ensure accurate record-keeping and timely reporting. Identify and escalate discrepancies or anomalies in transactional data. Support ad hoc finance projects, reporting requests, and documentation as needed. Qualifications Qualifications: Recent graduate with a degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or a related field. Strong attention to detail and comfort working with large volumes of transactional data. Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets; experience with financial systems (e.g., NetSuite, SAP, or similar) is a plus. Highly organized with a proactive attitude and a willingness to learn. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Availability to work full-time for the duration of the internship (typically 6–12 months). Additional Information Submit today and get started! We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect to meet with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a skills assessment. Your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions. Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 40 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we’re excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire.

title: Group Financial Reporting Analyst
description: About the job We offer an opportunity you simply won’t find anywhere else. In less than six years, Mileway has grown into Europe’s leader in last mile logistics real estate, with a 550-plus team across more than twenty six offices in eleven countries. Join Mileway as a Group Financial Reporting Analyst and become part of our dynamic, pan-European team. Based in our Valencia Centre of Excellence and reporting to the Group Consolidation & Reporting Manager in Amsterdam, you’ll play a key role in shaping and improving our financial reporting processes. This highly visible role offers the opportunity to contribute to a best-in-class financial reporting function while supporting the consolidation of over 500 legal entities. You’ll work closely with the headquarters finance team in Amsterdam and collaborate with teams across the organization—including Investment Accounting, Tax, and FP&A. We’re looking for someone who combines operational excellence with the ambition to grow alongside our rapidly expanding business. Working at Mileway We offer an opportunity you simply won’t find anywhere else. Launched in 2019, Mileway has rapidly grown into Europe’s leader in last-mile logistics real estate, with a team of over 550 across more than twenty offices in 11 countries. From the start, Mileway set out to be a different kind of real estate company, with a cloud-based IT infrastructure and a team that combines local expertise with the pooled strengths of a pan-European presence. Our culture is fast-paced and highly international, with team members from more than 50 countries, bringing diverse perspectives and a “can-do” attitude to everything we do. While we have already achieved a lot, we’re only just getting started – our purpose is to be Europe’s leading provider of last mile logistics real estate, enabling businesses to thrive, driving sustainability forward, and shaping the cities of tomorrow. To get there, we live by our values: Drive, Trust, Grow, Together. At Mileway, we believe company growth comes from supporting the growth of our combined capabilities. That’s why we offer an in-house learning & development program where personal, professional, and business development go hand in hand, helping you carve out your own unique career path. You’ll be based at our Valencia office. While we embrace a flexible approach to work, our policy requires working from the office three days a week. To support this, we provide a state-of-the-art technology package to keep you connected at all times. What you will do Support the Group Controllership team in the consolidation of over 500 entities. Assist in preparing high-quality consolidated financial statements in accordance with IFRS. Manage the automated intercompany elimination process. Contribute to timely and accurate internal and external financial reporting. Review and analyze data from Investment Accounting teams. Identify and resolve data discrepancies through analysis and collaboration. Become a key user of our consolidation platform (OneStream), supporting database maintenance and reporting design. Maintain financial databases to reflect changes in legal structure or chart of accounts. Prepare and analyze financial reports, including KPIs, variance analysis, and deep-dive insights. Identify and implement opportunities for process improvement and automation. Serve as a key liaison with internal teams, auditors, and senior management What will you bring Education: Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Economics required. Master’s or accounting qualification (RA, ACCA, or equivalent) is a plus. Experience: 4–5 years in audit, consolidation, or financial reporting, ideally in a fast-paced, international environment. Mindset: Proactive, analytical, and solution-oriented, with a collaborative approach. Expertise: Comfortable working at both group and entity levels. Solid understanding of IFRS and technical group accounting. Tech Skills: Proficient in ERP systems and Microsoft Office Suite. Experience with consolidation tools like OneStream or Oracle Hyperion is advantageous. Attention to Detail: Consistently delivers accurate, high-quality work. Autonomy: Able to manage tasks independently and adapt to shifting priorities. Communication: Excellent written and verbal English skills. Bonus: Knowledge of real estate is helpful but not required.
