Our clients are funded by some of the world’s top investors, like Founders Fund, Sequoia Capital, and Andreessen Horowitz. Persona is a talent agency that recruits, trains, and staffs talented remote professionals such as yourself. This is an opportunity to work closely with the future Googles, Facebooks, and Amazons of the world—building out their organizations and helping them reach the next level of success. We support everyone we hire with training, mentoring, and technology resources so they are enabled to do their best and are as happy as possible in their roles. We have a large international team dedicated to supporting and taking care of new Persona team members, and our goal is to provide excellent long-term career opportunities for everyone who joins the team. Who’s building Persona? We are a global team of passionate problem solvers who love to build new things and make our customers happy. Our team is made up of motivated, hard-working people spanning the globe, united by a culture of learning and continuous improvement. What we’re looking for: We are looking for Assistant Project Managers to help our clients operate and scale different parts of their growing businesses. As an Assistant Project Manager you'll be a general problem solver, collaborating with different teams at our client company and helping them with various projects. Responsibilities—what you'll do: Business-to-Business Communication Client and Vendor Management Data Collection and Analysis Reports Generation and Documentation Project Management Tools Process Optimization Requirements: Fully fluent in English Skilled in the use of apps and technology Ability to commit long-term and full-time Ability to work U.S. business hours (Pacific Time, Central Time, or Eastern Time) No work experience is required, but we will take any work experience you have into account This position is for serious, career-oriented candidates Other qualities we look for: Track record of success at work or in school An ability to solve complex problems with minimal guidance Experience in high performance work or school environments Skilled at anticipating team members’ needs Willingness to work hard and persevere Intellectual curiosity and resourcefulness Professionalism What we offer: Best salaries in the industry Permanent ability to work from anywhere in the world Opportunities for growth and advancement A fast-paced and collaborative environment Warm and friendly company culture Full benefits Benefits at Persona: Health insurance Unlimited paid time off (paid sick and vacation leaves) Annual bonuses based on performance Monthly tech allowance Opportunity to be paid in your currency of choice Others depending on seniority This is a full-time and long-term role, dedicated exclusively to serving one of our clients. We are looking for individuals who are ready to fully commit their time and energy to one company and grow and develop along with that company. All roles at Persona are 100% work-from-anywhere (work from home or wherever it suits you best). If this is your first time working for a U.S. company, that’s okay; we provide guidance and assistance getting set up as a remote professional. Once hired, we will carefully match you to a client company of ours that perfectly suits your career background, skills, and goals. In case you or any exceptional people you know are exploring other roles, our rapidly growing company is also looking for new team members with backgrounds in administration, bookkeeping, accounting, finance, project management, operations, recruiting, human resources, content writing, social media management, research, executive assistance, customer service, customer support, technical support, data management, video editing, sales, account management, marketing, and design. Visit our website for more information: https://www.personatalent.com/

title: ¡Buscamos Project Manager de Marketplaces!
description: About the job ✨ Si Amazon Seller Central no tiene secretos para ti… este reto es para ti. ✨ ¿Quieres liderar un proyecto estratégico y crecer junto a una empresa en plena expansión? ¿Te apasiona el e-commerce y estás listo/a para dar el salto a liderar proyectos estratégicos? En Sidi Global Market S.L. estamos creciendo y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo. 🔎 ¿Qué harás en tu día a día? Gestionar y hacer crecer nuestra cuenta de Amazon Seller Central. Detectar oportunidades en otros marketplaces (eBay, ManoMano, TikTok Shop, etc.). Analizar datos de ventas y proponer acciones que generen impacto real. Coordinar con marketing, logística y operaciones para que todo fluya. Medir resultados, presentar informes y proponer mejoras continuas. ✅ Lo que buscamos en ti: Al menos 3 años de experiencia en gestión de Amazon u otros marketplaces. Buen manejo de Excel (reportes, análisis, fórmulas básicas/intermedias). Un perfil semi senior con ganas de liderar proyectos y crecer con la empresa. Proactividad, organización y mucha orientación a resultados. 🌟 Plus si tienes: Experiencia multicanal en varios marketplaces. Conocimientos en herramientas como Helium 10, Jungle Scout o Data Studio. Habilidades de comunicación y, si hablas inglés, mejor aún. 💼 Lo que te ofrecemos: La oportunidad de liderar un proyecto estratégico desde el inicio. Crecer con una empresa en plena expansión. Un entorno dinámico, joven y con mentalidad de equipo. Salario a convenir

title: Project Manager
description: About the job Fincons Group is an IT business consulting company that has been designing the digital future of leading companies on international markets for 40 years. Fincons Group built its reputation on foreseeing and interpreting new business models and the rapid evolution of IT systems by building a complete range of services: from research and consulting to design and development, from system integration of leading vendor software solutions right up to application management, supporting clients step by step along their digital transformation journey. Fincons is a multinational with over 2,600 people and several offices worldwide (in Italy, Switzerland, Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Belgium and the USA), but above all a Family Company where the founders play a strategic role with commitment and passion, grounding the company in the same principles of a united and caring family. We firmly believe in the value of cooperation and in the contribution that every idea and intuition can bring. We believe that everyone’s effort can make a difference. Transforming knowledge into a strategic resource is our company mission, and we pursue it with the help of our most strategic asset: our people. Fincons is looking for a Product Owner/Project Manager Platform and Tooling Delivery platform: Azure DevOps, with CI/CD pipelines. Product Owners are expected to work within this environment. Additional tools include: • Slack – team communication • Azure DevOps – SCRUM management • Google Analytics, Microsoft Clarity, Sentry, ThousandEyes – monitoring and analytics • Figma – design collaboration English (B2) required Office: Rome modality of work: Full remote Our personnel search is addressed to candidates of all genders. The data will be processed and stored exclusively for the purposes of this or future selections, in compliance with the Federal Data Protection Law (LPD) and guaranteeing the rights referred to in art. 13 Legislative Decree 196/03 and EU regulation 679/2016 (GDPR)

title: Art Project Manager
description: About the job BrainRocket is a software development company and digital solutions provider. The company has created over 40 cutting-edge products spanning 20 different markets. Our team of around 670 tech-savvy professionals successfully delivers scalable projects that are custom-made to the customers’ needs. We also strive to create a culture centered around personal and professional growth for employees, in a positive and welcoming environment. We're looking for an experienced Art Manager to join our team in Warsaw. (preferably with experience in the advertising industry) ✅ Responsibilities: ✔️Assist with quarterly planning sessions, including preparation, execution, estimation, and post-analysis. ✔️Coordinate with cross-functional teams to gather input, set priorities, and make timelines. ✔️Identify and highlight dependencies, risks, and issues related to planning processes. ✔️Prepare key presentations: collecting content and cooperate with designer to make the presentation ✔️Assist with design and implement new workflows and process enhancements. ✔️Participate as a facilitator in estimation sessions and other process related meetings ✔️Develop and maintain comprehensive process documentation and planning materials. ✔️Prepare weekly reports on PMO's quarter progress and other internal reports ✔️Support organizational change initiatives through effective planning and communication. ✔️Provide training and support to teams adapting to new processes and tools. ✔️Identify potential risks in planning and operational processes. ✔️Develop risk mitigation strategies and ensure implementation. ✔️Monitor risks and adjust plans as necessary to maintain project continuity. ✅ Requirements: ✔️Proficiency in English (written and spoken) is essential. ✔️2 years of experience in business process management, planning, and operational coordination. ✔️Experience with quarterly planning cycles and project management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence, Trello). ✔️Experience with process automation tools (e.g., Jira). ✔️Experience with planning cycles for IT companies with a high rate of changes to the planning ✔️Experience in facilitating workshops and training sessions for process improvements. ✅ We offer excellent benefits, including but not limited to: 🧑🏻‍💻Learning and development opportunities and interesting challenging tasks; 📝 Official employment in accordance with the laws of Cyprus and the EU, registration of family members; ✈️ Relocation package (tickets, staying in a hotel for 2 weeks); 🏋️‍♂️ Company fitness corner in the office for employees; 📚 Opportunity to develop language skills and partial compensation for the cost of language classes; 🎁 Birthday celebration present; 🏝 Time for proper rest and 24 working days of Annual Vacation; 🍲 Breakfasts and lunches in the office (partially paid by the company).

title: Project Manager (GameDev)
description: About the job About us Artificial Core is a developer and publisher of Corepunk. Corepunk is one of the most anticipated MMO RPG's right now. Our motto - Good enough is not enough. Early Access Trailer Official Announcement Trailer Corepunk Gameplay: Professions "The Corepunk Update We've All Been Waiting For" Headquartered in Amsterdam with locations in Kyiv and Athens, we're collaborating with studios and talent all over the world. Corepunk Team About the job We’re looking for a Project Manager to join our team and help with the organization and management of the company workflow. Developing MMO games is very challenging. In our view it is as much rewarding. We want to find someone who shares our passion for challenge and excellence to enjoy this path together. Responsibilities Ensuring clear communication with the key stakeholders, passing information to them about statuses of the development processes. Interacting with art and technical teams Identifying and assessing risk, their further escalation and search for ways to avoid them Workflow planning and controlling of the development terms at all stages Creating reports, statistics and team performance reports Searching for ways to optimize teams workflows Creating new workflows and improving the existing ones in Jira Participating in the project documentation preparation Project structure organization, files and folders distribution, working on creation and structuring of game assets naming Requirements +2 years of IT project management experience Good command of English - verbal and written skills, ability to freely communicate and present ideas Profound knowledge of project management, understanding of principles, tools and techniques of project management Possessing skills to plan, structure and automate your work, formulate requirements and convert them into tasks Ability to quickly identify problems, offer solutions and implement them Ability to work on different projects simultaneously Reliability, excellent organizational skills, punctuality, team player Tactful, friendly, easy to communicate with Keen to learn and develop within the role Passion for video games Will be a plus Understanding the use of technologies in game development Work experience within the game development industry Software programming skills, UI development, QA CSM or other Agile certification Benefits You’ll play a key role in delivering a highly anticipated new IP MMO RPG for millions of players. Flexible schedule Remote work 28 days of annual leave (including 12 paid public holidays, 16 bonus days, and 2 additional days for corporate events) Enjoy the "behind the scenes of Corepunk". Take a sneak peek at the team working and having fun over the years from 2016. We hope it will give you a feel for the atmosphere at Artificial Core. We’d be happy to see you with us 😉

title: Business Analyst (productos/procesos bancarios) (100% remoto, solo España)
description: About the job ¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestro equipo! Para que nos conozcas algo mejor, UST es una multinacional norteamericana certificada como Top Employer y Great Place To Work, con más de 35.000 empleados a nivel global y con presencia en más de 35 países. Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías. ¿Qué buscamos? Estamos en búsqueda de un/a Business Analyst con experiencia en productos y/o procesos bancarios, con posibilidad de trabajar de forma 100% remota, junto con uno de nuestros clientes, líder en su sector a nivel nacional. Modalidad: Teletrabajo Horario: de L-V de 9.00 a 18.00 horas. Objetivos del puesto: Apoyar al Product Owner del producto en proyectos de IT dentro del dominio. Requisitos Necesarios: 3 años de experiencia mínima en rol de Business Analyst. Experiencia en comunicación efectiva con stakeholders digitales: Es importante que el candidato tenga experiencia en mantener una comunicación fluida y transparente con todas las partes interesadas digitales, incluyendo clientes, equipos de desarrollo, equipos financieros y reguladores, asegurando una comprensión compartida de los requisitos, expectativas y progreso del proyecto digital. Conocimiento de uno o varios productos / procesos bancarios (cuentas, pagos, tarjetas, contabilidad, préstamos, depósitos, Contact center, wealth, onboarding, etc.). Uso de Jira y Confluence. Experiencia en proyectos bajo metodología Agile (Skrum, Kanban, etc.). Buenas habilidades comunicativas para trabajar en equipo de forma colaborativa. Muy buenas habilidades con Power Point para documentar los distintos procesos. Tener experiencia trabajando con áreas cross de la compañía (Legal, Compliance, Producto…) para trasladar sus necesidades/especificaciones a requerimientos funcionales del producto. Principales funciones: Toma de requerimientos Planificación de requerimientos Seguimiento de los desarrollos de los equipos Preparación, seguimiento y validación del testing Paquetización de requerimientos para subidas a entornos Pre / Pro Gestión de incidencias Reporting interno y seguimiento de KPIs Realización de Presentaciones (PPT) Idiomas: Español Nativo Ingles C1 ¿Qué te ofrecemos? 23 días laborables de vacaciones y el 24 y 31 de diciembre. Numerosos beneficios sociales (seguro médico, ayuda al teletrabajo, seguro de vida y seguro de accidentes). Programa de Retribución Flexible (tarjeta comida, cheques guardería, tarjeta transporte, clases de inglés online, seguro médico para tu familia…). Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación. Estabilidad y carrera profesional. Tenemos implantado un plan de compensación de referencias internas. Posibilidad de elección de percibir tu salario en 12 o 14 pagas. Medidas de conciliación (teletrabajo, asesoramiento de especialistas (psicólogo, nutricionista, entrenador personal). Plataforma UST Club descuentos y descuentos en gimnasios. Si quieres conocer más, no dudes en inscribirte y nos pondremos en contacto contigo para ampliarte información de la posición ¡Te estamos esperando! En UST nos comprometemos con la igualdad de oportunidades en nuestros procesos de selección y no realizamos ningún tipo de discriminación por razón de raza, género, discapacidad, edad, religión, orientación sexual o nacionalidad. Estamos comprometidos con la discapacidad y apostamos por la incorporación de personas con certificado de discapacidad.

title: Project Manager
description: About the job FERCHAU Spain, provee servicios de ingeniería avanzada en el sector aeroespacial, automoción, ferroviario, IT, maquinaria industrial y plantas. Formamos parte de un grupo alemán fuertemente consolidado, reconocido por ser uno de los líderes de la ingeniería alemana y con presencia en Alemania, Austria, Francia, Polonia, Reino Unido e India. Ferchau lo forman alrededor de 11.000 empleados con más de 100 Oficinas técnicas. En Ferchau Spain contamos actualmente con un equipo de 300 ingenieros y técnicos, con oficinas en Madrid, Bilbao, Sevilla, Barcelona y Valencia donde estamos ampliando nuestra presencia, gracias a nuestro conocimiento, la realización de proyectos innovadores y de alto valor añadido. Actualmente estamos buscando el siguiente perfil para poder trabajar desde nuestro equipo 100% en remoto. Responsabilidades principales Gestión integral de proyectos: Liderar la planificación, ejecución y seguimiento de los proyectos, garantizando entregables de calidad y en los plazos establecidos. Alineación con stakeholders: Coordinar de manera continua con los principales interlocutores internos: Negocio local (equipos regionales de Servicio) Negocio global (Operaciones de Servicio central) ITO (Tecnología de la Información & Organización) Análisis de requisitos: Recoger y analizar requerimientos globales de todas las regiones de Servicio. Documentación de procesos de negocio: Traducir los requisitos en documentación formal de procesos, incluyendo flujos futuros (To-Be). Facilitación de workshops: Organizar y moderar sesiones de trabajo con stakeholders para validar procesos y definir soluciones. Gestión del cambio: Identificar impactos organizativos y apoyar la adopción de nuevos procesos. Reporte de progreso: Proporcionar actualizaciones periódicas de estado, identificar riesgos y proponer planes de mitigación. Requisitos Formación / Cualificación: Gestión de proyectos. Conocimientos en SAP ECC & S/4 Hana enfocado al área de Servicio (módulo CS). Fuertes habilidades de comunicación. Manejo de Power BI (capacidad para construir dashboards). Gestión de aplicaciones digitales. Formación complementaria: Gestión de herramientas (HILTI). Disponibilidad: Visitas ocasionales a Pamplona para la alineación de hitos del proyecto. Competencias y experiencia requerida Hard Skills: Experiencia demostrada en gestión de proyectos de transformación de procesos de negocio. Dominio de herramientas de documentación de procesos (ej. BPMN, ARIS, Visio). Familiaridad con entornos SAP y procesos de Operaciones de Servicio. Alta capacidad para estructurar y redactar documentación profesional y clara. Inglés avanzado imprescindible; español y alemán son valorables.

title: Project Manager | Solar & Storage
description: About the job Power Electronics es el líder mundial de almacenamiento energético y el primer fabricante de inversores solares para plantas fotovoltaicas en América, Oceanía y Europa. Con presencia en más de 1600 proyectos de energía renovable distribuidos en todo el mundo, y más de 60GW de potencia AC instalada, que han permitido evitar la emisión de más de 60,5 millones de toneladas de CO2 al medio ambiente. Power Electronics cuenta con 25 delegaciones internacionales diseñadas para mejorar el bienestar de sus 2500 empleados. Power Electronics cuenta con la tecnología más avanzada en su planta de producción, donde la integración vertical de todo el proceso es uno de sus principales valores. Gracias a sus cuatro divisiones: energía solar, almacenamiento energético, movilidad eléctrica e industrial, Power Electronics promueve la energía renovable alrededor del mundo. ¿Cómo sería tu día a día? Liderar la relación como responsable y contacto exclusivo con el cliente, identificando sus necesidad y resolviendo las dudas que plantee durante el transcurso del proyecto. Liderar la coordinación y el flujo de la información entre las diferentes áreas internas, así como gestionar la relación con el cliente desde el inicio del periodo hasta la puesta en marcha correcta de los equipos entregados. Control y seguimiento de proyectos ( cronograma & hitos) identificando posibles desviaciones, y tomando las decisiones e impulsando las acciones necesarias para el cumplimiento de la planificación del proyecto. Supervisar y asegurar el correcto control y recopilación de toda la información y documentación tanto interna como externa asociada al proyecto. Supervisar y controlar la contabilidad asociada a los proyectos para emitir la facturación. Supervisar la coordinación y ejecución de la fabricación, las compras y el transporte con el objetivo de garantizar el cumplimiento de los compromisos de la compañía con los clientes. Análisis de las especificaciones y las necesidades del proyecto junto con el departamento de preventa. Elaborar informes de progreso. Reportar sobre el desarrollo del proyecto. ¿Qué necesitamos que tengas? Licenciatura y/o Grado Universitario, preferiblemente en Ingeniería eléctrica, electrónica, energías renovables o similares Máster o formación especialista en gestión y dirección de proyectos (Project Manager) Inglés Nivel Avanzado ¿Cuál es nuestro propósito? Contribuir al desarrollo de la tecnología para generar energía limpia que ayude al medio ambiente guiados por nuestros valores de Excelencia, Innovación, Flexibilidad y Sostenibilidad ¿Qué nos hace especiales? Te ofrecemos un proyecto estable. Horario flexible. Seguro médico privado cubierto por Power Electronics. Servicio de autobús gratuito Valencia - Campus Llíria Comedor subvencionado. Retribución Flexible (Restaurante, Guardería, Transporte, Formación). Gimnasio propio en las instalaciones. Parking de Cargadores gratuito. Pertenece a la comunidad PE y participa en eventos internos deportivos, talleres de sostenibilidad, días en familia, etc. Apostamos por la Formación a través de nuestro departamento de Universidad Corporativa. Welcome to PE Generation! En Power Electronics valoramos a las personas por su aportación de valor profesional formando parte de nuestra cultura empresarial los principios de Integridad, Igualdad, Transparencia y Compromiso cívico. Power Electronics está comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades en todos los ámbitos y especialmente, en el acceso al empleo y desarrollo profesional, sin discriminar por razón de sexo, estado civil, edad, condición social, religión o convicciones, orientación e identidad sexual, expresión de género, características sexuales, así como por razón de la lengua.

title: Software Project Manager
description: About the job En Preference, llevamos más de 30 años desarrollando soluciones tecnológicas que transforman el sector del cerramiento a nivel internacional. Nuestra misión es clara: ofrecer software innovador que impulse la digitalización de nuestros clientes y contribuya a su crecimiento. Estamos en plena ejecución de proyectos estratégicos de gran alcance, y buscamos a una persona que nos ayude a conectar la visión global con el detalle técnico, liderando la supervisión transversal de los desarrollos, y aportando visibilidad, estructura y foco en la entrega. Si tienes experiencia en proyectos de software complejos, hablas el lenguaje de los Product Owners y Tech Leads, y dominas Jira más allá del uso habitual… ¡Queremos conocerte! Propósito del Rol: Supervisar y mantener actualizada de forma centralizada la evolución global de los proyectos estratégicos de software, incluyendo arquitectura funcional, planificación técnica, prioridades, fechas clave y entregables. Este rol asegura la coordinación entre Product Owners y Tech Leads, así como la trazabilidad operativa, financiera y estratégica del proyecto. Responsabilidades Actualizar y mantener la visión global del proyecto, incluyendo arquitectura funcional, roadmap, fechas clave, interdependencias entre módulos, riesgos y entregables. Será la fuente de referencia transversal para todo el equipo y la dirección. Participar en reuniones con clientes para hacer seguimiento de entregas, gestionar cambios de alcance o prioridades, y reportar el avance. Supervisar la planificación técnica definida por los Tech Leads y sus equipos, asegurando la correcta alineación entre historias de usuario y las dependencias entre desarrollos. Coordinar con los Product Owners la coherencia de las historias de usuario, gestionando su integración dentro de la visión global del proyecto. Controlar la evolución de las tareas en Jira, detectando cuellos de botella, bloqueos o desviaciones respecto a los objetivos y cronograma definidos. Aportar visibilidad y orden mediante el diseño y mantenimiento de dashboards avanzados en Jira (filtros, automatizaciones, informes). Supervisar la correcta imputación de horas por parte del equipo (Toggl, Jira) y su relación con la facturación y rentabilidad del proyecto. Mantener actualizada la información de estado de proyectos y generar informes operativos y estratégicos para Dirección. Colaborar en la mejora continua de los procesos operativos, proponiendo ajustes en las herramientas o metodologías que aumenten eficiencia y visibilidad. Coordinar entregas parciales y aprobaciones funcionales con stakeholders. Requisitos Experiencia +5 años como Project Manager en entornos de desarrollo de software, gestionando proyectos de larga duración con múltiples stakeholders. Coordinación de equipos internacionales, multidisciplinares, y experiencia supervisando a varios Product Owners y Tech Leads en paralelo. Experiencia gestionando proyectos con seguimiento financiero, control de imputaciones y reportes ejecutivos. Formación y Conocimientos Técnicos Titulación técnica universitaria (Ingeniería, Informática, Telecomunicaciones) o experiencia equivalente. Nivel avanzado de Jira (no solo uso básico: dominio de flujos, automatizaciones, filtros JQL, dashboards personalizados, gestión de proyectos y configuración de tableros). Familiaridad con Toggl o herramientas similares de time-tracking. Inglés avanzado. Habilidades clave Pensamiento estructurado y visión global. Rigor organizativo, capacidad de priorización y orientación a resultados. Comunicación efectiva con perfiles técnicos, funcionales y clientes. Capacidad analítica y foco en mejora continua. Características del puesto Horario flexible de lunes a viernes 7h a 15h. 2h de flexibilidad de entrada y/o salida Modalidad presencial. Parque tecnológico de Paterna (Valencia) Disponibilidad desplazamientos a cliente. ¿Qué ofrece la empresa? Immersión en una empresa con más de 30 años como líder en el desarrollo técnico de alto nivel. Trabajar colaborativamente con equipos expertos. Aprendizaje y evolución continua. Salario en función de conocimiento aportado (nuestro modelo salarial se basa en la contribución de valor a la compañía y mantiene una línea objetiva y transparente a los equipos). Retribución flexible Beneficios en gimnasios, gratuidad en consumos de cafetería Clases de inglés Incorporación en una compañía con mucho potencial de crecimiento y desarrollo

title: Project Manager, Player Care- Monopoly Go!
description: About the job Scopely is looking for a Project Manager in Customer Support to join our Monopoly GO! Game team in one of our global studio hubs or remotely. At Scopely, we care deeply about what we do and want to inspire play every day - whether in our work environments alongside our talented colleagues or through our deep connections with our communities of players. We are a global team of game lovers who are developing, publishing and innovating the mobile games industry, connecting millions of people around the world daily. Monopoly GO! is our new casual game and a key franchise that has just become Scopely’s largest game, enjoyed by millions of players. The team is based in Europe and the US, and works every day to create captivating new experiences for our players. What You Will Do As Project Manager, you will work alongside a team responsible for driving excellence in delivering product insights, running outsourced support operations and designing state-of-the-art technology to support our players. Responsibilities include: Utilise project management skills to oversee game-related development projects. Monitor and report on project metrics and KPIs to ensure deliverables meet the highest quality standards Work in close partnership with Product and Technology stakeholders, ensuring clear communication and effective management of timelines and deliverables. Lead war room management during critical project phases Manage relationships with external vendors, including handling day-to-day operational processes Partner with cross-functional teams to provide insights leading to direct improvements of player experience in the game Develop and manage a comprehensive knowledge base and ensure training processes are up to date What We’re Looking For 3+ years of project management experience in the video game or tech industry Proven track record of successfully managing projects from inception to completion based on business case and expected impact. Great communication skills within multicultural, pluridisciplinary teams Experience with data and BI presentation tools (Looker, Tableau, …) A passion for making players enjoy world-class mobile, social and casual games. At Scopely, we create games for everyone - and want to ensure that the people behind our games reflect that! We are committed to creating a diverse, supportive work environment where everyone is treated with respect. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to join us & embrace the adventure! About Us Scopely is a global interactive entertainment and mobile-first video game company, home to many top, award-winning experiences such as "MONOPOLY GO!," “Star Trek™ Fleet Command,” “Stumble Guys,” “MARVEL Strike Force,” and “Yahtzee® With Buddies,” among others. Scopely creates, publishes, and live-operates immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer™ experience across multiple platforms--from mobile, web, PC and beyond. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform Playgami that supports one of the most diversified portfolios in the games industry. Recognized multiple times as one of Fast Company’s “World’s Most Innovative Companies,” Scopely is a multi-billion-dollar business due to its ability to create long-lasting game experiences that players enjoy for years. Scopely has global operations in more than a dozen markets across Asia, EMEA, and North America, and is home to many internal game development teams, referred to as Scopely Studios, with additional game studio partners across four continents. Scopely was acquired by Savvy Games Group in July 2023 for $4.9 billion, and is now an independent subsidiary of Savvy. For more information on Scopely, visit: scopely.com Notice to candidates: Scopely, Inc and its affiliates will never request payment or ask for financial information as a condition for applying to a position or receiving an offer of employment. All official Scopely, Inc. recruiters only use email domains that end with @scopely.com. Our official website is www.scopely.com. Please only apply to positions posted on our official website and ensure the recruiter only communicates via the official email domain. Should you have any questions or encounter any fraudulent requests/emails/websites, please immediately contact recruiting@scopely.com. Our job applicant privacy policies are available here: California Privacy Notice and EEA/UK Privacy Notice. Employment at Scopely is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications. Scopely does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

title: Junior Compliance Analyst
description: About the job 🚀 Join Us in Protecting the Future of Web3 At Dapper Labs, we’re building the future of digital ownership by making Web3 accessible and empowering users to engage with blockchain technology in safe, meaningful, and enjoyable ways. Whether it’s NFTs or fintech, creators or collectors, we’re shaping the next generation of digital experiences. We’re looking for a Junior Compliance Analyst to join our Risk Operations team and help us protect our community from financial crime, detect suspicious activity, and respond to blockchain-based threats. This role requires weekend availability and hands-on experience with Chainalysis, identity verification platforms, and SQL. 🔍 What You’ll Do Monitor transactions and activity using Chainalysis to detect and escalate suspicious activity in real time. Conduct thorough investigations of account activities as a result of transaction monitoring alerts Facilitate Request for Information (RFI) in the investigation of transaction monitoring cases Review and validate identity documentation using Persona, Sardine, and similar platforms. Investigate potentially fraudulent or high-risk users by analyzing behavioral patterns, wallet activity, and verification inconsistencies. Use SQL to extract and analyze user and transaction data to support investigations and compliance reporting. Conduct enhanced due diligence (EDD) reviews for high-risk users and escalate findings as needed. Collaborate with internal teams (Fraud, Payments, Engineering) to implement improvements in compliance workflows and alert handling. Maintain detailed supporting information used during investigation and audit logs to ensure regulatory readiness. 💼 What You Bring 2+ years of experience in a compliance, fraud, trust & safety, or risk operations role, ideally in fintech, crypto, or Web3. Prior experience in case management tools, alert queue systems, or crypto exchange environments. Hands-on experience with Chainalysis or other blockchain analytics tools. Proficiency in SQL—you’re comfortable writing queries and digging into raw data. Familiarity with ID verification platforms like Persona, Sardine, or similar. Strong attention to detail and analytical thinking with the ability to recognize patterns and anomalies. Comfort with working independently on weekends and managing time-sensitive case escalations. Excellent written communication skills, especially for investigative summaries and internal documentation. Understanding of blockchain fundamentals, NFT ecosystems, and digital wallets. Knowledge of BSA/AML, OFAC, and global KYC/EDD regulatory requirements is a strong plus. A strong team player who is also able to work independently with minimal oversight. ✨ Nice to Haves Experience with manual process automation; specifically AI Agents Experience working with ticketing systems such as Zendesk, Freshdesk, or other case management tools. Why You’ll Love Working Here 🌍 Remote-first culture with flexible hours and a global team. 🚀 Work on the cutting edge of Web3, NFTs, and fintech. 🧠 Learn fast with direct exposure to real fraud cases and rapid decision-making. 💡 Be part of a mission-driven company building the trusted foundation for decentralized experiences.

title: Remote Data Analyst – Spanish Language (ES)
description: About the job A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst: In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information. No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement. Basic Requirements Full Professional Proficiency in Spanish language Being a resident in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Spain Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world! Once you have successfully applied and registered, please send a confirmation email to jasmin.loja@telusdigital.com with the subject line: Subject: Application Confirmation - [Job Title] via Linkedin to ensure your application is processed. Please include the email address you used to register.

title: Quality Monitoring Analyst REMOTO
description: About the job ✨¡Nueva vacante de Analista de Control de Calidad media jornada en REMOTO!✨ En INIZIO Engage buscamos un Analista de Control de Calidad (Quality Monitoring Analyst) para trabajar a media jornada en REMOTO, en un nuevo proyecto internacional con un laboratorio de renombre, para empezar en Septiembre. ¿Tienes formación en CC de la Salud, experiencia monitorizando llamadas o en atención al cliente, dando formaciones y quieres trabajar 100% desde casa? ¡Esta es tu oportunidad! ✅¿Qué harás? Garantizar la precisión, cumplimiento y calidad del trabajo realizado por el personal del centro de atención telefónico. Revisar llamadas, informes y casos adversos y reclamaciones sobre la calidad de los productos. Confirmar el cumplimiento de las buenas prácticas (GDP). Apoyar la implementación y cumplimiento de los procesos de garantía de calidad. Realización de auditorías internas y seguimiento. Contribución a la cultura de mejora contínua. 👀 ¿Qué perfil buscamos? Formación en CC de la Salud (licenciatura preferible). Preferible experiencia previa en industria farmacéutica y/o sanitaria. Necesario conocimiento y familiaridad con terminología médica compleja. Al menos 2 años de experiencia previa en call center, preferiblemente ámbito sanitario. Dominio del inglés (B2-C1) en conversación. Capacidad de priorización y organización altos. Habilidades de resolución de problemas, pensamiento crítico y atención al detalle. Excelentes habilidades comunicativas Dominio del paquete Office, uso de CRM, y acostumbrado a softwares de llamadas. 💸¿Qué ofrecemos? Trabajo 100% remoto en España. Contrato de media jornada, indefinido con INIZIO Engage. Remuneración anual: 13.500€ SFBA + 10% incentivos Herramientas IT (portátil + teléfono). Flexibilidad horaria. Formación inicial y seguimiento continuo. Proyecto dinámico y con impacto en la salud de los pacientes. Posibilidades de evolución en la compañía. ¿Te interesa esta oportunidad o conoces a alguien que encaje en la descripción? ¡No dejes pasar esta ocasión y aplica o comparte! 🙌 Inizio Engage es un partner estratégico del sector Health & Life Sciences. 💊 ¡Además somos una de las 100 mejores Empresas en España para trabajar según Forbes! 😎 Nuestro equipo global aumenta la experiencia local y la mezcla diversa de habilidades con datos, ciencia y tecnología para ofrecer soluciones de compromiso a medida que ayudan a nuestros clientes a reimaginar cómo se relacionan con sus pacientes, personas y proveedores para mejorar sus resultados. Nuestra misión es colaborar con nuestros clientes para mejorar vidas ayudando a los profesionales sanitarios y a los pacientes a obtener los medicamentos, los conocimientos y el apoyo que necesitan. Creemos en nuestros valores: 💜Capacitamos a todos/Aceptamos el reto/Trabajamos unidos/Preguntamos qué pasaría si/Hacemos lo correcto, y te preguntaremos cómo se alinean tus valores personales con ellos. Para saber más sobre nosotros, visítanos en Nuestra Web En Inizio Engage nos enorgullece ser una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Aquí todos son considerados sin distinción de edad, ascendencia, color, género, identidad o expresión de género, información genética, estado civil, condición médica (incluyendo embarazo, parto o condiciones médicas relacionadas), discapacidad mental o física, origen nacional, cuidado familiar protegido o estado de licencia médica, raza, religión, orientación sexual o cualquier otra característica protegida por las leyes estatales o locales. En Inizio, nos esforzamos por brindar oportunidades equitativas para todos. Agradecemos mucho tu interés en unirte a nuestro equipo y trabajaremos en considerar a aquellos candidatos que cumplan con los criterios de selección establecidos. 🌈

title: Technical Project Manager / Delivery Manager (Fully Remote)
description: About the job We’re a small but fast-growing Web3 development agency (14 people right now) and we’re looking for someone who’s sharp, organized, ambitious, and client-focused to join us as our Technical Project Manager / Delivery Manager. This is not a corporate environment — we’re young, flexible, and fast-paced. Most of our team is based in Western Europe, fully remote. As long as you’re getting things done, you can set up your day however you like (we just ask for 8 working hours between 9am–9pm CEST). What the Role Looks Like This role is a mix between project manager and delivery manager. You’ll be making sure projects run smoothly end-to-end: communication, timelines, onboarding, launches, and client experience. We want someone who’s not just “tracking tasks” but really owning delivery and making both clients and devs feel supported. Communication & Updates → Clear, structured updates so clients never chase you. → Proactive about risks, timelines, and next steps. → Professional but approachable tone at all times. Project Management & Process → Create clear roadmaps and milestones. → Keep scope and deliverables under control. → Spot risks/dependencies before they cause problems. → Keep tickets/issues organized (Notion, Slack). Onboarding & Kickoff → Onboard clients with welcome pack, kickoff call, tool setup (Slack/Telegram, repos, boards). → Align goals, scope, and success metrics early. → Make sure we get them early wins in the first 1–2 weeks. Deployment & Launch → Manage final launch flows. → Use proper launch checklists (performance, SEO, security, mobile responsiveness). → Support clients with training, handover docs, Looms. → Run smooth launches with clear communication and a fallback plan. Client Experience → Explain decisions in a way that builds confidence. → Reduce stress during crunch moments. → Celebrate milestones and keep relationships strong post-delivery. Proactivity → Spot potential opportunities with clients (upsells, connections, etc.) → Bring new ideas, industry best practices, and a partner mindset. What We’re Looking For Agency experience → you’ve worked at a software/dev agency before. Technical fluency → you don’t need to code daily, but you should understand how full-stack JS apps (frontend + backend) are built. Notion skills → we use it heavily for project coordination, so you should be comfortable. Languages → strong English (written & spoken). Spanish is a big plus. People skills → this role is about trust and communication. You should be clear, empathetic, and able to keep clients calm and confident. Proactive → ****Self-motivated, proactive problem-solver, and dedicated to delivering high-quality work. Strives for perfection in their craft and displays genuine care for the projects and potential challenges that may arise with clients. What You’ll Get Full remote flexibility, with a team spread across Europe. A young, ambitious team (we move fast, no bureaucracy). A role that actually grows with you — we’re scaling and you’ll have space to step up. The chance to directly shape how we deliver projects and work with clients. Salary range: $2,000-$3,000 depending on experience

title: Ecommerce Data Analyst
description: About the job Tired of inheriting someone else’s messy dashboards? Ready to build the entire BI function from the ground up - your way? We’re looking for a hands-on Ecommerce Data Analyst to help a fast-scaling DTC team stop guessing and start acting on real data. This is a unique opportunity to architect a clean, scalable data infrastructure from scratch, enabling data-driven decisions across marketing, ops, product, and leadership. If you love collecting, cleaning, and connecting data - and transforming that into insights that actually drive action - this is your chance to make a massive impact in a company that’s hungry for your expertise. YOUR MISSION To build and own a brand-new Business Intelligence system, structuring raw, fragmented data from multiple sources into accessible dashboards and reports that empower the teams to optimize performance, identify inefficiencies, and make smarter decisions. This is a full-time, contractor role. WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU Architect the company’s entire BI stack and define best practices from day one Work with high-leverage datasets from platforms like Shopify, Meta Ads, GA, TripleWhale, Klaviyo, Checkout champ, Phone Apps, and more Operate independently in a low-data-maturity environment where your work will directly drive growth Work from anywhere with a fully international and global team WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING Build a brand-new Business Intelligence infrastructure from scratch Collect and connect data from multiple marketing and analytics platforms to create a unified view of performance Work with large datasets and create custom AI bots Build and maintain automated processes that transform raw data into structured, usable insights Design intuitive dashboards and reports that help the team make fast, informed decisions Turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive marketing strategy and funnel performance Spot anomalies or underperformance early and flag them to key stakeholders Work cross-functionally with teams across marketing, tech, and leadership to improve data visibility and measurement WHO YOU ARE Experience: 3+ years in ecommerce data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics roles with exposure to data infrastructure and performance reporting Builder Mentality: You’ve worked in (or thrive in) low-data-maturity environments and know how to get results without perfect tools Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL and comfortable working with Python or similar scripting tools to automate and structure data Platform Familiarity: Experienced with key marketing data sources like Shopify, GA, Facebook Ads, and email platforms Analytical & Strategic: You connect the dots across funnel stages, ROI metrics, and ad performance to guide decision-making Self-Starter: Comfortable working independently and building systems from the ground up in a fast-paced environment Collaborative Partner: Skilled at working across departments and aligning data initiatives with company objectives Software Background: Bonus if you have a foundation in software engineering to collaborate more effectively with developers RECRUITMENT PROCESS Intro Chat: A quick intro call to understand your experience and motivations Tech Interview: Deep dive into your technical abilities and past experience Task: A small, real-world BI task to see how you think and communicate Final Chat: We’ll align expectations, goals, and finalize the next steps

title: Creative Project Manager
description: About the job As a Creative Project Manager at Designity, you’ll be the driving force behind high-impact creative projects—from branding and digital campaigns to web builds and content production. You’ll connect the dots between client goals and creative execution, leading cross-functional teams with precision, speed, and a sharp eye for creative quality. You’ll also leverage AI-powered tools to streamline workflows, eliminate bottlenecks, and keep projects moving faster—so your team can stay focused on what matters most: delivering bold, effective creative work. ‍ Designity is a Creative-as-a-Service (CaaS) platform that empowers businesses with a flexible, high-quality, and scalable alternative to traditional agencies and in-house teams. ‍ Our unique model connects marketing and creative leaders with the top 3% of US-based creative and marketing talent, all led by experienced Creative Directors, Project Managers, and Marketing Strategists. Through our collaborative platform, we streamline the creative process, ensuring fast, high-impact execution without the inefficiencies of hiring in-house or the high costs of traditional agencies. ‍ Brands like Calendly, Kung Fu Tea, and Marriott Hotels trust Designity to handle their design and marketing needs, proving that there's a better way to scale creativity. Unlike in-house hiring, which is expensive and skill-limiting, or marketplaces like Upwork and Fiverr, which lack reliability and creative oversight, Designity delivers a seamless, results-driven approach that makes creative collaboration effortless. ‍ PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead end-to-end creative projects across branding, campaigns, websites, and digital content—from kickoff through delivery. Collaborate with Creative Directors to turn client goals into clear briefs, timelines, and actionable creative strategies. Manage scope, schedules, and resources across multiple projects to ensure on-time, high-quality execution. Own client communications—setting expectations, sharing updates, leading reviews, and resolving issues with clarity and confidence. Guide creative teams through each phase of work, ensuring alignment, brand consistency, and strategic impact. Evaluate in-progress creative against project goals, providing structure and feedback that drives executional quality. Leverage AI tools and automation to streamline task management, optimize workflows, and speed up delivery. Monitor project performance, identify risks early, and make real-time adjustments to keep work on track. Improve processes continuously—identifying gaps in delivery, communication, or structure and implementing smarter solutions. REQUIREMENTS: 5+ years of experience managing creative projects, campaigns, or brand initiatives in an agency or similar creative environment. Strong understanding of end-to-end creative workflows across branding, digital design, marketing, and content. Proven ability to lead cross-functional creative teams, evaluate work, and ensure alignment with brand and business goals. Demonstrated success managing multiple fast-paced projects with shifting priorities and tight timelines. Experience working directly with clients—owning communication, presenting creative, and navigating feedback cycles. Hands-on experience with project management and collaboration tools, or equivalent platforms. Strong track record of applying AI or automation to improve project operations, team efficiency, or creative output. Excellent organizational and communication skills with a high degree of accountability. Comfortable working independently in a fully remote environment. Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Design, or a related field is a plus. ‍ BENEFITS: Join a company at the perfect moment! Career making opportunity. Work remotely full-time, within a virtual office environment. Unwind during the flexible PTO (available after 90 days), and company holidays. Professional growth opportunities and ongoing training. Enjoy dedicated focus times designed to boost your productivity and creativity. Fast-moving, values-driven, globally distributed team. In order to be considered for this position, you need to complete the application process at www.designity.com/careers/creative-project-manager ‍ Please do NOT follow up on your application. We will be in touch within 2-3 weeks if you're qualified. ‍ At Designity, employment decisions are based on business needs, qualifications, and merit. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, valuing diversity in culture, perspectives, skills, and experiences, which strengthens our team, clients, and products. Be cautious when applying. Official communications from Designity will come only from the Designity.com domain. We will never request payment details. Beware of scammers using fake domains like Designity.team to attempt fraud.

title: Junior Talent Coordinator (Remote within Spain)
description: About the job At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration. We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before. We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page! About The Role Leadtech is growing, and we're looking for a Talent Coordinator to help us streamline and enhance our hiring processes. As we expand, ensuring a smooth and efficient candidate experience is crucial to attracting top talent. We need someone organized, proactive, and passionate about supporting recruitment operations. Do you have experience coordinating hiring processes in the digital industry? If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working closely with recruiters and hiring managers, we'd love to hear from you! YOUR MISSION As a Talent Coordinator at Leadtech, you will: Organize and manage interview schedules for candidates, ensuring timely communication and smooth logistics between candidates and interviewers Keep candidates informed throughout the recruitment process, providing timely updates on next steps and interview feedback Maintain and update candidate information in the Applicant Tracking System (ATS), ensuring that all records are accurate and up to date Assist in managing internal recruitment processes by supporting the administrative management of applications and maintaining continuous communication with employees interested in the processes, helping to ensure fluidity and satisfaction Assist in the preparation of job offers, ensuring all relevant documents are accurate and completed in a timely manner Support the collection and organization of required documentation from candidates, including references, identification, and other necessary paperwork Coordinate with the Payroll team to ensure that new hires are properly onboarded and all payroll-related tasks are completed Act as a point of contact with recruitment vendors, external agencies, and partner companies supporting the recruitment process. Ensure smooth communication and alignment with external partners to enhance recruitment efforts Requirements WHAT WILL MAKE YOU STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD We're looking for someone with a balance of hard and soft skills who can thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment. Here's what we'd love to see: Previous experience in a Talent Coordinator, HR Assistant, or similar administrative role Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities Excellent written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail Familiarity with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and HR software Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment Proficiency in office software (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Suite) and other communication tools Strong problem-solving skills and ability to adapt in a fast-paced environment Experience in managing relationships with external vendors and recruitment agencies is a plus Strong attention to detail Proficiency in English Benefits WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US? Growth and career development At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities Work-Life balance Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer! Comprehensive benefits Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services) 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options—no blackout days! Unique Perks If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it coplete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences Equal Employment Opportunity Employer: Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project! Location You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you. If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions. The personal data you provide will be processed in order to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by writing to our address (Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta. Barcelona. 08005) or to the email address protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, attaching to your request a document that can validate your identity. Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressión and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

title: Digital Insurance Project Manager - Spanish Speaker (Fully Remote)
description: About the job Top 3 Reasons To Join Us Competitive Salary 100% Remote Working on the latest tech for the Insurtech Market Leader About Us At CoverGo, our mission is to empower all insurance companies to make insurance 100% digital and accessible to everyone. We are a leading global no-code insurance platform for health, life, and P&C We're the winner of the Insurtech of the Year in all of Asia and other awards globally We work with insurance enterprise clients such as AXA, Bupa, MSIG, Dai-ichi, Bank of China Group Insurance, and many more We're an international, diverse team of over 120 people with 30 nationalities and team members working remotely from all over the world We are fully funded and backed by reputable VC funds and strategic institutional investors We have a global presence in Asia, EMEA and the Americas We've grown our annualized revenue by over 30x since January 2021 We're constantly working towards making CoverGo a workplace that you love coming to. We deeply believe that bringing together a diversity of thoughts, expressions, and perspectives is key to building the best culture for equally diverse communities all over the world and a workplace that you love coming to. We deeply believe that bringing together a diversity of thoughts, expressions, and perspectives is key to building the best culture for equally diverse communities all over the world About The Role As a Digital Insurance Project Manager, your core responsibility will be to oversee and manage the implementation of new and/or existing projects within CoverGo's operations. This role presents an exciting opportunity for an individual with a strong drive to lead transformative projects in the insurtech industry. What You Will Do Engage and manage relationships with clients and stakeholders Lead project planning sessions with the internal team and client's staff Support solution proposals for client pursuits, proposals, and PoCs Participate in proposal and POC processes (i.e. design, submission, and review) Support the creation of contracts and related communication with clients Identify and help secure growth opportunities for existing clients Manage project progress and adapt work as required Ensure projects meet deadlines Manage relationships with clients and stakeholders Host regular/weekly project review and create reports with key metrics about team and project status using company standard metrics Oversee all incoming and outgoing project documentation Identify and manage issues, risks, assumptions, and dependencies Continuously optimize and improve processes and the overall approach where necessary What We Need Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related technical field is a plus 5+ years experience as a Project Manager Insurance domain knowledge is a must Strong client facing experience is a must Technical skills are a plus Has experience seeing projects through the full life cycle Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving skills Strong interpersonal skills and extremely resourceful Proven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timeline Self-motivated and able to work independently Able, willing, and excited to work in a fast-paced collaborative startup environment Must be able to speak in Spanish fluently Why You'll Love Working Here Fully Remote Flexible Leave International Environment Competitive renumeration package Performance Bonus Company activities and events Learning and development plan Remote work allowance CoverGo Company Video By submitting your application, you confirm that you have read, understood, and accepted the content of CoverGo's Privacy Notice and you consent to the processing of your data as part of this application.

title: Project Manager (Construction, Renewable Energy)
description: About the job We are looking for a project manager based in Spain for management construction of our renewable energy projects across Europe. This position is part of company acting as IPP (independent power producer). Responsibilities: Acting as main leader for project from the project’ Owner position (an IPP), synchronizing all stakeholders to successful implementation. Overseeing construction phase of the project, ensuring alignment with the company’s objectives and compliance with contractual obligations. Leading internal and external work interfaces including: contractors, global equipment suppliers, service providers, owner’s engineer, legal teams, development teams, local and ministerial authorities, financial institutions, and more. Follow-up and maintenance of project schedule, budgets and cashflow, and identifying improvement possibilities for each Analysing key milestones and understanding risks and contractual exposures, elaborating risk mitigation plan and to developing proactive solutions. Requirements: At least 5 years of previous experience in construction project management – a must, 10 years- a significant advantage. Bachelor’s degree in electrical / civil / mechanical engineering or other relevant fields – a must. High level of proficiency in all Office applications including Excel – a must Fluent Spanish and English – a must. Location in Spain- a must. Previous experience in the field of renewable energy – a significant advantage Experience in working in Owner/Developer position- a significant advantage The upcoming project in the portfolio is located in Castilla-La Mancha, Spain, and as the role requires frequent site visits, candidates that are within reasonable driving distance or be willing to relocate to the project's proximity are preferred. Ability to work either as a direct hire or as a freelancer (invoice-based), depending on candidate preference. Personal skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Excellent self-management skills, task prioritization and multiple interface management in parallel Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Flexibility and adaptability for changes, priorities, and conditions Strong self-education skills Strong problem-solving abilities and Strategic proactive approach Technical orientation with outstanding ability to look at the bigger picture Technical proficiency and the ability to understand and oversee complex engineering and construction processes.

title: Strategy & Operations Analyst - Becario/a (Valencia)
description: About the job Descriptif du poste Sobre La Empresa ¿Quieres vivir en Valencia y deseas trabajar en francés y español para una empresa de la transición energética? Hello Watt es la plataforma de referencia para reducir la factura de energía y su impacto en el planeta. En Toda Francia, Europa, Hello Watt Permite a Los Particulares Recuperar El Control De Su Consumo De Energía a Través De Su App, Descargada Más De Un Millón De Veces, y De Elegir un proveedor de energía más verde y económico. Aislar su hogar y reemplazar su caldera de gas o fuel por una bomba de calor. Instalar paneles solares para convertirse en su propio productor de energía renovable. Hello Watt es, sobre todo, un gran equipo de más de 200 personas, centrado en la satisfacción de sus clientes, y decidido a acelerar la transición energética en Francia y Europa. Hello Watt acelera la transición energética haciéndola más simple, más eficiente y más accesible. Descripción Del Puesto Trabajarás en los siguientes proyectos: Estrategia y desarrollo empresarial Análisis y seguimiento de la rentabilidad del negocio español: seguimiento de los principales KPIs, control de la evolución de las ventas (calidad, volumen, productos, precios, etc.). Implicación en la expansión internacional, gestión del negocio y coordinación con Operaciones. Implicación en la gestión de las relaciones con los socios: gestión de la cartera de socios clave de Hello Watt España, gestión de las relaciones diarias y estratégicas, discusión de términos y condiciones comerciales y presupuestos asociados. Seguimiento de las noticias del mercado, inteligencia estratégica e intercambio de conocimiento interno. Dependiendo de las necesidades de Hello Watt y de tus preferencias, ¡también se te puede pedir que trabajes en otros proyectos de alto nivel! Profil recherché Excelente capacidad analítica, buen dominio de Excel Capacidad para aprender muy rápidamente Iniciativa, entusiasmo y capacidad de propuesta Autónomo/a y orientado/a a resultados Tener un conocimiento del sector de la energía y la renovación es una gran ventaja. Idiomas : español y inglés avanzados/bilingue (nativo/C2), el francés es una ventaja Nuestros Valores Impact more: ayudamos a las personas a realizar la transición energética y utilizamos la tecnología para ayudarles a controlar su consumo. Apuntamos alto para maximizar este impacto. User focused: escuchamos a nuestros clientes y nos esforzamos por sorprenderles con la calidad de nuestros servicios y productos. One caring team: velamos por el bienestar y el desarrollo de cada individuo, basando nuestras relaciones en la humildad y la honestidad. Déroulement des entretiens Primer contacto con nuestra encargada de RRHH Realización de un caso práctico Entrevista en nuestra oficina con nuestro Country Launcher Entrevista con nuestro Director de Finanzas Información práctica Fecha de inicio: Julio 2025 Tipo de contrato: Prácticas con convenio Tipo de empleo: tiempo completo Duración: 6 meses Remuneración: 800€ mensuales Lugar: Passeig Ruzafa Qui sont-ils ? Hello Watt est le spécialiste de la transition énergétique des logements. Partout En France, Hello Watt Permet Aux Particuliers De Réduire Leur Facture D’énergie Et Leur Impact Sur La Planète 🌍, En Reprenant Le Contrôle De Leur Consommation D’énergie Via L’app Hello Watt, Téléchargée Plus D’un Million De Fois, Et De Choisir un fournisseur d’énergie plus vert et moins cher ; Isoler son logement et de remplacer sa chaudière gaz ou fioul par une pompe à chaleur ; Installer des panneaux solaires pour devenir son propre producteur d’énergie renouvelable. Hello Watt, c’est surtout une belle équipe de plus de 200 personnes, centrée sur la satisfaction de ses clients, et déterminée à accélérer la transition énergétique en France et en Europe ! Hello Watt accélère la transition énergétique en la rendant plus simple, plus intelligente et plus accessible.

title: Project Procurement Specialist
description: About the job Fundada en 2003, Prosolia Energy es un grupo empresarial líder en el sector de las energías renovables, con operaciones en los mercados de España, Portugal, Italia, Francia y Alemania a través de nuestras filiales. Prosolia Energy un productor de energía independiente (Independent Power Producer – IPP) especializado en ofrecer servicios de descarbonización a nuestros clientes. Controlamos toda la cadena de valor de los proyectos a través de los cuales proveemos de energía a nuestros clientes, desarrollo, construcción, operación y mantenimiento de un abanico de fuentes de generación y almacenamiento renovables. Estamos comprometidos a liderar la transición del sector industrial y productivo hacia un modelo descarbonizado, sostenible y competitivo, con una visión de producción energética descentralizada. Nuestros objetivos estratégicos para los próximos años incluyen la expansión a nuevos mercados y la innovación en soluciones energéticas, como el almacenamiento energético, aprovechando nuestras ventajas competitivas. Prosolia Energy dispone hoy de un portafolio de proyectos que supera los 4 GW en Europa. Para afrontar la construcción y desarrollo de este portafolio, así como la consecución de sus objetivos estratégicos, estamos en la búsqueda de profesionales con talento y alto potencial que deseen unirse a nuestro equipo y contribuir a nuestro éxito continuo. Buscamos ampliar el equipo con un/a Project Procurement Specialist cuya misión será el aprovisionamiento de servicios y productos en tiempo y forma. Entre tus responsabilidades estarán la gestión y control de SAP y asegurar la correcta información para las auditorias, así como obtener las mejores condiciones en cualquier adquisición que haga el grupo. Funciones / Áreas de responsabilidad Gestión de Compras: - Adquisición de materiales y equipos esenciales para proyectos fotovoltaicos o de otras tecnologías de energías renovables, tales como transformadores de potencia y auxiliares, cuadros eléctricos, inversores, estructuras, trackers, material eléctrico y otros componentes necesarios para garantizar la competitividad y la calidad y eficiencia de las instalaciones: - Identificación de nuevos proveedores de productos y servicios. - Realizar licitaciones, elaborar RFQ, negociar precios y condiciones contractuales. - Mantener actualizada la base de datos de proveedores y subcontratistas. - Aumentar o disminuir en pool de proveedores homologados, siguiendo los criterios de la compañía. - Homologación y evaluación de proveedores. Control de Información en SAP: Gestionar las compras en el ERP de la compañía (SAP) y garantizar que toda la información relacionada con las compras cumple con las directrices de la empresa. Colaboración en Reuniones de Adjudicación: Participar activamente en las reuniones de adjudicación de proyectos importantes, trabajando en conjunto con los responsables de cada proyecto. Coordinación de Pagos: Colaborar con el departamento de administración para gestionar todos los pagos relacionados con las compras que estén bajo su responsabilidad, asegurando que se realicen de manera puntual y eficiente. REQUISITOS Estudios requeridos: Idealmente estudios de Ingeniería o afines a la posición Formación Complementaria para el puesto: Inglés Alto, SAP Experiencia Requerida Mínimo 5 años en un puesto similar Competencias requeridas: - MS Office 365 - MS Teams -SAP QUÉ OFRECEMOS Empresa internacional y en expansión Oficina en el centro de la ciudad Flexibilidad horaria Trabajo Hibrido

title: Pricing Analyst
description: About the job The Opportunity Avantor is seeking a detail-oriented and self-motivated individual to join our team as a Customer Pricing Analyst. In this role, you will serve as a business partner to the Sale Organization to drive pricing strategies that deliver growth, profitability and support our customer's needs. The ideal candidate for this role is someone with an equal balance of pricing knowledge, analytical, and interpersonal skills. Process improvement is a big part of our culture and, as such, having transformational project experience would be a plus. MAJOR JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (List in order of importance) Analyzes, evaluates, and implements pricing to improve profitability and growth. Supports implementation and compliance with customer contracts related to pricing. Provides support and makes recommendations to assigned sales managers and sales representatives in regards to contracts, pricing and reporting. Performs price analysis to craft and recommend price strategies in RFP / Tender opportunities. Supports the internal and external compliance activities, specifically with monitoring and auditing routine price changes, uniform pricing requirements and other key terms and conditions as required. Evaluates and implements updates to contracts based on corporate driven changes and initiatives (price change from supplier, fx). Support process improvement / transformation projects as assigned. Performs other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS (Education/Training, Experience And Certifications) Bachelor degree preferred 3-5 years pricing, contracts, finance, or related experience Prior Pricing Project / Transformation Experience Strongly Preferred. KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES (Those necessary to perform the job competently) Ability to be a project leader/self-starter. Able to prioritize tasks to meet deadlines. Advanced Excel and data manipulation. Good knowledge of SAP. Desired knowledge of Qlikview/Qliksense and PriceFx or similar tools. Be able to work independently and be a contributing team player Good interpersonal skills. Good problem solver. Strong Math and Analytical skills. Strong attention to detail. Strong communication skills – both written and verbal. Strong Organizational & Time Management skills. ENVIRONMENTAL WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL EFFORT (Under Typical Positions) Typically works in an office environment with adequate lighting and ventilation and a normal range of temperature and noise level. Work assignments are diversified. Examples of past precedent are used to resolve work problems. New alternatives may be developed to resolve problems. A frequent volume of work and deadlines impose strain on routine basis. Some Travel required. Minimal physical effort is required. Work is mostly sedentary but does require walking, standing, bending, reaching, lifting or carrying objects that typically weigh less than 10 lbs. Ready for a challenge? Apply today! Disclaimer The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Avantor is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Why Avantor? Dare to go further in your career. Join our global team of 14,000+ associates whose passion for discovery and determination to overcome challenges relentlessly advances life-changing science. The work we do changes people's lives for the better. It brings new patient treatments and therapies to market, giving a cancer survivor the chance to walk his daughter down the aisle. It enables medical devices that help a little boy hear his mom's voice for the first time. Outcomes such as these create unlimited opportunities for you to contribute your talents, learn new skills and grow your career at Avantor. We are committed to helping you on this journey through our diverse, equitable and inclusive culture which includes learning experiences to support your career growth and success. At Avantor, dare to go further and see how the impact of your contributions set science in motion to create a better world. Apply today! EEO Statement We are an Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor. We do not discriminate in hiring on the basis of sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state/province, or local law. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us by email at recruiting@avantorsciences.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Requests for accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Privacy Policy We will use the personal information that you have submitted to us in order to consider your application for the relevant role. Your privacy is important to us. Please click here for our Privacy Policy which explains the purposes for which we will use your personal information and the ways in which we will handle and retain your information. It also explains the rights you have in relation to your information, and how to contact us with any queries or requests. 3rd Party Non-Solicitation Policy By submitting candidates without having been formally assigned on and contracted for a specific job requisition by Avantor, or by failing to comply with the Avantor recruitment process, you forfeit any fee on the submitted candidates, regardless of your usual terms and conditions.
